Reviews.Title: “Small and perfect in every way ....nearly”
Reviews.Author: Lencher
Reviews.Content: A free unasked upgrade is always a bonus. Lovely room, bathroom with tv set in wall opposite the loo! And our own Turkish bath. Staff were always helpful. It didn't seem the 2 guys front of house ever slept as they were on duty in the evening, and appeared immediately when we came down at 5am. One con: our son was in 305, mentioned in another review because it's so small. But it was adequate as who spends time in a hotel room in Sultanahmet when there's so much to do and see all around. Yes, we'd go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, very nice ( small) rooms”
Reviews.Author: BobFromLA
Reviews.Content: You can't even IMAGINE a better location: right next to Hagia Sofya and the tram line. Well insulated, so I didn't hear the call to prayer, but if you want quiet ask for a room on the Hagia Sofya side rather than on the street and tram side. Service is top notch, breakfasts are all you'd want, and the wifi was always working. My room was very nice, well lit, beautiful bathroom, but small enough that there were no drawers at all. After one night I was moved to a larger room that was entirely satisfactory. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and cosy”
Reviews.Author: perry O
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a mini break in Istanbul recently and was very happy with our choice of hotel. The staff were very professional and eager to help you in anyway, Turkish hospitality is really something to be experienced. The room was lovely and spotless and the bathroom was really big. Buffet breakfast good with lots of options for meat eaters and veggies. Our room had sepctacular view of Hagia Sofia and all of the other attractions are a very short walk away. All round a great place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “5 * for location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Cassy G
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel â€“ the best points are the fantastic location and wonderful staff. It is walking distance to everything that most people want to see (Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque etc). In fact some rooms overlook the Aya Sophia.Our room did not overlook it but we had the most amazing hamam style bathroom- which was a lot of fun. The customer service is really great and the staff really make you feel at home. The hotel also a very homely and comfortable feel to it. The rooms and very clean and tastefully decorated, as are the communal areas. The bed was extremely comfy and I slept very well. It was my first time in Istanbul and I had a wonderful experience staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad719
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman's location is terrific. Up a cobbled, picturesque street with restuarants and little shops everywhere on the street, the hotel's techniccal back faces "tram street<' and an ancient cistern you can visit. The hotel is also a very short walk to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Hippodrome, Grand Bazzar, tram stops --- and a Starbucks. A big cup of coffee can be a thrill after drinking teensy Turkish cups. Morning breakfast, a huge buffet, is served in a glassed in terrace with precious views of Old Sultanhamet's rooftops. It's a lovely respite. The little bar wasn't as impressive and there is no to speak of, but I don''t use those faclities very much when available anyway. Better to be out seeing sites and mixing with people. When I had a problem getting free wireless from my room a helper was immediately dispatched to my room to get me on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to visit Instabul”
Reviews.Author: elenaweng
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just next to Aya Sophia, perfect location to visit istanbul, everything was within walking distance. The staff is really friendly and when you check in, they will explain all the main things you need to know about Istanbul, even before you ask. The room was okay, the bed was not confortable at all and a bit too noisy because you can hear any possible sound. Breakfast was nice, especially the honeycomb!! Last tip, just make sure you have comfortable shoes to walk around, since road are not well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been nicer”
Reviews.Author: LouiseW54
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial, and I can honestly they couldn't have been friendlier or more welcoming. We were automatically given a room upgrade, and the lady at the welcome sat us down with tea and Turkish delight and talked through exactly where we were and how to get to all the relevant places of interest. The location of the hotel is fantastic, right in the middle of all the sights by the second day we felt like we knew the area well. I can recommend the Mosaic restaurant which is just a short walk on the way to the Grand Bazaar. We enjoyed our stay immensely and would go back again tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Best Meal in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: Sasha L
Reviews.Content: While I was not staying in the hotel, I read about their Imperial Restaurant online. The ancient recipes were SO delicious, the wait staff was very kind and brought us free goodies, and it was the perfect last dinner to have in Istanbul! If you vacation here, it is a MUST DO to try some of these meals. After all, where else can you dine like the sultans??

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Barbro R
Reviews.Content: We were six people visiting Ottoman hotel one week and we had a wonderful time. Very helpful kind and friendly staff showing us great hospitality. We insist you have some of your dinners at the hotel, the cuisine is delicious! The location just near by Hagia Sofia is absolutely great. You can easily walk around the old town and just take the tram if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks For Location”
Reviews.Author: kingkong1400
Reviews.Content: Awesome location right in the midst of the old city and across from Hagia Sofia. The hotel has a very good atmosphere, all the staff we came across were lovely. They made our stay a memorable. We had a very comfortable room, it was spacious, very clean, good size bed and very comfortable for a hotel bed. Location of the hotel is outstanding, very close to all the sights, walking distance from Hagia Sofia ( as it's across the cobble stone street ) from the hotel, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are steps away. Well presented breakfast, large variety to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated quite and comfortable at Hagia Sophia”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel - next to Hagia Sophia. Elegant rooms at good price. Great staff - very helpful. Restaurant excellent with imaginative use of old recipes. Hard to imagine a better site for Sultanhamet visits. Quiet in a very busy district.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in the heart of the old town.”
Reviews.Author: adelaide4444
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with the location of the hotel, bang in the heart of the old town of Sultanahmet. All of the historical and touristic sites are walking distance away. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Place , Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazar, Spice Market etc... where ever you fancy to visit you don't have to walk far. There are two tram stops near the hotel , comes handy when you want to hop on the tram to visit the city center. Rooms are very comfortable, good size bed and very clean, be sure to get a room with a view of Hagia Sofia. Staff are very kind, helpful, friendly and polite, I would recommend this hotel to anyone has plans to visit Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel To Stay”
Reviews.Author: nold77
Reviews.Content: Pleased to say we enjoyed our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Location could not be any better, just a short walking distance to all the sites. Good size room with comfortable bed and spotless clean. All the staff were very charming, always willing to help you with any inquiry you might have with a smile on their face.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location and Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ana M
Reviews.Content: We could not be happier with our stay in Istanbul. Not only the city and the people are unbelievable friendly but the hotel we picked was awesome. When we first arrived to the hotel they greeted us with delicious orange/cherry juice and Turkish delights. The check-in process was fast and efficient, but above all it was friendly. The concierge was ready with a package of information and maps for us. The room was very nice. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were kind of hard. The good thing is: pillow menu! so, if you want a soft, feather or 'tempurpedic" pillow they have it for you. Next day we got upgraded (for a small extra fee) and our room had a "Hammam" style (Turkish bath) shower, our view was amazing and the room was very spacious and nicely decorated. All the rooms we stayed (because we came back after going to the Turkish coast) were clean, comfortable, perfect in temperature and nicely decorated. The Staff was great. They made a true difference in our stay at the Ottoman Hotel. There's 2 guys at the front desk that alternate days and shifts: Erhan Deger and Ozgur Gundogdu. They are both fantastic.They were always ready to help us with directions, suggestions and to teach us some helpful Turkish words. The hotel provides breakfast and I have to honestly say that their breakfast overall was delicious and had plenty of variety but their soups are the BEST I've ever had. I know it sounds strage: soup for breakfast? seriously... TRY it. There's a different kind every day and they are all amazing. You'll be hooked! The hotel is located right across from Hagia Sophia. Our next room (at the tail end of our trip) had a view of the church/mosque. There's nothing like going to bed and seeing the breathtaking building from there. It's an experience you can't compare. Seriously, if you go to Istanbul, don't even think about it: stay here. You will not be disappointed. We originally booked this hotel for the 1st part of our trip and intentionally did not book the 2nd half of our trip in Istanbul (after our return from the coast) to keep our options open. We ended up booking the whole trip at the Ottoman and we would definitely do it again. Stay here and say hi to Erhan and Ozgur from us!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation but.........”
Reviews.Author: Megfy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is alongside Haya Sofia, so is ideally situated to see the centre of the city and its magnificent sights. The tram stop is about 400m away and the hop-on tour buses stop about 300 m away. However, don't be influenced by the photos of rooms on the website if you've booked a standard room. Our first room, for one night, was barely able to hold the double bed and the bathroom was tiny. There was no view as it was at the bottom of an enclosed light well, barely 10 ft to the opposite wall and three floors down from reception - NO lift to help with luggage or if you have walking limitations. People with mobility problems should also note that the street up to the hotel is roughly cobbled throughout and would be difficult to negotiate in any sort of high heels. We were moved to a better room for the three remaining nights, but this was also quite small. It did have a view of the neighbouring buildings though. Our main disappointment again was the bathroom, which was the size of a normal British en-suite shower room. It was generally clean, but the shower cubicle was badly in need of a good scrubbing to remove the black mildew on the grouting. I will add photos to show this. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is satisfactory, although we have had better. There is a laptop in the bar for guests' use and you can print off boarding cards for your return flights, which is very handy. This is a good place to stay for a short visit to Istanbul to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “We could not of asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Gail B
Reviews.Content: First off I should like to say that I am extremely difficult to please as I was in charge of quality standards for a fleet of luxury vessels and I tend to be a little obsessed about standards. That said we cannot recommend highly enough the Ottoman Imperial Istanbul, from the moment we arrived (literally as we had an included transfer who was waiting for us on arrival) everything was perfect. The location is central to most of the major sites and is in between 2 tram stops so very easy to get anywhere else. Tip: we bought an akbil pass which you can recharge easily use on all methods of public transport including the ferries and funicular railways. Much easier than having pockets full of tokens, 6TL for the card then you recharge as needed but we had just one card for the both of us which is accepted and each trip is cheaper than the normal fare. The hotel is fabulous, the staff, from Mary the guest relations manager who greeted, us to Hakan our chamberman could not of done more to make our stay so perfect. Breakfast was excellent with a large choice of hot and cold dishes I particularly liked the fresh honeycomb. The staff in the breakfast room were helpful friendly and were happy to cook fried eggs to order if asked. We were lucky enough to be upgraded and had an incredible view of Hagia Sopia from our bedroom window. Also lovely little touches in the room like turkish delight when we arrived, the following day we returned in the evening to find a vase of flowers in our room and then on international woman's day a card with another flower, we felt very special throughout our entire stay. We would not hesitate to return to this hotel. We travel fairly regularly and this is the first time I have been impressed enough to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: VICKY P
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent international travellers and have been everywhere in the world. This is an excellent traditional four stars hotel. Our room was ellegant, clean and had a nice view. The staff is friendly and will do everything to please you. You can eat a great breakfast and dine at the restaurant inside the hotel. It faces the Haggia Sophia and is very close to the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and carpet wholesellers. The location is excellent and well served in transportation. At a walking distance, you can go to the tram station, if you want to visit other far spots. It is really worthy the money. The Otoman Imperial is simply classy. I would recommend this hotel to all travelers visiting Istanbul, Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 40by40
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a fantastic location--everything in the old city is walkable from this hotel. The tram stop is also close which makes getting around really easy. The room we stayed in was small with two twin-sized beds (which we requested) but it was clean and the bathroom was wonderful. We were on the tram side of the building and it was a bit noisy but not enough that I wouldn't stay here again. The breakfast was wonderful and our first night at the hotel we ate at the restaurant and enjoyed it. But perhaps the best part about staying here is the staff--everyone was kind and helpful. So much so that when we e-mailed the hotel to say that the airport in the city where we were arriving from was closed due to snow, they were kind enough to move our reservation back a day. They did this three times (once for each day that the airport was closed) and were gracious about it each time. It was frustrating to be stuck where we were but it was so comforting to know that once we got to Istanbul we'd have a place to stay. The staff knew who we were when we arrived and said they were happy that we had finally arrived and asked us if we were all right. So kind. I'd definitely stay here again especially since I found the price so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: AthensDeb
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The location couldn't be better, right next to Ag. Sophia. You can walk to all the major sights - the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar aren't that far and it's a nice stroll (even in the snow). All the staff are polite, helpful and everything one should expect but very often doesn't get in hotels. One of the bellhops even stopped us a bit away from the hotel and said hello, were we alright - and he was in regular clothes, off duty. The breakfast is an enormous buffet with a large selection of all kinds of food. We also had lunch one day and the meal was quite exceptional. The room had everything (and lots of hangers) including bathrobes. The shower is very good, lots of pressure and hot. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: almthen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an amazing location next to the Hagia Sofia, one of the most interesting hostorical places in Istanbul. It is a nice and clean place to stay, comfortable beds and quiet at night, and great breakfast. The hotel gave us good tips for both dining and shopping. The rooms are quite small and many have very little view, but you dont want to stay indoors for long in this excellent city anyway.

Reviews.Title: “So many small positives ...”
Reviews.Author: GJC10044
Reviews.Content: Realy enjoyable stay at this hotel. Excellent location for the 'Old City' sights, Very friendly and co-operative staff who would arrange anything you needed and offer advice as well. Hotel is small and not 'Western Style' but very well appointed, clen and actually rather fun to stay in. Free Wi-fi available in rooms which is helpful to plan trips and do research etc. Hotel restaurant was well priced and good quality - again with a Turkish rather than 'Western' flavour. We would certainly return again and happily recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hamam style bathroom not to be missed.”
Reviews.Author: swyatt68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my mums 80th birthday with my sisters and we were all very happy with the hotel and the service. We booked it due to its location so we could walk to all the main sites which was a huge advantage. All the staff were charming and so helpful and very happy to give us advice about where to go etc. This was great as we had no clue about anything in Istanbul and we were impressed with their English. The rooms are lovely, well decorated and spotless. My room had the most amazing hamam style bathroom which was a real treat and something I had never seen before. Buffet breakfast had loads of options andveggies well catered for. Highly recomended, you will be well looked after. Tip= If it's available ask for a room with a hamam style bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Altogether a great place to stay in the old town”
Reviews.Author: vaurbright
Reviews.Content: Really loved this boutique hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Booked for a romantic break and this was the perfect place, it is on a little street right in the heart of the old town and we had the most wonderful view of Aya Sofia from our room, I really coudn't believe how close it was. So glad we stayed here rather than at one of the big chain hotels, it has a lovely intimate atmosphere and has anthentic Turkish feel to it feel to it due to the decor. The staff were wonderful, so helpful and friendly. The hotel is a great base to explore the old town and many of the sites are within walking distance. Really comfy bed, large and well fitted out bathroom and good buffet style breakfast. Altogether a great place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: srwoods
Reviews.Content: This hotel is BEYOND fantastic! A friend and I stayed here fro three nights in mid December 2011, and we had the best experience! I chose this hotel for its location....and I was not disappointed. As many other reviewers had mentioned the location REALLY is the BEST regarding hotels in the area! It is literally central to EVERYTHING in the old town. There a many restaurants/ little shops/ and quaint historic narrow cobble stone neighborhoods right outside the doors of the hotel. We walked EVERYWHERE....even during December when it was cool/cold...but had the luxury of running back to the hotel to grab a bite to eat, freshen up, or the like between visiting the historical sights! The rooms are of differing size...ours was not huge...but was large enough for us to be comfortable in....and the bathroom was AMAZING!!!! It was almost the size of the room itself...and was filled with opulence and luxury! This is also a VERY safe neighborhood, and my friend and I walked alone , at night...all the time and felt very secure. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough for its location in the Old Town Area, great guest relations coordinator (who booked for us our trip to Ephesus one day before we wanted to go) and tickets to the Whirling Dervishes (which unfortunately we did not enjoy- but at no fault to the hotel :) )...and gave us maps and directions to EVERYTHING! Fantastic city....fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gram77
Reviews.Content: In every way we were very pleased with our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. From the minute we arrived until we checked out we were treated as we were part of the family. All staff spoke very well English, they were all friendly and helpful, especially the young lady who was at the guest relation desk ( so sorry just could not remember the name ) was so helpful, she recommended some excellent restaurants, places to visit, how to get around by public transport around Istanbul, a huge thank you to her. Location of the hotel is fantastic, your steps away from all the main attractions, Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel , Blue Mosque is two minutes away ( as you walk out the front door you can see it towards the right ) and the Topkapi Palace is around the back about five minute walk away. Rooms are very comfortable, has all the amenities you would need for your stay. Good spread for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: bas17
Reviews.Content: the ottoman imperial is a world class hotel. staff are very helpful and friendly, and the location unbeatable being just opposite the aya sophia. as we were staying during the winter low season, we managed to get a low rate and upgraded room - and this room was amazing with great views and a jacuzzi. breakfast had a wide variety. Overall this is a fantastic hotel, especially if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, warm atmosphere, ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: jon60for
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial has all the qualities to be one of the top hotel in Istanbul. Ideal location, across the cobble stone street from Hagia Sofia and a short distance away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and variety of restaurants and cafes . Very friendly, warm and helpful staff. Good standard of decor in the rooms and in the building. Rooms are bright, airy, comfortable and very clean. This hotel is worth the stay while visiting Istanbul, it's also good value.

Reviews.Title: “Away from home, but felt like at home”
Reviews.Author: madoxyear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and a short walk to all the main attractions of Sultanhamet, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace and the Blue Mosque.Close to the tram line if you wanted to visit attractions outside of the Sultanahmet area and it's near by large selection of restaurants. The room was a reasonable size,clean and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Dream location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: chilly1122
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better location. All the attractions we had in mind to visit were a short walk away, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque as well as the famous Grand Bazar. Rooms are well portioned, good size bed , comfortable and clean. Staff look after you very well, always willing to help out with any inquries you might have, they also have some good suggestions when it comes to where to go and how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be any happier with our stay”
Reviews.Author: mikezz657
Reviews.Content: Everyone at Ottoman Hotel Imperial made our stay so enjoyable we could not be any happier. First the location of this lovely hotel is spot on , it is across from Aya Sofia and you can walk there in seconds, in fact we walked to all the other main attraction in the beautiful historic district of Istanbul. Ottoman Hotel Imperial has a great atmosphere which you feel as soon as you arrive. It's nicely decorated and all of the staff were wonderful, so helpful and friendly and more than happy to go the extra mile for you. The rooms are in good size ( at least our's was ) has everything you need, very comfortable bed, good siaze bathroom and everything is spotlessly clean. Good buffet beakfast with loads of selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: hushcentral
Reviews.Content: My partner and I absolutely enjoyed staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial and the wonderful hospitality shown towards us. The staff were just charming, helpful and friendly. It is has a great location, in the centre of the old town, very short walk to all the main sights and close to many restaurants and cafes. It is also close to a tram stop if you want to travel to other areas of the city. The rooms are nicely decorated with flare, very comfortable and clean, bathroom was large and well equipped. The breakfast buffet was lovely offering a wide range of options.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: marissaongo
Reviews.Content: My first business trip happened to be in Istanbul, booked Ottoman Hotel Imperial based on positive reviews on this site also it's close to all the major attractions I thought I would have a chance to visit before I returned back but unfortunately time ran out. It's a wonderful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff, stayed for two nights , all positive, rooms are well prepared, good size bed, comfortable, clean, good wifi in the room. Good selection for breakfast. Would stay here again one day when I return back for a proper visit.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lundelunde
Reviews.Content: My friend and I absolutely loved this place and its wonderful Turkish hospitality. The staff were just amazing - charming, helpful and friendly. It is in a fab location in the centre of the old town. It is a very short walk to all the main sights and close to a plethora of restaurants and cafes. It is also close to a tram stop if you want to travel to other areas of the city. The rooms are nicely decorated with an ethnic flare, very comfortable and clean and our bathroom was large and well equipped. The breakfast buffet was lovely offering a wide range of options. We ate so much that it kept us going all day. A really special hotel, we couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Staff”
Reviews.Author: sanchez8478
Reviews.Content: I was so happy with all aspects of this really charming boutique hotel but what really made it stand out was the staff. They are wonderful, so helpful and friendly and really added to the enjoyment of our stay, well done Handan and mehmet. We received excellent service from everyone. The rooms are lovely, decor is elegant and modern with a good touch of Turkish style.The bathroom was large, clean and well fitted out. Very comfortable bed. Perfect location, minutes from all the sites of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: idrisquad
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a few reasons: 1.Top location- stones throw from all tourist sites. 2.Amazing staff. 3.Comfortable clean and nicely decorated rooms. 4. Luxury bathroom. There is also a fabulous terrace, too cold for us to eat there but would be beautiful in the spring/summer. Strongly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: goodman62
Reviews.Content: A terrific hotel slap bang in the middle of the historic district. I was really happy that it is so close to all the things I wanted to see, Hagia Sofia is on the doorstep and I had a great view from my room. Nicely decorated rooms and very warm, I slept wonderfully. Good bathroom and very clean, nice robe and slippers provided. Superb staff, friendly and attentive and they really made you feel at home. A professionally run hotel, all in all a first rate experience, would have no hesitation in recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: pokerface4011
Reviews.Content: Throughly enjoyed our stay - what really sets this place apart is the perfect location. It was amazing to see the Hagia Sofia from our room which was about 100 yards away and all the other top attractions are a very short walk away. Everyone were very friendly, from the people that were working the front desk, Ozgur and Erhan to the restaurant service staff Eren, all were very helpful as well. Great rooms, in good size, comfy bed and a lovely bathroom, good breakfast, all you can ask for. Strongly recommended. Thank you for making our visit to Istanbul an experience we will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Very hospitable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandy699
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely visit, staff were so hospitable and the place has a great atmosphere. So glad we booked here so much nocer than some of the other hotels we have stayed in before. Good diverse breakfast, nice clean and warm room and spacious modern bathroom. Perfect location, outstanding service, a high quality establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tukutak
Reviews.Content: After reviewing so many hotel site trying to find the right hotel for us that's close to all the sites we had in mind to visit we finally decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial. From the moment we arrived and checked in we were greeted like family, we knew than we had made the right desicion. First of all the location of the hotel is superb,walking distance to all the sites we had in mind to visit as Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque and of course Hagia Sofia which is located across the street. Staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. Good size room with comfortable bed and clean. Good size bathroom with bath tub and shower , has all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay”
Reviews.Author: minter_blue
Reviews.Content: We were only in Istanbul for couple nights, therefore not much time to explore this beautiful city, we'll be back again to have a proper visit and when we do we'll be staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial once again as we were very happy with the service received. can't beat the location, near to all the historical sites, comfortable and clean room, outstanding service provided by the staff , big thanks goes to Handan the Guest Relation person as well as to Erhan and Mehemet. Hope to see everyone soon.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home.”
Reviews.Author: rachel_waters11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days last year for our anniversary and loved it. A little jewel in Sultanamhet. Would really recommend staying here in the heart of the wonderful historic district, perfect for a romantic trip. You could not get any closer to Hagia Sofia if you tried! The rooms are well appointed with pretty decor and the bed is very comfortable. Nice slippers and bathrobes make you feel right at home. The bathroom was large, modern and had high quality fittings. The hospitality was impressive, the staff are so helpful and go out of their way to make sure your stay is comfortable. We would definitely stay here again if we go back to Istanbul. It is a charming boutique hotel and really added to the overall experience of our stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: martinmare
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is wonderful, the location could not be any better, right in the heart of Sultanahmet and the staff made it a tryly special experience. They go out of their way to assist you and are so pleasent. The room was nicely decorated in a very tasteful Ottoman style and very comfortable. The bed was in good double size with good mattress and I slept very well. The bathroom also very nice and everything was very clean. I was happy with the breakfast, there was a wide range of options and served in a very pleasent room. Would highly recommend this charming little gem to anyone, would be hard to find a better located and more friendly place for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Location”
Reviews.Author: boz1690
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum and sister for a mini break and we were all delighted with the place. It is an intimate friendly hotel and staff were really polite and more than happy to give us helpful advice about istanbul , restaurants etc... It was so refreshing to stay somewhere with an Ottoman theme . feel. We really felt like we were in Turkey and my mum was particularly taken with the size of the bathroom, very spacious. The rooms are very well decorated and clean with comfortable beds. The room I was in had a large bathroom with a nice size bath tub and a stunning view of Aya Sofia. We all enjoyed the breakfast , there was a big choice. The location of the hotel is superb, it is within walking distance of all the main attractions, it is a real bonus to be able to go out for a nice meal and few drinks and just amble back to the hotel at any time of the night. All in all a really wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jdewar
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. The staff were helpful and friendly. The room was on an upper floor and was quite comfortable. There was no English TV but the location was what set this hotel apart from others. Literally a minute or two walk from the main tourist attractions. In particular we enjoyed the breakfast which has evertything you could have asked for. Fresh fruit, yoghurt, pastries, eggs, cold meats and cheeses and turkish sweets. Great coffee to set you up for the day's touring!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: lizzybee45
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this wonderful hotel in November 2011, we like to thank everyone from the hotel managment to the staff for making our stay such an enjoyable . Everyone were so kind and friendly. Ottoman Hotel Imperial has the best location, next to Aya Sofia and a very short walk to the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Rooms are nicely decorated, spacious, large bathroom with bath and shower, slippers and robe, everything you need for your stay, nice large LCD tv. Good choice of food for breakfast, both hot and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and service”
Reviews.Author: parlamp33
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a very professional, friendly and helpful staff. Top class in every detail. Delicious breakfast. Ottoman Hotel Imperial is very close to all the sights, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofoa museum are walking distance away. Rooms are bright, comfortable, nicely decorated and cleaned everyday. Sultanahmet area is very lively with many restaurants and shops. On our second day in Istanbul we explored the city outside of the toristic area, it was wonderful. Istanbul is a beautiful city, we'll recommend the hotel and the city to all our friends .

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ball77
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was an excellent choice. All staff were very helpful and friendly and polite at all times. Our room was always cleaned and had everything I needed when requested. Breakfast was delicious. The hotel location is perfect, all the historical sites along with banks, post office, stores and restaurants are all around the corner from the hotel. based on this visit, I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there when I return to Istanbul again, there are so many things to see and do, we only had few days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city, lovely hotel, well looked after.”
Reviews.Author: swazy_22
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a lovely hotel to stay in and Istanbul is a beautiful city to visit, very interesting with loads of history and culture. Hotel is located in the top stop of the Sultanahmet Square area, directly across from Hagia Sofia and a short walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace.Grand Bazar is a comfortable 10-15 minute walk, it's a nice walk, you can also make us of the publick transportation as a tram to make your way there, two tram stops are located near the hotel. Well decorated and furnished rooms , spacious and bright with comfortable beds. Breakfast buffet which offers many variety of food both hot and cold. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Farnaz F
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Istanbul today morning. I really enjoyed my time over there. The Ottoman Imperial Hotel was great. The location was excellent. It was close to many historical places. the staff were super friendly and helpful especially Mr. RÃ¼stem. The quality of the breakfast was very good. I truly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for the price, good value”
Reviews.Author: jker99
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial offeres the perfect location for anyone interested in exploring the old city and don't want to walk to far. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The rooms are fine, no mansion but it will do, comfortable and clean, beautufuly decorated. The bathroom was luxurious. My partner and I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitality, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: happyday1290
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, friendly, helpful staff and absolutely has the best location in the Sultanahmet area. Hotel front door opens to the outer wall + garden of the Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace is about half block to the left and the Blue Mosque is about half block to the right and the Basilica Cistern just on the other side of the hotel. Hotel is located between two tramway stop, There are numerous restaurants around the Sultanahmet area, all serving tasty Turkish cuisine as well as your usual fast food restaurants. Rooms are in good shape and size, our room was nothing large but it was more than enough with a very comfortable double size bed.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect”
Reviews.Author: JJCubs
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel allowing a lot to be packed in a short period of time this is the place. The hotel is situated right next to the Hagia Sophia and is minutes (to be counted on hands!) from most of the attractions that makes this area so fabulous. The staff were fabulous and the attention to detail excellent. Rooms were clean and tasteful. One slight concern was tv noise from the room next door and piped music from the outdoor bar could just be made out in our room. Don't let this put you off a stay here. One useful thing to know is that only private taxis can drop you right outside. Public taxi ranks will drop you off about 5 minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal location”
Reviews.Author: angelbow1922
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent, most of the interesting historiacl sights are within walking distance, as Hagia Sofia ( next to the hotel ), Blue Mosque , Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, the Grand Bazar as well as the Spice Market. The hotel staff were very polite, helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean, good size and comfortable. Breakfast buffet, which was included in the rate has good choice of food available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Short Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cellbabe33
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the quality of the hotel and it's location. Prefect for a short city break, all major sites are walking distance means don't have to run around trying to get to the sites before closing, take your time, even if you're only visiting for a weekend like we were. Rooms are in good shape and size, the more costly rooms are in better position, but they are all comfortable and clean. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Good choice of food available for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: alexandra b
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpfull staff. The hotel is situated in nice area. close walking distance to many activities. Rooms are comforable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Try it, you'll love it”
Reviews.Author: happygo90
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial during Christmas period after one of our friends who visited istanbul in the past and recommended the hotel to us and we were not disappointed. Well run hotel, close to all the sites we wanted to visit and do something different for Christmas this year. We had reserved the superior sultan room, it was spacious, bright, overlooking Hagia Sofia museum, comfortable bed, all the amenities we needed during our stay and very clean. We could see staff were well trained , they are very professional, kind, friendly and helpful. We would also recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul and want to stay close to all the historical sites but still not far away from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle Of History”
Reviews.Author: Cagatay G
Reviews.Content: Ä°t was really amazing. It is one of two places that you can eat Real Ottoman Food. Their menu was prepared according to the Ottoman Archives. Smiling and helpful emloyees. Clean rooms. Hagia Sophia and the Cistern only 2 min walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: carrieon69
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Sultanahmet, surrounded by main sites and you could hear the call to prayer in the morning from a distance which made it feel like an authentic stay. Staff very friendly and helpful, always around to help out with any inquiries or suggesting places to visit, how to get around by public transport while in Istanbul etc.. Good range on buffet for breakfast. Rooms are laid out nicely, fresh, bright, clean and the bed is very comfortable, we had a room overlooking the Hagia Sofia . You can't ask for an ideal location, all sites are a short walk away also there are two tram stops near the hotel, makes it handy if you wanted to visit areas outside of the old town. Overall we would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a boutique hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: cvbr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Turkey that started with 5 nights at the Ottoman Imperial. The location is fantastic on a quiet street behind the Hagia Sofia and a quick walk to the Topkapi Palace. We loved the breakfast buffet. Each of our three rooms was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms, were downright luxurious. I will say that the bathrooms had a funny smell, which we decided came from the water in Istanbul not anything to do with the hotel, because it was the same everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: eastcost55
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel. friendly , helpful satff and absolutely the most convenient location. The hotel front door opens to the outer wall of the Aya Sofia museum, Topkapi Palace is half a block to the left and the Blue Mosque is half a block yo the right.Numerous restaurants are within easy walking distance as well as the two tram stops. Rooms are bright, spacious, clean and comfortable. Good breakfast buffet, nice choice of both local and international flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for visiting the old town”
Reviews.Author: tanya56234
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial is an excellent choice as a base for exploring the historical sights of Istanbul.Location can not be any better, next door to Aya Sofia and couple of minute walk to the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi palace. The rooms are in good size, plenty of space, comfortable bed and very clean. Excellent staff, very friendly and helpful. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar location”
Reviews.Author: Lotus777
Reviews.Content: Like almost everyone has said here, the Ottoman Hotel Imperial has one of the best locations in Istanbul. it's in the heart of the main tourist area of Sultanahmet but yet tucked away in a quiet,shady area and once you reach the hotel doors and are safely ensconced in your room you will feel like an esteemed visitor to an Ottoman mansion. I took a Premium Vazir room and although it was for a single person the room was of a lovely size and had a nice,queen size bed. The room had two windows, one overlooked the courtyard of the Hague Sophia and the other overlooked the quiet cobblestoned alley of Caferiye Sokak. The room was quiet and so wonderful. At night I kept the windows open because I wanted to be lulled to sleep by the muezzin's call to prayer. The staff were friendly and ever willing to help. The two ladies at the front desk are exceptionally helpful and are full of good tips and advice to make your good trip an even better one.

Reviews.Title: “Best Possible Location”
Reviews.Author: Wardy44_11
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial has the best possible location in Istanbul for visiting the main sights and has easy access to the main International airport and rest of the city as there are two tram stops only a few minute walk from the hotel. The hotel itself is of a good standard, clean and offers a varied buffet at breakfast which makes for a great start to the day.I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great value in the best possible location in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman Experience”
Reviews.Author: girlblue33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay in the Sultanahmet area instead of Taksim Square ( city centre ), I would recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial to anyone who wants to be near all the historical attractions. The location is perfect, near the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Aya Sofia all within easy walking distance. The rooms ar in good size and clean. Good choice of selections for breakfast ( buffet style ).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.Good service.Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: morethanword80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for three nights after reading many positive reviews on trip advisor. Overall we would consider to be one of the better hotels we have stayed in and by far best in terms of location. The rooms are bright, spacious, clean very high standard. the furnishings were all tasteful and the shower/bathroom excellent. Hotel has a wonderful terrace for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfast was of a good quality with wide variety of food. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is located on a quite cobble street across from Hagia Sofia and close by to other major sights such as Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque etc. All the sights are literally a few minute walk. We would definately recommend this hotel, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: bartonvilla33
Reviews.Content: Very kind and helpful staff who were keen to help out in every possible way. The location of the hotel could not have been any better. Located on a side cobble stone street across from Hagia Sofia and a short walk away from Topkapi Place and the Blue Mosque, in the heart of the old city. Restaurant specialises in Ottoman cuisine dishes. Rooms are well decorated, well looked after and maintained, spacious and clean. There are two tram stops close to the hotel which means getting across Golden Horn bridge and to Taksim ( city center ) is easy. Buffet breakfast is wonderful served in the dining room with a nice views.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the atmosphere of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: sultan68_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for two nights during our visit to Turkey and this was our Istanbul leg. Very good hotel , ideal location for visiting all the important sights as all the attractions were so close by. Nicely decorated rooms, comfortable bed in good size, clean, homely feeling. All the staff were very helpful, nothing was much for them. We will surelly come back to visit Istanbul again and Ottoman hotel Imperial will be our base.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kaymar234
Reviews.Content: We loved Istanbul and Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Prefect location, across the street from Hagia Sofia and just a short walk to Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. We were treated like one of the family by all staff, they were very helpful with all inquiries we had, many good suggestions from the guest relation lady. The frond desk staff were friendly and responsive. Rooms were clean, bright, spacious and comfortable. Good choice hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable short break”
Reviews.Author: organize99
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial on our first visit to Istanbul and could not have been more pleased with the service received and the hotel staff. the location is absolutely perfect in the middle of Sultanahmet and walking distance to all the historical sights. The staff were very helpful and frienldy, professional and nicely presented. We took the popular day option tour of Bosphoruse and the istanbul by night, it was a good way to explore istanbul in a short time. Rooms are well presented, free wifi, amenities you would need during your stay it was clean and comfortable. We would recommend the Ottoman Hotel Imperial to any prospective visitors.

Reviews.Title: “The Only One in Istanbul For Us”
Reviews.Author: theone48
Reviews.Content: Now we know where to stay on our next visit to Istanbul. This is trully a beautiful hotel in everyway. First the location, how can you go wrong when all the major attractions are withing short distance walk away, the Blue Mosque, Topapi Palace, Hagia Sofia etc.. second , nicely decorated rooms, comfortable, large and very clean, we had the pleasure of staying in the room overlooking the Hagia Sofia and a bathrom in hamam style, excellent touch. Staff are outstanding, very kind and friendly, helped us out with good tips and recommendations. Good choice of food for breakfast from variety of cold cuts to cheese and olives, scramble egg and Turkish sausage. Witout a doubt I would recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, lovely staff, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: glory36
Reviews.Content: The Ottroman Hotelo Imperial met and exceeded our expectations in every way. We had a lovely room, bright, airy , spacious overlooking the Hagia Sofia. The location of the hotel is the very best, only a couple of minute walk to all the historical attractions as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cisters, Bosphoruse and tram ride to the Grand Bazar and the city center Taksim. The staff were very helpful in every way. The breakfast was served in a sunny room and had good variety of offering. This is really a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sweey hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: ciscoworld
Reviews.Content: The family stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial for two nights, we were very impressed with the serviced received and the way the hotel was managed. Every staff we came across were very helpful, friendly, kind and courteous. Rooms are spacious, comfortable bed, quite, clean , has all the amenities you need during your stay. Locayed nicely in the Sultanahmet area , close to all the main attractions, within minutes walking distance. On our next visit to istanbul we would definitely stay here again, we made some good friends.

Reviews.Title: “Memories that will last forever”
Reviews.Author: bridgeworld
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for a week and I can not praise this hotel enough. First of all it's perfectly located in the heart of the old city, all major historical attractions are within walking distance. Hagia Sofia which is located next to the hotel ( we stayed in a wonderful room overlooking the museum ), the Blue Mosque is two minutes away, Topkapi Palace is about five minutes away and the Underground Cistern is a minute away. everything is so close by, there are two tram stops near the hotel, which we used to visit Taksim ( city center ), we took the tram over the Galata Bridge, got off the stop at the ned of the bridge, took the Tunnel, the oldest underground system, to Beyoglu and walked up to Taksim Square. Rooms are wonderful, spacious and cleaned everyday, comfortable bed, large bathroom, large LCD tv, mini bar and they also provide slippers and bath robe, nicely decorated and kept up well. Outstanding staff, top class, wonderful, friendly always polite and kind very helpful. I would recommend the Ottoman Hotel Imperial to anyone that are planing to visit Istanbul, you will not be disappointed. Our thanks goes to everyone at the hotel for making our visit such a pleasant one which we will cherish forever.

Reviews.Title: “great location, unfortunate room”
Reviews.Author: dm125
Reviews.Content: Disappointing room in what looked like a cute hotel, certainly in a great location in the Sultanahmet area. This was booked on our behalf by a tour agency, although we were traveling alone. We had to have had the worst room in the hotel - I say this because all the other reviews raved about this place. It was listed as a four star, and based on this website, it looked like it was going to be a great choice. Wrong. Our room was so small, my husband could reach his arms out and touch both sides. The bath was small, old, bad fixtures. The bed and pillow really uncomfortable. I never thought to ask for a better room until it was too late. But I wonder, if better rooms were available, why didn't the staff automatically put us in one? The breakfast room was extremely warm, although the buffet was fine. I assume this had a four star rating only because of the location. The hotel seems more suitable for travelers who don't expect much from an accomodation; unfortunately we passed that point about twenty years ago. Lesson learned - I advise those of you who are planning to stay to contact the hotel ahead of time, ask what room is planned and upon checking in, ask to see the room first. If it is unacceptable, let the staff know. Needless to say, our stay at the Four Seasons Bosphorous a few days later was much more suitable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 411David
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a Premium Sultan Room overlooking the Aya Sophia. The room was clean, very well appointed, including a jacuzzi bath, and had a stunning view. The hotel could not be better located for the main tourist attractions, being no more than 10 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace and literally beside the Aya Sophia museum. And we walked comfortably to the Grand Bazaar (15 minutes), Spice Market (25 minutes) and to the Galata Bridge over the Golden Horn (30 minutes). Hotel staff were very helpful. The only let-down was breakfast, which included diluted orange juice, and a lack of choice. The quality of food otherwise was OK but if you didn't fancy a Turkish style breakfast there was little else on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in hystorical center.”
Reviews.Author: Nobile64
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located at 10 meter from the Santa Sofia catheal and at 100 meter from the Blu Mosche. Wery warm rooms , clean and whit all the necessarily. Just a little beat noisy for the continues group of turkey that are lodging in the hotel and they are not so respetfulli to the other guest. I was felling very. Ongortable since the first minute I come in. Restaurant with particar ottoman hystorical cusine, with revised plates and dishes from the book from the ottoman house where now there is the hotel. Good breakfast and goog private shuttle service to the Ataturk Airport(25 euro). I will definitely lodge again during my future stay in Istanbul. I am strongly suggesting it.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has the WOW factor”
Reviews.Author: goodyshow22
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel in every way, location is wonderful close to all the attractions we had in mind to visit, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace, Underground cistern, Grand Bazar and the Blue Mosque. Staff were very helpful and very friendly, the guest relation desk organized many out on the town days for us, recommended many great places to visit, outside of the usual touristic area . Rooms are very clean , size can vary, but they are all in good size and comfortable. Good choice of food on the breakfast buffet. Overall a great place to stay when visiting this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: concordeprincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this very nice little hotel. The staff is to be commended. They were always so pleasant and helpful in every way. The very lovely Handan Tuna who precides over the front and concierge desk could not have been nicer. The Matbah restaurant was suberb. The very nice manager, whose name unfortunately escapes me at present, has done wonderful research on Bystantine menus and has reproduced them for the restaurant. The hotel is very convenient to all the major sites. You could not ask for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, excellent service and delightful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Joepusan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent seven days at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial and were so satisfied with the location, attentive service and considerate staff. We loved the restaurant for a special Ottoman meal and ample breakfast choices. The staff went out of their way to please us and we would recommend it to anyone. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it, loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: murightway
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is located next to Hagia Sofia and generally close to all the historical sights of the old city. Rooms are beautiful , nicely decorated, good size room with comfortable bed. It has all the amenities and it's clean. The breakfast is rich. There is free wifi and it's pretty fast. If you happen to drive, the parking is free. What we liked the most besides the location was the staff, they were very friendly and helpful who made our stay memorable. Definitely I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to stay in the heart of the old city, Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see key sites”
Reviews.Author: terlen
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to be much closer to the Blue Mosque, Sophia, or Topkapi attractions. If taking a cab or other private transport be prepared for a "back alley" tour in reaching the hotel. We were not that impressed with the SHE company's water tour offered through the hotel; we saw more modern and comfortable looking watercraft at same departure point.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, good service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: uripoint
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial was recommended to us by a friend who stayed here previously and plans on staying here again on his return back. This hotel has a very friendly, helpful and courteous staff, beautifully presented, clean and comfortable rooms, properly sealed double glazed windows. This is a charming hotel in an excellent location , every attraction we had on list to visit was a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bruster9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for three nights after reading many positive reviews on trip advisor. Overall we would consider to be one of the better hotels we have stayed in and by far best in terms of location. The rooms are bright, spacious, clean very high standard. the furnishings were all tasteful and the shower/bathroom excellent. Hotel has a wonderful terrace for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfast was of a good quality with wide variety of food. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is located on a quite cobble street across from Hagia Sofia and close by to other major sights such as Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque etc. All the sights are literally a few minute walk. We would definately recommend this hotel, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Had the time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: bluegrass66
Reviews.Content: Organized a surprise short weekend getaway for my girlfriends birthday to Istanbul, I've chose ottoman Hotel Imperial from the tripadvisor site due to it's good reviews and location as we only had couple days to visit all the historical attractions I had in mind. Not one second were we dissapointed with my decision. First of all the location is perfect if you only have couple of days to visit, hotel is located bang in the middle of the historical area Sultanahmet, all the major sights like Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Place, basilica Cistern, Archaeology etc.. are within 2-3 minute walking distance away. Can't get any closer than that. All hotel staff were very helpful , friendly and kind. Rooms are in good size and shape, nicely decorated with comfortable bed and very clean. Good hotel to stay, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “We were well looked after”
Reviews.Author: ruizecloud
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were looked after like family. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, no request was to much for them. Top class efficient service. You can't aske for a better location. Every historical sight are located a short walk away, perfect location, right in the heart of the old city Sultanahmet. Rooms are very comfirtable, nice size double bed, very clean, well looked after. Breakfast and free wifi were included in our room rate. We were picked up from the airport ( organized the airport transfer prior to our arrival ) without any problems, right on time even thought our flight was delayed. Thank you to everyone at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial for making our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dmbchs65
Reviews.Content: Clean, neat hotel with breakfast included, free wifi and good A/C. Best feature is location! Front door faces outer wall of Hagia Sophia. From front door, Topkapi Palace entrance is 150 yards around the corner to the left. The Blue Mosque and Hippodrome is 200 yards to the right. Basilica Cistern is 150 yards behind. Gulhane tram stop is five minutes away. More good restaurants than you can count within 10 minutes walking in several different directions. Can't find a better location in Istanbul. And I forgot to say that the hotel staff bends over backwards trying to help their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely city to visit, wonderful hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: redfly77
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a wonderful hotel stay and Istanbul is a beautiful city to visit, loads of history and culture. Hotel is located directly in the neighbourhood of Aya Sofia and very short walking distance to the Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. It's an ideal base for sightseeing in the Sultanahmet area. Visiting Galata quarters is very simple as there are two tram stops located a short walk from the hotel. Well decorated and furnished rooms with comfortable beds, spacious, airy and bright. Very kind, friendly and helpful staff.Do not hesitate to stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial when you visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: harryrightway
Reviews.Content: We were looking for quite hotel near the historical centre in the Sultanahmet area. The hotel is next door to Agia sofia and a short walk to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Place. The staff are very welcoming and helpful. The airport transfers were spot on. We booked two rooms , one for us and the other for our kids, the rooms were well decorated and in good size. The bathrooms were good, especially the showers. Brekafast was adequate. Has a great restaurant located within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three beautiful days”
Reviews.Author: cupcake6900
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Istanbul and staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial very much. All sights we had in mind to visit were a short walk away from the hotel as Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, hagia Sofia, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazar, Spice Market etc... can't beat that. Rooms are in good shape in size with all the amenities you need for your stay as well as comfortable bed and very clean. Good choice of spread for breakfast. Everyone at the hotel we came across were very friendly and helpful. Good hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A truly memorable week”
Reviews.Author: Bill F
Reviews.Content: We spent a week with Ottoman on our first visit to Istanbul and could not have been more pleased with both the experience and the hotel and staff. Weather was not ideal, especially for our visit to Gallipoli, but we would not have missed it for worlds. The location is absolutely perfect, with our room directly overlooking the Hagia Sofia and virtually in the middle of the Sultanahmet. The staff were very friendly, very helpful, beautifully presented and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. Because of an overbooking they asked if we would relocate for our first night (to the Ottoman Park) and they upgraded us to a magnificent suite! We took the popular tour options of Bosporus cruise, Istanbul by night, Whirling Dervish ritual, Gallipoli, and did lots of exploring (and shopping, more than planned) on our own. Istanbul and its people combine to make it one of the best places we've experienced. We would absolutely recommend the Ottoman Hotel Imperial to any prospective visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Good short weekend break”
Reviews.Author: croft67
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul, decided to get away for a short weekend break. Some of our friends who had already visited Istanbul in the past and stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial recommended the hotel to us. Hotel is nicely located for visiting all the sights we had in mind, Underground Cistern and Hagia Sofia are next to the hotel and Topkapi Palace , the Blue Mosque are a short walk away. Grand Bazar although it can be walked in around 15-20 minutes we did use the tram to get there. Grand Bazar although it can be walked in 15 minutes we did use the tram to get there, two tram stops are located near the hotel. All the staff were fantastic, helped out with many great tips and suggestions, recommending greta places to visit in a short time. They were very kind and friendly. Rooms were comfortable, free wifi and very clean. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pinkonroad
Reviews.Content: Me and my boy friend booked Ottoman Imperial hotel for 4 days in Istanbul. I had read about it before we booked. The location of this hotel is just perfect. Very close to all major sight of Istanbul. There are many options to eat out side and a great ottoman cosine inside the hotel. Beautiful place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: penquin456
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the professional, friendly atmosphere from the moment we stepped inside, we felt very comfortable almost like at home. The staff are amazing, always ready to help out with the usefull advice. The rooms are in decent size, comfortable bed, nice and clean. All tourist spots are within walking diatance.The restaurant was very good. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and were never disappointed. We highly recommend ottoman Hotel Imperial,

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JPL2010
Reviews.Content: I don't think I have stayed in a better located hotel than the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Walk out the front door and you the Hagia Sophia is directly in front of you, while other Istanbul landmarks are only a short walk away. The hotel is easy to get to on public transport. The staff are very helpful and friendly, the breakfasts are good and dining on the terrace is recommended if the weather is good.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels i have ever stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tlseeker
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and cosy (but it wasn't very big). The staff was very friendly and very helpfull. The location is perfect: a walking distance of all major attractions. Free wifi and had one of the best restaurants in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Good service amazing location”
Reviews.Author: gonehome44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with one of our best friend prior to attending a wedding in Izmir. As this was our first time in Istanbul, thought we would explore Istanbul before heading out to Izmir, it's located on the agean cost. We could have not asked for a more cebtral location to the prime sites on everyone's must see list. The staff, especially the yound lady in the concierge office was very helpful. Made reservation for a fab dinner at the Matbah Ottoman Cuisine restaurant which we enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stomper0161 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istanbul. The hotel had been helpful right from the start. After booking through Octopus (Itself found through trivago) I contacted the hotel direct to ask about transfers from the airport. Emails were quickly and professionally handled, and an offer to book a private transfer was confirmed. On arrival at Istanbul we easily found our contact in the busy crowd and after just a short wait we were in a car on the way to the airport. I was a little surprised to have another couple in the car with us though! The hotel is in an excellent position, at the heart of the tourist area only a few steps from the main attractions/religious sites. Reception was very efficient, there is chilled apple tea free while you wait. We were shown to a large room overlooking the Hagia Sophia. Lots of nice extras: Robes, slippers, Turkish Delight, free bottled water. Rooms are air conditioned and have large modern TV's. Large bathrooms with really good quality complimentary toiletries. Breakfast is included and is served in the roof terrace. A bright open restaurant with views over the city. A good hot & cold selection with toast, juice and tea/coffee. I was very pleased with the quality for the rate paid and would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: heather d
Reviews.Content: 6 of us recently toured Turkey through Dos Plumas travel which was one of the best thing decisions ever. They suggested the Ottoman Imperial Hotel. We originally wanted a different hotel. So glad we took their advice. The hotel is literally right next to the Hagia Sophia. I thought that there'd be tons of traffic and noise because of this. Not so! The hotel is on the side of the Hagia Sophia and very quiet. It was positioned perfectly so that we could also walk to the Blue Mosque, the Basilica Cisterns, and the Hippodrome. It was also close to the public tram for longer jaunts. The interior was very nice, clean. The bathroom was modern, and they left a litle dish of Turkish delights on our bed every day. They have a restaurant which is one of the best in Istanbul featuring Ottoman cuisine. Our tour guide even had dinner there with a friend while we were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: icecoldluke
Reviews.Content: During our two week visit around Turkey, starting off in Istanbul we stayed the first and the last night of our trip at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Found this one to be good as some of the 5 star hotels we stayed with almost half the price, great value. The rooms which are nicely decorated are large as are the ensuites. Cleanliness of the room and the hotel are of high standard and the staff were very friendly and exceptionally helpful. The location of the hotel were it takes your breath away, right in the heart of the Sultanahmet district is ideal being so close to the all the historical and tourist sites and with a good selection of restaurants close by. Hote's garden restaurant is a great location to have a meal and the food was delicious. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Found our hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hiphopaway_38
Reviews.Content: After looking over so many hotel sites trying to find the right hotel in Istanbul , we finally decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial as it was close to all the historical sights we wanted to visit. When we arrived we relised we've made the right choice. Hotel is located in the perfect spot of Sultanahamet , walking distance to Hagia Sofia ( which is located right across ), Topkapi Palace, basilica Cistern, Grand Bazar etc.. even took a ferry ride to one of the islands . Everyone at the hotel were very friendly and helpful, no question was to much for them. Rooms are in good size, comfortable bed everything was spotless clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but this is it.”
Reviews.Author: Frik2009
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband choose that hotel because the pictures of the room on the tripadvisor, but ... when we got there, they gave us a room with no sunlight, with balcony facing to a wall and a very noisy room, because all of the AC units from the rooms around us were on our balcony's wall, all the room was shaking. With a tip you can always solve the problem in Turkey. My husband solved the problem in turkish way and they changed our room. This was the begining of our holiday to celebrate our 10th year of marriage. Very nice. The breakfast is always the same, with very minore diferences, the orange juice is the concentrate way. And this is it, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced. Underdelivered.”
Reviews.Author: F B
Reviews.Content: First the good. The location is idea. It is close to the Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace, and the Grand Bazar (skip the Bazar). It is also close to the trolley. The rooms are clean, quiet, and safe. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Now for the bad. The bathroom was tiny. Really tiny. My knees hit the wall while sitting on the toilet. The shower leaked like crazy, leaving a half-inch of standing water after every shower. I told the staff about this twice and though they were empathetic, they did nothing. The restaurant was mediocre and overpriced. The service in the restaurant was also mediocre. The coffee at breakfast is absolutely undrinkable. It tasted like instant coffee that had been sitting on a burner for two hours. All of this would still be OK if the price was 25% less. This is a decent stop for a couple of kids on a budget. Except that the prices are not budget at all. They really need to up their game if they want to deserve the money they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sonia5501
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial met and exceeded our expectations in all ways. Our room was lovely and full of filtered sunlight. We even watched a dance show from our window. The location is the very best and only a couple of minutes walk from the Hagia Sofia and the Topkape Palace. Staff were very helpful in all ways. The breakfast was served in a bright sunny room and had a good variety of offerings. This is really a boutique hotel. Loved it..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: howdy9566
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial has all the qualities required to be one of the top hotels in Istanbul. Perfect position, short walking diatance to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Spice Bazar, Grand Bazar etc... Friendly and helpful staff, high standard of decor in the rooms and around the building. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. By the way all sfatt spoke good English, suggested many places to visit in Istanbul and how to get there, outside of the usual tourisric area. Worth the stay. .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: exploringwoman
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable! Right next or few walking minutes max. to four of the major sights and easy access to other restaurants as well as a cute little Bazaar. Best choice when on a short weekend sightseeing trip. Staff lacks a bit in English skills [which is a common in Turkey] but they make up for it in attitude. They are really interested in making your stay as comfortable as possible. They are friendly, welcoming and helpful; able to make good recommendations. We booked a Vezir Premium room on the entrance side with view on Aya Sofia. Amazingly quiet considering the masses of tourists a few hundred metres away. We had full amenities in our premium room incl. bath robe and slippers. The pillow menu choice is rather unusual for four stars, so thumbs up for that. The room was ok, as we spent most time sightseeing. It was of avarage size only, but we liked the Ottoman-style decor. Very positive: no carpet, but Housekeeping was not cleaning properly the floor and we had flocks of lint & dust under the slippers on the 2nd day already. Bathroom was clean with the good choice of amenities. The breakfast is disappointing. It is meant to be an American Breakfast Buffet, but there are many little things presented on plates and in bowls that do not add value but only volume to the buffet. I also missed cooling of items and covers to protect food against flies, dirt, sneezing etc. The overall buffet presentation seemed dull to me. The quality of the items was low in general, and in particular the baked goods and pastries. I would have expected far better quality. Nevertheless, I would go back again for a short trip. Majority of guests were couples, aged 40 and up with no kids which makes this place peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location & charm”
Reviews.Author: RussChapman
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ottoman Hotel Imperial based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews posted in tripadvisor and we were glad we did. The location of the hotel was criticized in at least one less than positive review and I cannot understand that at all. The hotel is adjacent to the Hagia Sophia and quite close to the entrance to the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, both cisterns, etc. Thus, for us on our first visit to Istanbul, the location was perfect. The hotel is small and attractively decorated. We did not opt for a more expensive larger room and were very satified with our small but beautifully decorated room. The room and the hotel were clean and well maintained. The staff were friendly and helpful both prior to our arrival (i.e., with confirmations and travel arrangements etc.) and while we were there. The hotel restaurant (the Matbah) was an al fresco delight with an interesting menu of Ottoman palace dishes. In fact, one of the finest Turkish food items (an appetizer) we had in 7 days in Turkey was at the Matbah. Furthermore, some of the interesting dishes offered are not found in our two Turkish cookbooks and we would love to see a Matbah cookbook someday. Our waiter each night (Yassin) at the Matbah was a delight - charming, with a sense of humor, and attentive. We hope we can return to Istanbul for another visit and we will definitely return to the Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Allaround an excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: bluestarcowboy
Reviews.Content: We don't have a lot to add to the previous reviewers other than just to confirm this is a great hotel to stay while in Istanbul for the price. Location was excellent, walking distance to all of the historical sights.
