Room was very clean and comfortable and breakfast was a treat with Turkish traditional dish to complement the normal European breakfast. Do visit the Grand Bazar it's an experience as well as the city centre Taksim, many restaurants, cafes, shops and I believe one of the oldest tram lines that will take you from one end of the Taksim area to the other.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: toddy65826
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial was in excellent location to visit the mojor sights of Istanbul. Next to the hotel is the Hagia Sofia museum, on the other side the Underground Cistern, two minutes away is the Blue Mosque and around the back side of the hotel about three minutes away is the Topkapi Palace, can't get a better location than this. There are two tram stops near the hotel that , we used the tram to visit the Grand Bazar ( altough you can walk, about a good 15-20 minute ), follow the tram line to an area called Sirkeci to visit the Bosphorus. The satff at the hotel could not have been friendlier, very helpful, many great inside tips to where to visit and how to get around busy Istanbul. The rooms are modern, nicely decorated and clean, it feels so cosy entering the room. We really enjoyed our stay and would definately came back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get any closer”
Reviews.Author: AhasverSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and we were not disappointed. Right behind the Hagia Sophia, 3 mins walk from Tokapi Palace and 4 mins from the Blue Mosque plus, the grand cistern is just across the back street. You can't get any closer. The hotel is built into a slight slope, with the main entrance at the upper level (behind the Hagia Sophia). To get to our room (507), we had to cross the terrace restaurant and then go 2 flights down, facing the main street and the exit of the grand cistern, perhaps the most impressive of all the main attractions although it is completely underground (but beautifully illuminated). The room was small and the bathroom (shower) even smaller but that was a good trade-off given the location. On the main street also runs a tram line with street cars passing every other minute however, they are of the most modern and hence, most quiet type and didn't bother us much. Breakfast buffet was rich but lacking in good beverages. Staff was very friendly and made our stay a real pleasure. The hotel does neither have a pool nor a fitness center

Reviews.Title: “complete deception”
Reviews.Author: MINA B
Reviews.Content: Actually this is not a hotel...it is a remodeled house turned into a hotel.... The rooms are very small , noisy, but clean. The breakfast is average. the location is great in the middle of historical sites.... The reception staff and concierge are unhelpful....rude...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: annaperon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located on a quiet street in the Sultanahmet district, close to all major attractions. It is next to the Hagia Sofia and within easy walking distance of many other historical sites and restaurants. The rooms are clean and well appointed, the staff is very accomodating and the breakfast buffet is extensive and delicious. We felt very comfortable there and would return.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful respite from the bustle of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AnnaWaci
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is RICH in sensory stimulation -- including the 13+ million people who inhabit the city. For us, the Ottoman Hotel was a wonderful sanctuary to return to after a day of experiencing the bustling activity of the city. While one isn't spared the crack-of-sunrise blare to prayer that reverberates into your REM sleep cycle (even with windows closed and the AC turned on), the hotel is otherwise located on a quiet street in the heart of the charming Sultahahmet quarters. Breakfast is great and includes beautiful views. And, we can't say enough about the hotel's Matbah Restaurant. While a bit pricey, it's worth the exceptionally prepared meals that offer well researched and deliciously realized culinary Ottoman authenticity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: hajiessex
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Excellent service especially from Mohammed on the front desk and the guest relations team. Will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, good value”
Reviews.Author: hoop360
Reviews.Content: Firts of all we want to say thank you to all the team of Ottoman Hotel Imperial, they were lovely and very helpful. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, we felt like we were right at home. The breakfast was very good with many delicious dishes. Location to die for, next to Hagia Sofia and a short distance walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace , Underground Cistern , the famous Grand Bazar etc.. we will for sure recommend this hotel to our friends and family who are planing to visit Turkey in the near future,

Reviews.Title: “Feel the spirit of St. Sophia”
Reviews.Author: ThanosRubis
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is very close to Hagia Sophia and generally close to all attractions of the old city. The rooms are beautiful, with majestic decoration, although not very large (all the hotels in Old Town have the same problem). It has all the amenities and is clean enough. The breakfast is rich but could have more hot dishes. There is free wifi and is very fast. The parking is free, although it is difficult to drive to the hotel, in fact there are no legal way to get to the hotel, you must drive over the lines of the tram! What we liked most was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful. Especially, I would like to thank Ozgur and Handan who made our stay memorable. Definitely, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to live in the heart of old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: novemberstorm_11
Reviews.Content: We have many good memories of our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Location is perfect for exploring istanbul by walking. many of the historical sites as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace and the Blue Mosque are all within a short walk away. Staff are fab, very helpful and friendly. Rooms are in good size and shape, comfortable and clean, free wifi in the room works well.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable rooms, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: kaytime78
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the heart of the historical Sultanahmet area. The hotel is located at walking distance from the tramway and the main attractions as : the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia museum, the Grand Bazar, Topkapi Palace etc... Authentic oriental design, very friendly and dedicated staff with good tourist information desk. Breakfast buffet was good, good choice of international and local dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good customer srvice”
Reviews.Author: seafront936
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ottoman Hotel Imperial on our first visit to Istanbul in April for it's perfect location. When we arrived at the hotel we were surprised when we learned we were upgraded to a room overlooking the Aya Sofia museum. Very stylesh room, spacious, bright, very clean and comfortable with a seperate seating area. Everyone at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Very stylesh room, spacious, bright, very clean and had a seperate small seating area. Everyone working at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Perfect location, Aya Sofia is across the street with Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “An astounding experience and worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: PilotMike2009
Reviews.Content: This trip was a mix of business and a mini-vacation, and for once I was joined by my wife. That was a bad idea, because now she thinks ALL the hotels I stay at are like this mini-palace, and nothing could be further from the truth. That being said, when I die and if I go to heaven, I hope it is as nice as this hotel. The logistics are a bit tricky. The hotel is located in a zillion-year old building next to the overwhelmingly huge Haya Sofia mosque and museum, which is a treat. You're right in the heart of ancient Constantinople, and history abounds. But the city has just turned the whole area into a pedestrian zone, so it's hard to find a taxi that knows the secret back roads that can get you to the front door of the hotel. It can be done, but we only had one taxi out of six or seven who managed the trick. Ask for the hotel car to pick you up; it's simply easier. The lobby is small and intimate, and although this is Ottoman heritage it almost had the feeling of an small English manor house. We were given Room 202, directly over the lobby, with a balcony and lovely views. The rooms are small and the air conditioning somewhat feeble, but the bed and bathrooms were a treat. In addition, the room had a huge balcony where we sat at night and listened to the laughter from the patio restaurant, below. It was charming. The real kick was the bathroom. It was very large and spendlidly equipped, with a shower bigger than some hotel rooms. Elegant appointments, handsome stone work, lovely amenities -- my wife was loving it. The food in the restaurant was great, although certainly not cheap. The breakfast buffet is more than enough. There was live music and dinner and on the one night we were there a dervish came and danced (whirled?) as an example of this unusual religous culture. The only problems: no luggage rack, and no 120v electrical power. Minor issues, really. We asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation and she made a fine choice; a fish restaurant on the bridge over the Golden Horn. Again, bring your wallet, but the experience was worth the ticket. No complaints, only praises -- well worth a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandblast511
Reviews.Content: We loved the city and the hotel, the hotel is across the street from Hagia Sofia and just across from the Blue Mosque. The location was perfect for us. Upon arrival we were greeted, given a map and some useful information about the attractions, opening times etc.. The front desk staff were very friendly and responsive. Rooms were clean, bright and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: tree3315
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for friends wedding , decided on the Ottoman Hotel Imperial due to it's fantastic location, we thought we would stay longer and explore all the historical sights. All the main sites are a few minute walk away. Good room, nothing special , but than again your only there to sleep, it's in good size, comfortable and clean. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “We got what we paid for: location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: kokonutzFT
Reviews.Content: We were able to book a room at this hotel for $150US/night on Orbitz. Having read the reviews of the hotel here on TA, we had a pretty good idea that we'd end up in the Annex facing the tram in a tiny room. We were correct. But for that rate, we were paying for the location, not a grand room. And the location literally cannot be beat. The service was good, particularly the orientation at check-in. So we got what we paid for and left happy, despite the tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “In every way top class”
Reviews.Author: flyhigh44
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial, everything was top class. Located perfectly close to all the historical sites , all a short walking distance away. Aya Sofia is right next to the hotel, we had a wonderful view from our room, the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace are within 2-5 minutes away, on the other side of the hotel Underground Cistern is located, if you follow the tram line down it will take you to the Bosphorus where you could hop on a boat for a cruise around the Bosphorus, it'a only about 10TL. If you follow the tram line up, you will end op at the Grand Bazar. Staff are very helpful, polite and friendly. We had a wonderful room, good size, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “A HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: pragueaddict
Reviews.Content: Great location, good transportation, proffesional efficient and friendly staff!!! Our home in Istanbul!!! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Place”
Reviews.Author: ehelgason
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Imperial has much going for it, the location is great if you want to do sightseeing, the hotel is clean, the staff is polite and helpful, and the rooms are nice - but not very big. I found the breakfast buffet a bit lacking in freshness â€“ but otherwise this is a place I would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, well presented hotel”
Reviews.Author: guide2389
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. Location Ä±s unbeatable, walking dÄ±stance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Gulhana Parki Underground CÄ±stern etc.. Many turkish cuÄ±sÄ±ne rerstaurants near by in the Sultanahmet area. Staff are very polite, kÄ±nd, frÄ±endly and helpful. Rooms are in good sÄ±ze, clean and comfortable, breakfast buffet was good. Restaurant Ä±s nicely situated with a good view of the surroundÄ±ng monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good service, bad location”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitRanda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, the service was good and personal but the location was poor, no taxi new were it was

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...but some compromises”
Reviews.Author: susanu
Reviews.Content: The major sights of Istanbul are all located around Sultanahmet Park with the Aya Sofia and Blue Mosque at opposite ends of the square and Topkapi Palace just around the corner. Aya Sofia's minarets were the view from our room at the Ottoman Imperial. On a hot summer day in Istanbul, it's a great luxury to have an air-conditioned hotel room just a short walk away - and that's the best part of this hotel. We were surprised by the size of the crowds and the length of the lines at the sights...when 3 huge cruise ships are in port (as they were when we visited), the tourist area of Istanbul is just overwhelmed by mobs of tour groups from the ships. The Ottoman Imperial gave us the ability to see the sights early and retreat from the crowds and the heat. The location of the hotel is simply wonderful. It's also easy to see why the reviews of the hotel are so mixed. We had booked a standard room, and were shown to a room at the back of the hotel that was so small there was no space for our suitcases. The window faced a busy street that was sure to be noisy at night. We asked for another room, and were shown another tiny room on the ground floor with a window facing a tiny interior space -quieter, but still no space for suitcases. The hotel then upgraded us to a larger superior room at the front of the hotel at no extra charge. Many thanks to the Ottoman Imperial for this - we enjoyed looking out at the quiet front street and Aya Sofia. I recognized the rooms we were shown from complaints in Trip Advisor. If you want a comfortable room with a a view, be prepared to pay for a superior room. The restaurant was located on a beautiful outside patio, and the food was good - but it was very expensive, and a bit formal for our taste. We found a wonderful little outdoor restaurant - Konuk Evi- around the corner at the end of Caferiye Sokak. A great place for a simple lunch in a beautiful garden. Inexpensive, and they'll even make a hamburger and fries on request! The breakfast room at the Ottoman is at the top of the hotel; sunny with nice views and open windows. The coffee was good and the food was fine for an included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean!”
Reviews.Author: TravellersJuly2011
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel, functioning AC, friendly and service-minded staff. Very close to touristic attractions. The breakfast buffet was nothing special by Scandinavian standards, a lot of pastry, but O.K. compared to continental breakfast. We would definitely stay there again, but we would skip the breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman was our entry gate to Turkey. It is perfectly located for the main sites in Sultanahmet, such as the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. In this sense, location is hard to beat. I was at first upset to be assigned a room in the annex, and not the Mosque view as I have requested - though it must be said it was the travel agency and not the hotel's fault. This is my main criticism of the hotel, as these rooms are really, really small, and the dark furniture adds a claustrophobic feel. The hotel also has light saving sensors on the corridor , so it does feel a bit eerie on this annex as you don't get to see the end of corridor when it's dark or when other people are not around. I was moved the day after to a room overlooking the mosque: still small, but much lighter. Thus, you should pay the extra to stay in one of the Vizir rooms or smaller rooms in the main building. Other than that the hotel staff is really helpful and accommodating, the rooms and bathrooms are quite clean, and the AC works perfectly. Breakfast is plentiful, and guests should at least once have a meal at the Ottoman restaurant onsite. They are one of the few places cooking traditional Ottoman cuisine, and the food is really delicious. All in all, I highly recommend this hotel if you plan to stay in the Sultanahmet area, but be careful in your room selection to fully enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back to this one!”
Reviews.Author: SavannahUAE
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily for its location which we had read was excellent, and so it turned out to be. In the old part of Istanbul, Sultanahmet, the hotel was close to many of the main sites of the city - the Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia were right next door, the Blue Mosque a short walk away. The hotel was also close to many cafes and restaurants and within walking distance of the quayside for boat trips along the Bosphorus, and to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar. We normally look at 5* hotels but came down a star for the location. Very glad we did as this hotel's location was perfect and a little less expensive than 5* although without the routine spa, swimming pool etc which didn't matter on this occasion. We had a Premier Sultan room which looked out on to the Hagia Sofia. The room was not huge but perfectly adequate as we didn't really spend much time in it being out in Istanbul most of the time. Furniture was dark wood in Turkish style. There was adequate wardrobe space, a safe, a television, tea and coffee making facilities, a console table, plus a table and chair, and of course the double bed. The bathroom was big with modern amenities and a bath that had a jacuzzi fitment and also a shower.There were complimentary toiletries, hairdryer, and towels were plentiful. Altogether very nice and everything was very clean. The hotel itself is a former hospital and school converted in the 20th century so its layout and architecture is much more individual than some hotels. The dining room where we had breakfast looked over the rooftops of Istanbul. Breakfast was a modest affair. I'd give it 7/10, not perfect, but an adequate selection of basic hot dishes (sausages, eggs), cheese and cold meat, good selection of pastries, with tea, coffee and what was supposed to be fresh orange juice, but didn't taste like it. Was OK anyhow! We were not at the hotel for dinner. Most staff were friendly, one or two were a little offhand but this could have simply been because English wasn't their first language. Most staff spoke English quite well. There is a minibus you can request to pick you up from the airport which is a free service if you book three nights or more (we were there for four nights). The hotel also has its own car service for your return to the airport as well but you have to pay for this - a very reasonable E25 I think. They were very slow delivering our bags to the room on arrival. Istanbul is a lively, vibrant, walkable and historical city, we'd love to return sometime and if we do we would choose the Ottoman Imperial again. Try it, I think you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tonytourist
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quiet hotel near to the historical centre of Istanbul in Sultanahmet. The hotel is very close to Agia Sophia. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. The airport transfers were effcicient. We booked two rooms. Our kids got a street view (with some noise from the bar outside), we had a view of a wall (but it was a very quiet)! The rooms were well decorated but small. OK for a night or two, but no more. The bathrooms were good, particularly the showers. Breakfast was basic but adequate. I'm not sure I will ever want olives for breakfast. Hotel restaurant looked nice but outside of our budget so we ate outside.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Excellence”
Reviews.Author: SeanFlanigan2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to my wife and I by a relative who has stayed here previously and is about to stay here again soon. Based on this my wife and I had no hesitation booking this hotel for our own stay in Istanbul. While this hotel doesnâ€™t have the facilities to rate as 5 star, the friendly, very helpful and courteous staff, the beautifully presented and clean room, and the Matbah restaurant are the best of the 3 hotels we have used during this holiday (and the one supposed to be 5 star fell short in many areas). Properly sealing double glazed windows provided welcome insulation from a city that parties and dines well into the night. This is a charming boutique hotel in an excellent location, and is the hotel we will stay in for our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel located in the historical part of the old city”
Reviews.Author: pearljam_12
Reviews.Content: There are so many hotels to choose from in Istanbul, hard to decide, after a detail search we decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial and we're glad we did, very happy with our stay, exceeded our expectations. Perfect location, close to all the historical sights, Hagia Sofia, Topkapai Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazar, Spice Market, Bosphorus etc.. all a short walking distance from the hotel. Good size rooms with plenty of space, comfortable bed and clean. Complementary breakfast buffet was good and tasty. Very helpful and friendly staff, on the day we arrived guest relations staff provided us with helpful information.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: powertrip021
Reviews.Content: We were very happy we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial for our first visit to Istanbul. The best location for visiting all the historical sites. All of them are within few minutes walking distance from the hotel. Hotel has beautiful decorated rooms with comfortable bed and it's very clean, bright, has good size space. Good choice of selections on the buffet table for breakfast. Staff are very friendly and always willing to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and great service”
Reviews.Author: de2626
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with our best friend's prior to sailing out of Istanbul. We could not have asked for a more central location to the primary sites on everyone's "must see" list for the city. The staff, especially Mary in the concierge office, was very helpful. They arranged all of our transfers to and from the airport/cruse terminal, arranged for a terrific private tour guide/car, made reservations for a fabulous 20th anniversary dinner at a great restaurant with the most amazing view of the city. If we ever go back to Istanbul we will no doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Part of the Family”
Reviews.Author: QAussies
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week in this superbly located hotel. We found the hotel room excellent. However the pinnacle of our enjoyment was entirely created by the very friendly and always helpful staff. For example having lost our camera one of the reception staff loaned us a replacement so that we would not miss out on photographing a special experience. The restaurant "Matbah" serves some superbly different meals based on ancient recipes. Breakfasts are good with plenty of choice at the buffet. The location in Sultanahmet could hardly be better for those wishing to explore the old part of Istanbul. We would be more than happy to stay here on any other occasion that offers. Two well pleased Australians.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for End of Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: prezzgreg
Reviews.Content: We traveled here for the last two nights of our Honeymoon. We spent a total of 10 nights between Athens, Mykonos and Santorini, and finished up with 2 nights in Istanbul. The hotel is located very close to Hagia Sofia (between the tram tracks and Agia Sofia). The hotel is very tricky to find, as you have to walk up a small hill, where there is a restaurant on the triangle corner near the hotel. We took a taxi from the airport, which was about 35 TL (which is very reasonable). We emailed them that it was our honeymoon, and they gave us a free upgrade, which was really nice. Breakfast in the morning is pretty good, and there is WiFi in the room and lobby. The front desk is very helpful. TIP: The small store selling souvenirs by the hotel can be haggled down to the best prices in the city. TIP: Agia Sofia - A person came up to us while online offering us a deal. The tickets cost 20 TL each, so he offered to sell us a book on Istanbul, and he would allow us to cut the long line. So, basically, we paid him 60 TL, 40 TL for the tickets, and another 20 TL for the book and to cut the line. This saved us about an hour of waiting, which was totally worth about 12 dollars alone, not to mention the free book! If you are only traveling for a few days, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Overated”
Reviews.Author: zebrefleuri
Reviews.Content: Good place but terrible room, it's like living in a closet with a view on a wall!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel that could not do enough for you.”
Reviews.Author: M7104
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in great central Istanbul location. Service excellent and ros are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: amazonhouse
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is located directly in the neighbouthood of Hagia Sofia and a short walking distance to the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. This hotel is an ideal base for sightseeing i the Sultanahmet area. Visiting the Galata quaters is very easy because there are two tram stops located a short walk from the hotel. Well furnished hotel and rooms with comfortable beds, spacious and bright. Staff are very kind , friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: coldworld33
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days. the welcome was extremely courteous and friendly. The room was comfortable, good size bed, bright and clean. The breakfast buffet was very good. We had dinner in the restaurant two nights, it was delicious. The guest relations staff and the front desk were very helpful in planning our journey around Istanbul. Location to die for, across the cobble stone street from Hagia Sofia, two minutes away from the Blue Mosque and five minutes the most from Topkapi Palace.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: ocmaryland
Reviews.Content: We loved the professional, friendly atmosphere from the moment we stepped inside. "You are home" we were told and felt very comfortable. The staff is amazing - always ready to help out with useful advice. The rooms were small compared to US standards - but who needs a huge room when you have an awesome view and all the tourist spots within walking distance. The restaurant was pricey but very well done for our first night. Again, outstanding staff. We were there for 5 nights and were never disappointed. We highly recommend this hotel. If we ever go back to Istanbul we're at the Ottoman Imperial. Thank you Ottoman!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calligraphers
Reviews.Content: During a two week visit to Turkey we stayed the first and last nights of the trip at this hotel, on the tour we stayed at a number of five star hotels but found this one was as good as those but at half the price. The rooms, which are beautifully decorated, are large as are the ensuites. Cleanliness is of a high standard and the staff were very friendly and exceptionally helpful. The location right in the heart of the Sultanhamet district is ideal being close to the major tourist sites and with a good selection of restaurants close by. The garden restaurant is a great location to have a meal and the food was very good. We strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sourcraftadozen
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel, in the heart of Sultanahmet wher all the major sites are located, across the street from Hagia Sofia, nice cobble stone street , you also dont have to walk far to visit Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Very helpful and friendly staff, from the moment we arrived they made us feel like part of the family. Good comfortable rooms, comfortable and clean, full amenities, free wifi. All in all we had a very pleasent stay at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fascinating city, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetcandy890
Reviews.Content: Choosing to stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a good choice. all staff were very friendly, courteous and helpful. The Guest Relation staff ( so sorry can not remember her name ) provided us all the information we needed and gave us some great advice. Our room was in good size and shape, well decorated, comfortable and cleaned every day.Breakfast buffet was delicious, variety of choices. Location of the hotel is one of the best, most historical sites as Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia museum are all within few minute walk away. There are many restaurants , local shops, post office and banks within a short distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Ardis_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was difficult for the taxi driver to find. It's best to have the hotel call one for you and have him meet you at the airport. This hotel is across a narrow, cobblestone street from the Hagia Sofia. It's just steps away from the Hippodrome, the Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, and the Blue Mosque. The food at the restaurant is so absolutely marvelous and the staff is so professional and friendly that we chose to eat a number of evening meals here on the beautiful patio overlooking the city and listening to the evening call to prayer. The breakfast was included in the price of the room and was a wonderful smorgasbord of traditional Turkish food plus some standbys for guests who don't want to go there. We stayed in two rooms here. The first was adequate though quite small. The second was roomy and lovely with it's own view of the Hagia Sofia. It would be worth it to pay the extra money and have a larger room. We loved this hotel and especially its staff. We felt like we were leaving old friends when we left, and we'll definitely stay here on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MVTraveler9092
Reviews.Content: After two wonderful weeks traveling around Turkey, two of us stayed our last couple of nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. It was a shame to end a good trip on such a down note-- the staff were rude, the rooms very cramped, especially for the price, and the breakfasts were the worst of our whole trip. Three times the staff said they would do something such as fix the heating rack in the bathroom or pick up our laundry or provide a bag breakfast for us before our early flight, and they didn't do any of them. the room price was quite high and they overcharged for airport rides compared to the other Istanbul hotel we'd stayed in. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the Hagia Sophia is right outside your window”
Reviews.Author: jaredxtian
Reviews.Content: I stayed here July 2009. Air Conditioning is a MUST in this city at this time and the Hotel Imperial was a great cool place to return after sweating it out on a hot Istanbul summer afternoon. Location - You can't beat it. The hotel is on a side street next to the Hagia Sophia. The advantage, of course, is the beautiful view. The disadvantage is the call to prayer, the first being at some ungodly time in the morning. But I assume that the closeness of the location to a mosque doesn't really matter since the chant is on loud speaker. Besides, it's better to wake up to than an alarm. Service - Impeccable, outstanding. The receptionists are ready and willing to help and assist in any way shape and form. Room - Although the room is beautifully decorated, it was very small. The queen size bed in my room took up 80% of the room. I'm not joking. And the shower! First, I had to take a huge step up and into the shower. And then after the shower, I had to get out of the shower room because there was no room for me to stretch my arms to towel dry myself. Fortunately, I don't need that much room. Not to worry. Not all rooms are small. My friend had a room double the size of mine. The breakfast buffet was great and the dining room has a beautiful view. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: cesarblues
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial for our visit to Istanbul. The most ideal location for visiting all the historical sites. Hagi Sofia museum is located across the hotel, Topkapi Palace is about a 5 minute walk around the back of the hotel, Basilica Cistern is on the other side of the hotel, the famous Grand Pazar is about a good 15-20 minute walk, but a it's a short tram ride away, there are couple tram stops near the hotel. Many restaurants and caffes in the area. Only time we used public transportation is when we visited the city centre Taksim. Hotel has wonderfully decorated rooms, nice comfortable bed and very clean. Every staff we came across were very friendly, kind, big smile on their faces and very helpful. Nice tasty breakfast. Very good hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Quality small hotel in brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: travellingvillain
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights after reading lots of positive reviews on trip advisor. Overall I would consider it to be one of the better hotels I have stayed in and certainly by far the best for seeing major city sights in terms of location. The room was a bit small, but otherwise I though was of a very high standard. The furnishings were all tasteful and the bathroom / shower excellent. The hotel has an excellent sun terrace for breakfast for lunch. Breakfast was of a good quality with a decent variety (buffet style). I did not stay for lunch / dinner, but it was certainly very popular and often appeared fully booked. The staff were very friendly and helped with suitcases, airport transfers etc. The hotel is not that big which added to the relaxed atmosphere. It is located on a quiet cobbled street near to Aya Sofya and the other major sights such as the Topkapi Palace / Blue Mosque. All of these sights are literally a few minutes walk, making it an excellent place to see Istanbul's sights. I would definately recommend this as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: zooker38
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel based on the reviews posted on Tripadvisor and other review engines and we were very happy we decided to stay here. The staff are really great, friendly and helpful in every way they can. Good selection at breakfast and we also had dinner on the terrace and enjoyed it very much. It's the ideal locarion to do all sights, directly across Aya Sofia, short walk to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Tram station is about 3 walking minutes and many good restaurants and cafe's around. Would recommend this hotel for everybody who is the first time in Istanbul and wanna do all sights in the Old City and dont want to be far from them.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: dubleydubley2
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about the hotel, everyone at the hotel made us feel like part of the family soon as we arrived. Staff are very friendly and helpful, very informative on what to visit, hoe to get there, times of the museums open etc... We had a very comfortable and bright room, it was clean and spacious, had all the amenities we needed for our stay, free wifi in the room and around the hotel. Wonderful location, near by all the attractions, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Gulhana Park, couple of tram stops are all within walking distance. All in all we had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: scooter824
Reviews.Content: Our travel agency, Central Holidays Travel, reserved 2 rooms at the Ottoman as part of our family vacation. Overall, we were very pleased with the choice. The hotel is located right in the middle of the old part of the city, next to Haigha Sophia and close to other sites we planned to visit--e.g., Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace. The front-desk staff spoke English and were happy to arrange taxis, restaurant reservations and a personal tour guide. Every member of the staff we came in contact with was friendly and helpful. The bedrooms and bathrooms were typical of Europe--attractive and clean, comfortable beds with nice linens, but the rooms are small with limited closet and drawer space. A/C and plumbing worked well. Internet was free but signal was very weak, and we had to connect in other ways. There is no exercise room, spa or pool. There was only one key per room, and it was required to turn on the electricity in the room. So, charging our laptops, phones, camera batteries. etc. when we were away, meant leaving the room key inserted in the electrical switch and then asking a staff member to let us in with the master key upon our return. The staff was always available to do this, but it seemed an odd arrangement. Breakfast was included and was served buffet style in an attractive dining area overlooking the area. Quantity and quality were very good. People with U.S.-style breakfasts tastes might feel that the choices are limited, but there were scrambled eggs, toast, some fruits and a couple of cereal choices available. We enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay at the Ottoman again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cloud993
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial was in a fabulous position as we could walk to so many main attractions as Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazar, Bosphorus, Spice Market and many restaurants around the Sultanahmet area. Room was in good size, comfortable and was all very clean. The breakfast buffet which was included was very comphrehensive. The staff were very friendly and helpful with all request. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KimHL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally located, the staff were very hospitable. The decor was pretty impressive and a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque from the terrace bar! The breakfast was so so, the hot food looked delicious but was cold.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location”
Reviews.Author: zebedee70
Reviews.Content: Actually not an amazing location but rather a miraculous one; quiet leafy side street behind Sophia Hagia within spitting distance of main tram line,major sights and good restaurants. Downside is that is a little old fashioned ( actual keys for rooms which you leave in reception and solid decor) Staff attentive and helpful though clearly expect a tip. Istanbul is a delight but difficult to avoid being ripped off- don't even think about getting in a taxi unless you have a degree in assertiveness. A Brit free zone with not an England football shirt, tatoo or stag party in sight Restaurant provides unusual and interesting fare but a tad overpriced and service slow

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: candyfloss2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a lovely 4 day trip to Istanbul, & we found this delightful hotel on Tripadvisor. The location is perfect - only a few minutes walk to all the major sites, and some wonderful restaurants. We had a premium double room with a bathtub ... I specifically requested this as many of the hotel bathrooms just have showers. Breakfast is adequate, and we also had one evening meal here which was very good indeed - the food was different to say the least - I had minced lamb meat served in a hot scooped out melon - delicious! The staff are very helpful and friendly, and I can highly recommend this hotel. We both suggest you have at least one evening meal at Kayikci Restaurant, only a few mins walk from the hotel, down a quaint cobbled side-street - easy to recognise by the white wicker chairs outside - the food is absolutely delicious. Although the sites are within walking distance, most of the streets are cobbled so comfy walking shoes are a must. Instead of taking a boat trip down the Bosphorus we decided to take a boat trip to one of the Princes' Islands - a welcome break from the bustle of the city ... we went to the largest island, Buyukada where there are no cars, just horse-driven carriages ... even tho' very 'touristy' do take a trip in a carriage around the island!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - depending on the room”
Reviews.Author: debking10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights en route to the UK. The first room they showed us was very small with no view at all. We objected and were shown a fabulous room with an exceptional view of the Hagia Sophia (which is so close you could almost touch it). The upgrade charge to the bigger room was minimal and we were then delighted with our stay. The staff are friendly and the breakfasts are wonderful. Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone - but it does depend on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Imperial Hotel Ottoman Istanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: looche
Reviews.Content: Arrived Easter morning in Istanbul with friends. This hotel location was perfectly located to many of the main attractions. Right near tram, even though we didn't take it. The hotel was very accomdating as to places to eat as was our guide, Ugur. When eating out, the staff at the restaurants are very attentive but just besure to ask prices. 5 of us spent 700 Turkish lira, which we figured out the next day was $105/person . this was a restaurant on the bridge-very good BUT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Gilmanton
Reviews.Content: My Husband, sister and I stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 5 nights in May. We were so pleased to discover how close it was to the main sights and easy tram access. The neighborhood is ideal for strolls to many sections of Istanbul and near wonderful restaurants like Rumeli Cafe and Magnaura Cafe. We had to make a room adjustment and the hotel staff was very gracious and found us great rooms with views until our amazing triple was ready...it was very large and beautiful. The breakfast had many options and was served in a bright sunny room...it was a little too cold to sit out on the terrace. We highly recommend this lovely hotel and would stay again. Deborah Chase, John Funk and Lisa Chase

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaser30
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is located in an excellent location for visiting the major sights of Istanbul. Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel with Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque just a short walk away. The city center Taksim is about a good 20-25 min walk, can get there with a tram also which will take only about 10 minutes, many good restaurants, shops, caffes, cinemas etc.. can be found. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are modern , in good size, clean , it felt very cosy. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definately recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial for anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Staff, and Location”
Reviews.Author: chefmarkko
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this elegant hotel in the heart of historical Istanbul. We were amazed at how close it was to all of the "must see" historical landmarks. (Blue Mosque, Aysophia, Basilica Cisterns, Grand Bazaar, etc. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The advice they gave us made us feel safe and comfortable. Merih Demir, the concierge, was excellent at helping direct us to the important sites in the city, and a memorable trip! A must stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman Hotel Imperial the perfect boutique hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: backyard80
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is in a perfect location on a quiet street within easy walking distance to all the main sites in Sultanahmet and close to a tram stop which will take you anywhere in Instanbul, The lovely boutique hotel offers a fabulous breakfast which was included, spacious, clean, well appointed rooms and a staff that will do whatever it takes to make you comfortable and feeling as though you are with friends who want your stay to be perfect. We really suffered over where to stay and after much internet research we could not have been happier with our choice. Oh and the special service they use for the airport runs are reasonable, prompt and absolutely diligent.

Reviews.Title: “Like the stay”
Reviews.Author: cullen_mchel75
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel.Staff was professional and friendly with a great attitude and smiles the location of the hotel is reasonable good the rooms were nice the sheets were extraordinarily comfortable.Would recommend for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: dealer12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the perfect spot to visit Istanbul. It's located just across from Aya Sofia and all other main attractions in the Sultanahmet area are within walking distance. The staff were friendly, well appointed room

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite hotel in the centre of Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: boldsoul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial with my family for two nights at New Year's. The hotel is located right beside Aya Sofya in the heart of Old Istanbul. The staff were professional, courteous and friendly. We had a triple room in the new wing of the hotel. The room was tastefully decorated and had a spacious bathroom, but no full size bathtub. The breakfast was absolutely amazing, though. One of the best breakfasts I've had in any hotel around the world. All in all, we had a lovely stay and would thoroughly recommend this hotel, but book early to get a good price, like we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, good find”
Reviews.Author: rysean39
Reviews.Content: Although the Sultanahmet area is a bit touristy for our taste, but there is a reason much of Istanbul's historical mosques, palaces, bazaars and the sea are nearby. The Ottoman Hotel Imperial lived up to it's positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The staff are very helpful and the hotel is immaculate. Rooms are nicely decorated, in good size, comfortable bed and spotles clean. Complementary breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for visiting all major sights in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: Krissi55
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews posted on Tripadvisor and were really happy that we decided to stay here. I arrived eary in the morning way before the regular check in time and they prepared the room for me directly and even upgraded us to the Junior Suite. The staff is really GREAT, friendly and help you in every way they can. Tasty selection of breakfast and we also had dinner on the terrace and enjoyed it a lot. Its the ideal location to do all sights, directly across Hagia Sophia, short walk to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Tram station around 3 walking minutes and also a couple of nice restaurants and cafes around. Would recommend this hotel for everybody who is the first time in Istanbul and wanna do all the sights in the Old City.

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: withygirl
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was very central to all the major sites in the old part of istanbul., plenty to see and do within walking ditance. Rooms are well presented and very clean. Staff are friendly and helpful. Superb breakfast served to a backdrop of old Istanbul. Excellent base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “The location is perfect for exploring Istanbul, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: dehalr
Reviews.Content: The hotel arranged to pick us up from the airport - and that was just the first of several examples of helpfulness shown throughout our stay. The staff were all very attentive, and welcoming. (In particular the kindness of Merih Demir went well beyond the call of any professional obligation. She helped make the holiday very special.) Our room was remarkably quiet given the central location of the hotel - just opposite the Haghia Sophia, and close to the tram line. Once we had worked out the heating and air conditioning, we slept comfortably. And we ate some terrific food in the hotel's restaurant. The Turkish elements of the breakfast were perfectly satisfactory (ignore the standard Euro-hotel fare on the hotplates), but the meals in the evening were really exceptionally good. The recreations of classic Ottoman cuisine managed to press all our diverse buttons (omnivore gourmand; vegetarian; 7 year old). Delicious - and the waiters were extremely kind to our son, bringing him little treats to keep him happy. It wasn't just him the staff kept happy. I had a birthday while there - and the staff treated me to a very good cake with candles etc. A nice touch. Our bathroom was spotless. The bath lacked a plug, but the shower was so efficient we were happy just with that. Our bed was huge, and our son was comfortable in an extra bed in the room. Bedlinen and towels were very clean and fresh at all times. An ideal room would have had a view, but that might well have meant noisier nights. If having a view matters to you, it is probably worth talking to the hotel about the outlook from your room before you travel. In any event, the view from the dining room is very attractive, especially as night falls. And after all, the heart of historic Istanbul is literally on your doorstep as you leave the hotel. In summer we might have been wary of having a room too close to the outdoor dining area; a large party enjoying itself over dinner might have made an early night difficult. But there are other room options, so it is worth asking about exactly where you will be before you arrive. if we had one very mild criticism it would probably be about the repetitiveness of the music played in the dining areas inside and out. The music was interesting enough in itself, but became over-familiar by day two. Istanbul is a fabulous place. We will almost certainly go back, and will almost certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and employees made this an exceptional place”
Reviews.Author: chichiSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 6-11 and then again on April 27-May 3. Our first stay was on the first floor, room 101. Excellent room, but location was a bit noisy on the street. Larger bathroom with Jacuzzi tub. If you stay on the lower level rooms, please bring a sound machine as this really helps. Cannot say enough about the cleanliness of the rooms. Our room was thoroughly cleaned daily with new toiletries each day. Liked having a teapot for hot water, coffee and teas supplied daily also. Liked the fact that the rooms had hard wood floors and no carpet. This is cleaner in my opinion. Beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was a five star experience. The restaurant staff were superb and made us feel like family. The lunch and dinner was excellent as well. Management was incredible! Our second stay was on the 4th floor, room 407. Our room and bathroom were much smaller but much quieter that 1st floor. No jacuzzi, just a walk in shower. This room was higher in price as well. My recommendation would be to stay on the top floor, facing Hagia Sofia. Ask for a larger room and bath. Corner room would be great. Our rooms did not have a chair either. Looking in some of the other rooms I noticed a comfy chair. I would request that as well. Both of our rooms did face towards Hagia Sofia. Great views! This is an ideal location. You really cannot get any better than this. Restaurants all around the block. Walk to all major attractions. Easy metro not far. Gulane Park next door. Highly recommend this exceptional place to stay with the best location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, wonderful location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: tavava54
Reviews.Content: If your visiting Istanbul for all the historical sights, as far as the location goes, you can't get better than this hotel. Hagia Sofia is right across the hotel with Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque about two minute walking distance away. Grand Bazar is about a good 15-20 minute walk, but you could also hop a tram for a short ride, there are two tram stop's near by the hotel. Rooms are very well decorated, nice and bright, in good size and very clean, good choice of food for breakfast. Wonderful staff , very helpful , kind and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good customer service”
Reviews.Author: jesseyday69
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ottoman Hotel Imperial for it's perfect location. When we arrived at the hotel to our pleasent surprise we were upgraded to a room over looking the Hagia Sofia museum. Very stylesh room, spacious, bright, very clean and had a seperate small seating area. Everyone working at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We had read in the reviews on the site the hotel was so close to all the sites but did not realized how close it was. Hagia Sofia is across the street with Topkapi Palace and the Blus Mosque a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Pipster5 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Booked this as an additional extra to a 10 trip around Turkey. The location was fabulous and very close to the Blue Mosque. The room proved to be a big disappointment. For Â£156 we had a standard double. The view was non existent and the room size itself was comparitively small. Hot water supply was intermittent. As we had previously moved from another hotel a short distance away, we probably had something to compare against. Unfortunately the location did not make up for the significant hike in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Service makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: buckelberry
Reviews.Content: We relied on the positive reviews written about Ottoman Hotel Imperial on this site when we decided to book this hotel for 4 nights. Simply put we had a great experience. First of all location can not be any better, your within minutes from Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. We had a fantastic room, bright, spacious, clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet had plenty of both international and Turkish style dishes on the table. Very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: jollyblues
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperail was a good choice. The staff and the service provided by the hotel met our need and the transfer we had requested was easy and went very smooth. Breakfast buffet was delicious and the view from the restaurant was great. We had a very comfortable and spacious room, beautifully designed and colorful. I would say all rooms are well located, quite and clean. Located nicely to visit all the museums, all of them are short walking distance away, with Hagia Sofia beign located across the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: traveller72England Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: hotel was in a fantastic location, with all the main sites within 5 minutes of the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and the rooms were very clean and comfortable although a bit small. Would recommend this hotel if you stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “will be back at this great place”
Reviews.Author: MargreteTravel
Reviews.Content: This is the Hotel to stay at in Istanbul. Service is great and all the staff are really polite and serviceminded. The standard rooms are a bit small, but it doesn't really matter as they are clean and comfortable. The bathroom does also hold a good standard with a great shower. We thought the best part about the hotel was the breakfast room with a great view and nice ambience. And location - what is there to say... It can't be better! Close to the main attractions and close to public transport! There's also plenty of restaurants in the area - however look for the once recommended here in tripadvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Like no other hotel, fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: berton_h
Reviews.Content: Our friend group had three nice size room for a 5 day stay and we were very pleased with the service received and the location of the hotel. Hotel is located directly across from Aya Sofia and view from our room had a direct view of it. Most other historical attractions are just a few minute walk away. The hotel restaurant was excellent, offered variety of choices that was different from the standard menus we found in most of the local restaurants. Staff were very helpful in getting, cabs, providing information about local sites and other requests.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were able to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: ellypc1200
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel imperial for 4 days in February and loved everything about the hotel. One of the main reason we enjoyed the hotel so much was the warm welcome we received from the minute we arrived. All the major sights are short walking distance away, perfect location. The restaurant is a wonderful place to end the day after visiting all the historiacl sights. Staff at the hotel is wonderful, very friendly, kind and very helpful. Highly recommend it, it's the best choice to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: chakmaro
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Imperial very much. The room was very nice and comfortable and clean. The staff was very good and friendly. We must mention here Merih Demir at the reception who was particularly nice and helpful with all sorts of information that a visitor needs when he first arrives in Istanbul. We appreciated very much her assistance and kindness. Needless to mention the location of the hotel. Just perfect. It couldn't be better. Right in the heart of Sultanhamet. Next to the extraordanry Agia Sofia and within walking distance from all the main sites like Top Kapi, The Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar and others. Yet very quiet. We recommend it to all visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: vic481
Reviews.Content: If you looking for a hotel near to all the important historical sights , well ottoman Hotel Imperial is the one. Hagia Sofia museum is next to the hotel, we had a room overlooking the museum garden, Topkapi Palace is a five minute walk and the Blue Mosque is a two minute walk. Many restaurant and shops are also close by, perfect place. Service was outstanding, very helpful and friendly staff, always close by to help you with any questions you might have. Rooms are comfortable, clean with all the amenities you need for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location for sight-seeing.”
Reviews.Author: Cowbridgelady
Reviews.Content: After researching many hotels on Tripadvisor decided on the Ottoman Imperial and we were pleased with our choice. As everyone says - perfect location for all the main sights. Our 'free transfer' was waiting for us at the airport even after a long wait at visa and passport control. Our 'standard' room was small and lacked storage space, but we were comfortable enough and it had a great shower (more powerful than our power shower at home). Staff were friendly and helpful and seemed to enjoy my efforts at saying a few words in Turkish. Breakfasts were very pleasant up in the rooftop restaurant. Lots of choice including some more unusual breakfast options some days such as onion rings, chips and soup (the soups were lovely though - couldn't resist a bowl now and then!). Didn't dine at the hotel in the evenings as we prefer to go out - plenty of restaurants around - we dined in Amedros, Faros, Mosaik and the Passazade Ottoman (the latter being the most reasonable and yet currently No. 1 on Tripadvisor), and had lunch in Pasha Cafe & Pub, Cozy Pub, the Han Restaurant and Hamdi down at Erminou (before boarding the Bospherous Ferry). Most of these were Tripadvisor Restaurant recommendations and they were all great even though not particularly cheap if you want to order a bottle of wine with your meal. On average - a bottle of house wine (Angora) in a restaurant was about 45 Turkish liras (about Â£20) so it certainly pushed up the bill especially if you wanted a better quality wine - some of those went up to 97 liras!!! We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night city break at the Ottoman as there is so much to see and do all within walking distance, but by the end of it we had tired of politely saying 'No thankyou' to all the endless carpet sellers, fake guides and restaurant touts. Maybe it is worse in this area of Sultanahmet as it is so popular with the tourists, but I wish they'd realise it is probably counterproductive as it seems to encourage most tourists to 'walk on by'. It was particularly bad in the Grand Bazaar where browsing is virtually impossible before they are badgering you to buy. Consequently, I bought nothing in there on two separate visits and that's a shame. Finally, we flew with Turkish Airlines and they were excellent - flights bang on time and even a choice on the main course of the meal, but a second extra security check literally just before boarding meant all drinks/water were confiscated that had been bought in the departure lounge unless they were in a sealed duty free bag. Had a great time in Istanbul though - go ahead and book the Ottoman Imperial - I'm sure you'll enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellow065
Reviews.Content: Ottoman is the place to stay in Istanbul. This was our 2nd time staying here and we love it. They are very welcoming and the rooms are the best you can expect in Istanbul. I promise that you will not be disappointed!!! My little daughter lost her doll in the lift and incredibly the reception staff could remember the doll and left it in our room with a note!!!! Also it is one of the best locations within Istanbul so donÂ´t hesitate and stay at Ottoman.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel for Exploring Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JohnODonnell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the ancient sites in Istanbul with very comfortable rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. It is literally on the doorstep of the Ayasofya museum and The Blue Mosque, also easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar. A high quality mid to high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly "homey" hotel in an incredible location”
Reviews.Author: Shutterfly97
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is literally 20' across the street from the Aya Sofia - which is just across from the Blue Mosque! The location was really great. Upon our arrival, we were greeted, given a map and some key details about attraction times, etc... The front desk staff was was so friendly and very responsive. In particular, Erhan, Mahmet, another Mahmet and Ozgar. We were a handful as we entered and left the hotel every day and they were very friendly and accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, friendly, and I can't imagine a better location.”
Reviews.Author: SofiaJoe
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in our room we were struck by the luxurious furnishings and decoration. Our window looked out on Hagia Sofia. What more can you say. Breakfast was varied and delicious, and it was easy to take in a site or two, come back to the hotel and crash for a while, and venture out again. The monumental area of Istanbul is beautiful at night, and staying in the middle of it makes it easy to take a pleasant stroll around after dinner. We were able to park on the street in front of the hotel for our entire 3 day visit. The hotel is so well-located that we never moved the car. Navigating in this neighborhood of Istanbul is tricky, and our only problem was finding how to get there the first night. Do yourself a favor and call for directions.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jollygood048
Reviews.Content: Location is superb, across the street from Hagia Sofia and near to the most important historical sights, Bosphorus and to the public transportation to many other city areas. Decor is very tasteful and clean and comfortable bed and pillows, bright and well appointed rooms. Wifi connection in the rooms. Breakfast is very good, served in a wonderful terrace, if the weather permits, otherwise it's served in the restaurant. The staff is very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this hotel, you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: levy80
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in a quite cobble street in the old part of Istanbul with Hagia Sofia at your doorstep. The staff were very friendly and helpful, spoke very good English. Rooms are comfortable, good size bed and very clean. Good breakfast. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: qwertBern
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in Hotel Ottoman Imperial very much. The hotel is elegant, very central and quiet. We enjoyed seeing Hagia Sofia from our room, The hotel staff was very helpful and made a big effort to give us valuable ideas of places to go that are not very touristic. Our time in the hotel remains memorable thanks to the friendly service of Erhan Deger who always greeted us with a smile and went out of his way to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel , perfect location”
Reviews.Author: robrob22
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Lacation is unfeatable, walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Siofia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Gulhana Park, Archeological Museum, Grand Bazar and much more. The staff bend over backwards to make our stay a very enjoyable one. Our room was wonderful. Breakfast was great , restautant is nicely situated with a good view of the surrounding monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the list for location, service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: samsam74
Reviews.Content: Ottoman hotel imperial is perfectly located for visiting all the historical sights. Three of the major sites are within walking distance, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Hotel is very good, one ofthe better hotels we have stayed around n Europe. Rooms are bright, has a comfortable bed and very clean. Wonderful breakfast, good choice of food to choose from. Very friendly helpful staff. Located with a reasonable walking distance to many very nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “a top choice for location, comfort, value”
Reviews.Author: ElanaBaltimore
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed our stay, with the best location possible, great help from the concierge, lovely breakfast room and fine breakfast options, calm and beauty of a historic building brought to modern standards. Ask for what you need-- softer pillows, mobile hangers, reservations out and about, as the staff is so helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly but definately only 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Lintonchalmers
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and found the staff very friendly and helpful. The positives: The room was what I would expect of a 5 star hotel, cleaned to perfection daily, clothes folded, replacement of bathroom essentials and very courteous to privacy. Negatives: Power was out for 2 days ( to be fair this was not a direct result of the hotel as the power was lost over the street, the hotels back up generator was faulty all the same). Internet service was very intermittent (not due to just the power shortage). Unfortunate sewerage smell in the hallway that was masked by air fresheners. Walls are paper thin so please keep this in mind....... All in all I would recommend this hotel as the negatives could be due to just bad timing.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and people very helpful and a great location”
Reviews.Author: calgary70
Reviews.Content: Location and great people !!!had lovely stay.clean rooms!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but noisey”
Reviews.Author: TerryMinuit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and has friendly, helpful and courteous staff. While the rooms are a little small they are perfectly acceptable and have good facilities within them. Unfortunately, the rooms are not very well sound insulated. The problem does not come from normal city noise but from fellow guests walking up and down stairs, corridors and moving furniture in their rooms. Normally, this noise is absorbed by carpet and good quality sound insulation but it has not been installed in the hotel. The unfortunate result is that even guests who are simply walking past your room make a lot of noise. One or two occasions you can cope with but every evening we had the same problem and then every morning we heard the early check-out's making their way to reception and those who were going for breakfast early. The noise problem is very unfortunate and the staff moved us to what they hoped would be a quieter room but unfortunately was still the same. If the problem is rectified we would recommend the hotel every time to first time vistors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ottoman Imperial.”
Reviews.Author: sdoron
Reviews.Content: Exceeded our expectations - incredible location, beautiful room, great buffet breakfast in a glassed in roof-top restaurant. We resisted, but finally ate dinner in their sultan-recipe restaurant and it was abssolute superb food (just OK service). We even liked the toiletries provided. The hotel was gracious, but not fussy - was there when you needed help, but not intrusive service. Obviously, we liked it very much and thought it should be on people's top lists (that's why we're writing this review - we NEVER do this sort of thing). The people - the conceirge, the cleaning people, the wait staff at breakfast - charming, although my favorite was the night desk manager. He was funny and I remember asking him if we had to dress up for dnner, and he said - "treat us like home." What a nice attitude (he had a 3-year old daughter, but I have forgotten his name). I don't like stuffy places, but I don't like boppy trendy places either - this hotel hit a sweet spot for us: elegant, but inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: mill88
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in the old city and walking distance from important attractions- Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern and the popular Grand Bazar. Rooms are well furnished and in good size. Breakfast spread are lavish , warm and efficent service. Hotel staff were very courteous, warm, friendly and helpful. They helped with the daily trips into the city. All in all a very good experience .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: geodive
Reviews.Content: It is a 4* hotel, and it will be judged as a 4* hotel... The personnel is exceptional The rooms are small but with an excellent bed and bathroom...(anyhow, who is going to be in Istanbul to spend his time in the room). The breakfast is ok... Most of all, the hotel is in the "hot zone" of Istanbul, the Sultanahmed, and almost everything is within walking distance I definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: carey34
Reviews.Content: We just returned back from a long holiday, in Istanbul we stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 4 nights. Istanbul is a beautiful place to visit, it was our first trip there and we'll be back again I'm sure. Ottoman Hotel Imperial is an outstanding hotel with ideal location, excellent staff. Rooms are in good size, clean, comfortable and bright. Walking distance to all the important sites and the tram line is few steps from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: cheezy60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. My partner and 4 of our friends, it was our first visit to Istanbul and I was in charge of making our hotel arrangments. I started e-mailing the hotel for advice and guidance, after going back and forth for a while decided to book it. The hotel is centrally located to all the important historic sights. Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and the Undeground Cistern are a short walk away. Excellent staff, very helpful and friendly. Guest relations person recommended many restaurants we should visit, we loved each of the restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: crawley39
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel imperial is situated on the best spot in the old part of town, surrounded by all the major historiacal and cultural sights overlooking the Aya Sofia Museum, within easy walking distance of Sultanahmet Square, Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and other main attractions and a short taxi ride from Ataturk international airport. Beautiful rooms , comfortable and elegant furnitures. Premium service.

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: jessthetrue
Reviews.Content: We were very glad we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial to stay in Istanbul. There are so many hotels in this city, could not make up our mind , after reading some review sites Ottoman Hotel Imperial was it for us. It has a wonderful location, next to Aya Sofia, short walk to Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Very nice staff, they are very kind, polite, friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our room, it was comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Class hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: rsfeal
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial for our visit to Istanbul. The most fantastic location for visiting all the historical sites. All of them are within few minutes walking distance of the hotel. Only time we used the public transportation ( by the way the tram stop is about three minutes away ) when we visited the city center Taksim. Hotel has wondefullu decorated rooms, nice comfortable bed and very clean. All staff are very helpful, friendly, so kind with a big smile on their face. Nice tasty breakfast. Very good hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful is the word”
Reviews.Author: diastime80
Reviews.Content: We a group of 5 could not be more happy with our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. First of all the location is so ideal for visiting all the sites, all within a minute or two walking distance away. If you wanted to visit the city center Taksim, that is even a short taxi ride away, there are many restaurants, shops, theater and cinemas in the area. We were all very happy with our rooms, I mean nothing huge but it was just the right size, than again we were out most of the day, only return to the room to go to sleep. Nice comfortable bed and pillows, rooms are cleaned daily. Good friendly staff, very helpful, kind, great sense of humor. Well presented breakfast. Simply Wonderful Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: bellboy2001
Reviews.Content: We spent three days touring Istanbul from the hotel, well located, positioned perfectly for all the historical attractions. Across the hotel is Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque , Topkapi palace and the Underground Cistern are literally minutes away by walking. Guest relation person was very helpful in organizing our daily activities. All staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room overlooking Hagia Sofia which was in good size, comfortable and very clean. Variety of choice of food on the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: zafiroldy
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial was in a fabulous position as we could walk to so many main attractions as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazar, Bosphorus, Spice Market etc... Room was in a nice size, comfortable and was all very clean. The breakfast buffet which was included was very comprehensive. Wonderful in fact. The staff were very friendly and helpful with all request. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great choice”
Reviews.Author: flightworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Sultanahmet for all the major sites around the old city. Very comfortable rooms and the highlight of the hotel was the considerate, kind, helpful and friendly staff who go the extra mile for that extra client comfort. Would highly recommend ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean boutique hotel in a perfect location with respect to historical sites”
Reviews.Author: LondonSam786 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, well-kept, 4* boutique hotel located in the heart of Sultanahmet. In terms of location, it is hard to beat if your main interest is sightseeing - it is located a stone's throw (literally) away from a number of amazing buildings / sites such as Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The staff are polite and friendly. There are many nice restaurants / eating places in the vicinity of the hotel. Facilities are what you would expect from a good 4* hotel - basic but functional, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, ideal location for a base”
Reviews.Author: hyperhouse
Reviews.Content: Charming Turkish style with a special visitor adviser to help guests enjoy their visit to Istanbul. fantastic location close to all the major sights in the old part of town. Very good breakfast, multilanguage reception, welcome atmosphere, lots of great cafes and restaurants around the hotel area. Rooms are nicely decorated, in good useable size, comfortable bed and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it, you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: asherblue
Reviews.Content: This hotel in every way will not disappoint you. You'll love the location as we did, right next to Hagia Sofia, short walk to Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, the famous Grand Bazar is about a good 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, but it's a pleasent walk, or you could take the tram which will only take you about 5 minutes. There are so many good Turkish restaurants around Sultanahmet area, it was hard to choose which one to go to. Beautiful rooms, well decorated, nicely furnished, in good size, comfortable and clean. Every one of the staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: wildfire62
Reviews.Content: You could not have asked for a better location to be to visit all the important sites.
