Hotel is located nicely on a cobble side street next to Hagia Sofia and only a short walk to Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, the Grand Bazar, Bosphorus, Spice Market etc.. Rooms are well presented, comfortable and very clean. Good looking breakfast buffet with many variety of food. Staff are very welcoming, friendly and helpful, full of smiles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all around”
Reviews.Author: rayban78
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was an excellent choice. Every one of the staff were friendly , helpful and kind at all times. Room was always clean and had everything we needed when requested. Breakfast was delicious. The hotel's location was one of the best, most historical sites, banks, post office, stores, restaurants etc.. are around the corner. Based on our great experience, I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there when we visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find”
Reviews.Author: harl810
Reviews.Content: the hotel is amazing, staff did an excellent job of making us comfortable and the guest relation were most hospitable and helpful. The lcation next to the Hagia Sofia makes it a prime place to bgin touring the Sultanahmet area were all the important hisorical sites are located. Good, clean comfortable rooms, all amenities for daily use are provided, so are bath robe and slippers. Would highly recommend this hotel mainly due to location and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience”
Reviews.Author: andy76el
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to Istanbul, this time we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial, it's a wonderful hotel, very good staff, very helpful, always willing to go that extra mile to make sure you have a pleasent experience in Istanbul. What a wonderful location, nearby just about everything , Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, Underground Cistern, Spice Market and more. Lot's of delicious Turkish cuisine rerstaurants close to the hotel in the Sultanahmet area, do try the hotels restaurant at least once if you get, they also serve excellent food. Rooms are clean and comfortable, not huge but in good size.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: spicysoup
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticks all the boxes: best of all is its ultra convenient and surprisingly peaceful setting within Sultanahmet, opposite Hagia Sophia and a few minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque. But it doesn't rest on its laurels: I was impressed by how spacious our standard room was, clean and comfortable with fixtures and fittings in tip top condition. Most memorable is the breakfast: the restaurant has great views and a fantastic spread including lots of Turkish treats in addition to the usual stuff, the only disappointment being the instant coffee. Some of the staff were really charming, one or two seemed a bit aloof. All in all, fantastic value for money , I'd definitely stay here again, though I'd probably splash out on a room with a view. I've already recommended the Ottoman Imperial to several friends planning to go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: bornfree0009
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for our first visit to Turkey. The hotel set the tone for our trip. Perfectly located to all the cultural hotspots in Istanbul. We walked everywhere , to Hagia Sophia ( which was right across the hotel ), Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazar and even to the Ferry station for our Bosphorus tour. For the night out to the clubs we took a cab to the Taksim area. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet which was included in the room rate was delicious. Overall we had a wonderful experience and we would definitely stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: danushio
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located directly in the neighbourhood of Hagia Sofia and within five minute ealking distance to the Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. The hotel is the ideal base for sightseeing in the Sultanahmet area. Visiting the Galata quartes is easy because there are couple of tram stops close to the hotel. Individuallt furnished hotel offers a neat and familiar charm. One of the most impressive part was the service offered by the reception and the guest relations desk. The staff are not only deeply professional and fulfil all of your wishes, but also give you the feeling of beign treated more as a friend than just a guest. Gueasr rooms are very comfortable, nicely decorated, very clean, all the amenities you would need for your stay and free wifi. Good choice of spread for breakfast. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family back home and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, 5 star saff”
Reviews.Author: feelingood11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a fantastic location. The Hagia Sofia is across the street, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are around the corner and the Grand Bazar a 10 minute walk. The staff spoke well English and were very profeesional, pleasent, friendly and very helpful. Breakfast buffet included was quite a variety of many typical Turkish cheeses and breads, fruit, eggs, cereal etc... The rooms , lobby etc.. were attractively decorated and looked fresh and clean. they provide robes, slippers and more toiletries than I have ever seen in much more expensive hotel. There is a lovely large park in fron of the Blue Mosque in the evening we enjoyed relaxing there ( when the weather allowed ) whatching the local families and the tea sellers go by. We found the public transport in Istanbul to be excellent, there are two tram stops close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff, good stay”
Reviews.Author: fatema25
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located ideally for visiting all the major historical sights. Located on a side cobble street looking over Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are located just around the corner within 3-5 minute walk away. Also there are many Turkish cuisine restaurants within a short walk from the hotel serving delicious food. We had a wonderful room, comfortable , clean, bright and in good size, most of the days we were out visiting sights and the surrounding area. Breakfast which is included in the rates was delicious. All staff truly go out of their way to make your stay a good one. They were all very friendly and helpful/

Reviews.Title: “Looked after very well”
Reviews.Author: rootbeer60
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul, decided to get away here for a short weekend break. Our friends who has visited Istanbul and stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial recommended the hotel to us. From the moment we arrived we were looked after like a king. Hotel is located perfectly for all the sights we wanted to visit, didn't had to walk for Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, we did take the tram to visit the Grand Bazar although it can be walked in 15-20 minutes, it's a nice walk through the local area. Staff were superb, helped us out with many inquiries, suggesting many great places to visit in a short time. They were very kind, polite, friendly with always a wonderful smile on their faces. No complaint about the room, it was clean, airy, comfortable with free wifi. Nice choice of food for breakfast both hot and cold and both local and international.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in an unrivalled location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah19London
Reviews.Content: Hotel was small and intimate, well decorated and comfortable. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. Location was unparalleled just a stones throw from the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. All in all highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: franswan18
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial was agrand choice. The staff and the service provided by the hotel met our every need and the transfer we requested from the airport was easy and smooth. The hotel provided a sultan character of Turkey, beautifully designed and colorful. Breakfast buffet was delicious and the view from the dining area was great. We had a very comfortable room, I would say with confidence that all rooms are well located, quite and clean. Very ideal location to visit all the museums, none of them are far away from the hotel, matter effect Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel. We were sad to leave Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, good experience”
Reviews.Author: adelaide80
Reviews.Content: All of us are pretty well travelled people and I would say we're all a bit fussy about which hotel to stay and the hotel service. Just spend 3 nights at this wonderful hotel and we were all impressed with the quality of the location, decor and the service. Location is perfect as it's across the cobble street from Hagia Sofia and walking distance from most important ancient sights. The Bosphorus and public transportation to many other areas of the city. Hotel is tastefuly decorated and clean, comfortable beds and pillows, bright and well appointed rooms, there is a Wifi connection in the rooms. Breakfast buffet is very good, during the summer it's served on the terrace located at the back of the hotel, it was a bit chilly for now. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SinaHamburg
Reviews.Content: I come from Germany and I always fly to istanbul. And in my opinion the OTTOMAN HOTEL IMPERIAL is the best botique hotel from all in istanbul. I recommend this hotel for every one. For singles, for families.... Because the hotel is very very clean, the food I love it there, the stuff they are the best. Congratulation for Handan, Merih and Erhan. They were so helpfull and so friendly and they can speak english really perfect. As I said I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “uma experiencia surpreendente”
Reviews.Author: marciomartins2
Reviews.Content: It is a great experience my visit to Istambul. Particularlly because the hotel was simply outstanding. the people were amazingly gentle, helpfull, friedly. I mean everybody One person in particular was extremelly friendly. his name is Erhan Dezen. I strongly recomend this hotel. I plan to be back and stay longer in Istambul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in the Old Part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: drlehman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located if you are touring Istanbul. Three of the major sites are within walking distance. The hotel is very nice...has a wonderful breakfast and restaurant. The value is exceptional....one of better hotels we have stayed in in Europe. Located with a reasonbable distance of several very nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to all at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: murdon24
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about this lovely hotel. Staff were out fo this world, so friendly and helpful, making sure we enjoyed every minute of our stay there, always willing to answer any questions we had, suggested many great areas to visit outside of the usual touristic sights. Located in the heart of Sultanahmet Square area your not to far away from the hidtorical sights. Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque are a short walk away, while Hagia Sofia is right next to the hotel. On the othet side of the hotel Undeground Cistern is located. Rooms are pleasent, clean and comfortable. Good choice of food for breakfast, both hot and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the historic tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: IainJC Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent location for visiting the sights of Istanbul. Service level was very good and you're sure of a restful stay in very comfortable accommodation. The decore is a little over the top and Disney-fied for my liking but the staff's faux-Ottoman dress was entertaining if nothing else. Don't try and eat in the local area unless you like pushy waiters and paying too much for food and way too much for drinks. If you're happy with the price, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an incomparable location”
Reviews.Author: PeterAllott
Reviews.Content: The staff were very kind and helpful and spoke good English. The rooms were immaculately well-kept and big enough for a leisure traveller. My room looked out directly on to the Hagia Sophia which was amazing. Dressing gowns and slippers were provided free.The hotel restaurant is really very good even if it is not the cheapest place to eat. Breakfast was plentiful and good quality and a free English-language newspaper was provided. Free juice was always available in the reception area. The hotel has wifi but I didn't bring my laptop. They had a computer for guests to use which was fine if a little slow.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, enjoyed the stay very much”
Reviews.Author: judwell32
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 6 days about a year ago and loved it so much that we came back in January 2011 for 3 days. One of the reasond we enjoyed the hotel so much is the very warm welcomw we received the first time we stayed and also for the perfect location of the hotel. Everything is a shorty walking distance , including couple of trams stops. The restaurant is a wonderful place to end the day after visiting all the historical sights. Personal at the hotel is wonderful, very friendly, very helpful, educated well in terms of tourism and they all do their best to make you feel comfortable. Highly recommended, it's the place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: wildbarries
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul with a work colleague for a meeting in November, stayed at Ottoman Imperial for 2 nights. Very pleased with the hotel, although did not have much time to visit the torustic sites but I can see all the attractions were a short walk away from the hotel. Nice comfortable rooms, clean and airy. Good choice of food for breakfast. Next time I have to have a proper visit to Istanbul so I could I visit all Istanbul offers, it's a beautiful city and I would surely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: showroomtogo
Reviews.Content: Vacationing with the family we all agreed that the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a wonderful place to stay, has a superb location and very attentive, friendly and helpful staff. You'll never get lost as Hagia Sofia is right next to the hotel. Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are also close by just a couple of minute walk away. The rooms are very clean with tall cealings, nicely decorated with beautiful furniture. Good choice of food for breakfast. We had a delightful experience to add to our memories of our trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GerryS01
Reviews.Content: The Ottomoman Imperial is a an outstanding boutique hotel right in the heart of the main Sultanahmet attractions. It is located right next to the Hagia Sophia and seconds from the Blue Mosque, yet on a quiet street. The hotel is well appointed and charming - our double room had a very comfortable queen-sized bed, along with a separate sizeable ensuite bathroom which gave us ample room to spread out. The hotel decor and finishes were stylish and charming, and the breakfast room provides great views across the Sultanahment rooftops. The breakfast itself was excellent and catered for a wide range of tastes. Ask for a Turkish Coffee! In addition to excellent facilities, the staff were exceptionally friendly and eager to assist. Over a four day stay we established quite a rapport with most of them, and they went out of their way (management and front-line staff) to help us with a number of travel itinerary and lost luggage problems we encountered. We could not recommend this hotel more highly!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: mcd724
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the perfect spot to visit Istanbul. It is located just across from the Hagia Sophia and all of the main attractions of Sultanahmet are within walking distance. It is also has two tram stops close by that make getting to Taksim or Asian Istanbul quite easy. The staff were friendly. The room was small but well appointed. Our stay was only marked by one incident. There was a party in the garden room that also serves as the breakfast room with drums and loud music. It went on until about 1 am. After a long day of touring, it made relaxing and getting some sleep virtually impossible. It did have free wi-fi in the room which made staying in touch and planning our days easier. Other than that, no real complaints. The location pretty much made up for any downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes you want to feel like your at home”
Reviews.Author: flybird65
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about Ottoman Hotel Imperial, everyone at the hotel made us feel like we were at home. Staff are friendly and very helpful, very informative on what to visit, how to get there, restaurants around the hotel vicinity, times the museums open and close etc... We had a very pleasent room, it was clean, spacious and comfortable, had all the amenities we needed for our stay, free wiffi in the room and around the hotel. Excellent location, close to all the attractions, Blue Mosque, Topakpi Palace, Underground Cistern, Aya Sofia museum are all a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “marvelous place to stay, fab location.”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy4
Reviews.Content: I would surelly recommend this hotel to any one who are going to be visiting Istanbul. Fabulous location, everything is short walking distance away. Many great Turkish cuisine restaurants are located near the hotel around Sultanahmet square area, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazar, Bosphorus are all short walk away. There are two tram stops near by the hotel which we used to visit the city center area called Taksim. Nicely presented rooms , well decorated, comfortable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Turkish Experience”
Reviews.Author: cougartail
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time in Istanbul and with our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial was the topping on the cake. All staff were absolutely helpful. charming and very professional-always with a big smile , alsways asking if there was anything else we needed and if we were comfortable etc... The hotel is so handy to everything and surrounded by great cafes, restaurants and shopping arae. It's the perfect location. we felt safe and welcome and the Turkish peopke are wonderful, warm, kind, helpful and very friendly. Rooms are bright, airy, spacious, comfortable and clean. Free wifi in the room is a good bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further, this is the one!”
Reviews.Author: wallsea
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip advisor and we're glad we did. We were very happy with the hotel and our stay, idealy located in the old town, it's a fantastic place to be based as every historical and touristic attractionsare within minutes walk away. We all had a very lovely room, very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was great with variety of choices. Staff were very helpful and friendly especially young lady at the guest relations desk, sorry to say could not remember her name. We would recommend this hotel to rest of our family and friens who are planing to visit Istanbul in the near future. Thank you Ottoman Hotel Imperial

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets, can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: ellisbuggy
Reviews.Content: Bunch of us met up in Istanbul for our friends wedding and this hotel was an excellent choice. First of all it has an amazing location, walking distance from Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, grand Bazar etc... All staff were outstanding, friendly and charming. They really welcomed us with open arms, almost felt like home away from home. The rooms were nice, different sizes, had plenty of room, it was comfortable and clean with a nice ensuite bathroom. I would definitely recommend the hotel and if I were to go back to Istanbul, looks like we;re going to make a quite a bit of trip to visit our friend, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: rugbyruby
Reviews.Content: Very lovely charming boutique hotel in the heart of the historical Sultanahmet distric. The hotel is located at walking distance from the tramway and all the main attractions as : the Blue Mosque, St.Sophia museum, the grand bazar, Topkapi Place and many other sites. Autentic oriental interior deisgn, rooms are beautiful, very clean ( as the clean it every day ), wonderfully decorated, comfortable bed and in good size. Very friendly and dedicated staff with great tourist information desk where they will provide you information on what to visit and how to get around Istanbul, excellent tips and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “True Choice”
Reviews.Author: AyÅŸegÃ¼l K
Reviews.Content: As an advice I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Great location because I saw Hagia Sophia from the window of my room. It was just over. Ottoman made me feel in diffirent atmosphere. Very clean room, helpful staff. Ottoman has garden restaurant and winter restaurant both. I will definitly advice to my foreign friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, superb location.”
Reviews.Author: happytimes25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location as we were able to walk to so many attractions as Aya Sofia, Tpkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazar, Spice Market and the Bosphoruse. We did take a taxi to visit the city center area called Taksim, which has many restaurants, shops, cinemas, bars and cafees, althought you can take the tram, there are two tram stops very close to the hotel. Our room was just the right size, not huge but not small either, was very clean, comfortable and the bathroom was good, had all the amenities you need during your visit. The breakfast was great, many choices of food to choose from. The staff were very helpful with all request.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: PerlaLluy
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! Services + Ambiance +Restaurant The New Years Gala was excelelent, The Breakfast Buffet very good and Dinner Menu very very good. I will comeback!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sharpshooter35
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay if you are visiting istanbul and interested in seeing all the historical sights without walking to far. The hotel itself is quite nice, walking distance to Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Undeground Cistern and Aya Sofia museum. There are many restaurants and cafees around the surrounding area, got to try some of the Turkish cuisines, it's lovely, locatioon is alos in a very safe area, in the heart of the old town of Istanbul Sultanahmet. What a lovely staff, allways there to help and give out good ideas of what to do and where to visit. Rooms are comfortable, nothing to complaint about. Breakfast buffet has a variety of dishes both hot and cold, both international and local. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Jewel”
Reviews.Author: rainforest2001
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is so perfect you can walk to all the tour sites from the hotel. The staff recommended an outstanding nearby restaurant, which was delicious. We ate at the hotel restaurant on our first night and it was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful recommended where to go and what to do. They recommended a night time cultural dance and music show including belly dancer which was worth the trip alone. We stayed 3 nights which was enough to see everything. Rooms are nicley decorated, well presented, very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for visiting the old city”
Reviews.Author: swansea2267
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel for several reasons : 1. Location, location, location, literally across the street from Hagia Sofia on a beautiful cobble street and close to other historical sights as Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, it's also very close to public transportation. 2. The breakfast which was included in the room rate was amazing. 3: The service was excellent, staff's are very helpful, friendly anf kind. 4: Rooms are very nice, clean, bright and a very comfortable bed. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base for an Istanbul trip - with a few provisos!”
Reviews.Author: PRFluffy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a fabulous break in Istanbul at the Ottoman Imperial, which is the most perfectly located hotel for all the big sights (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace etc etc). Be warned, ladies, that the street outside and in the surrounding area are cobbled - heeled shoes will not cut the mustard! The staff at the hotel are lovely - really really friendly and incredibly helpful. One strong point of advice is to trade up in room terms if you can, because the base level rooms are situated on the main corridor from the reception to the lift, or on the street side, and must be very loud! We paid the extra for a deluxe room which was really comfortable, overlooking the restaurant patio, with the most amazing bed I've ever slept in in my life! Soooo comfortable! However, they're a bit let down by the bathrooms - getting in and out of the shower (over the bath) was a bit like an Olympic event and despite being healthy and fit (and 6ft tall each) both of us ended up with huge bruises from slipping when getting in or out! Also, if you're a light sleeper, take ear plugs as the noise in the corridors was unbearable on occasion (I think this may have been a combination of an incredibly noisy French family being split through three rooms on our floor and the marble floors, but it's worth saying). The buffet breakfast was amazing - fresh and filled with all sorts of local delicacies (make sure you try the sesame paste with jam on croissants - sensational!) and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Every morning an army of staff appeared to clean and polish everything, and it was all spotless! Definitely a hidden gem - but beware of those bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “Well presented hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaue33
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel in the heart of the historical Sultanahmet district. The hotel is located at walking distance from the tramway and the main attractions like : the Blue Mosque, St. Sophia museum, the grand bazar, Topkapi Palace and many other sites. Authentic oriental interior design, very friendly and dedicated staff with good tourist information desk. Our stay was really perfect. A Beautiful , well run and well located hotel. The rooms are nicely furnished, comfortable. We highly recommend this delightful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: goodadventure
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a perfect place to visit all the major historical sights. Across from Hagia Sofia and a short walk to Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Grand Bazar is about a good 15-20 minute walk, althought you could take the tram which will get you there in 5 minutes, there are couple of tram stops near the hotel. Area surrounding the hotel Sultanahmet Square has many restaurants to try out variety of Turkish cuisine. Rooms are comfortable, clean, has all the amenities you need away from home, free wifi in room is a plus. Good choice o food for breakfast. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Always willing to go that extra step to make sure you have a enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Delight”
Reviews.Author: ancrew
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better hotels we have stayed during our visit to Istanbul and this is our fourth visit to this lovely city. From every point of view from the managment team, staffs professional attitude, housekeeping, front reception, guest relation people it's top class. When it comes to location, it's one of the best, so close to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace,Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Underground Cistern, Spice Market, Bosphorus , trams stop, restaurants around Sultanahmet Square. Rooms are very well presented, very clean and bed is comfortable. We would stay here for sure on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “You won't find a better hotel than Ottoman Hotel Imperial for location and service”
Reviews.Author: may67_10
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport by the Ottoman car for our complimentary trip to the hotel and spent four nights in total at the Ottoman Imperial. I'm happy to state that the level of service and care did not stray from high level during our stay. Our room was very spacious and the Ottoman decor was a pleasent change from the usual hotel style. Room was comfortable, bright, clean ovelooking Hagia Sofia. Breakfast which was included in the price had good choice of food. Excellent location, it's located across Hagia Sofia and a short walk to Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern ( located on the other side of the hotel ). Grand Bazar, spice market are also not far away. Thank you to the team of Ottoman Imperial for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “We will take back the great memories of Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: livelygirl89
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul, there are so many hotels to choose from , we wanted to be close to all the major attractions also not far away from the local life and the city center . After looking over the reviews on trip advisor we decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial. After spending 4 days in Istanbul and 3 nights at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, we knew we made the right chose by choosing the hotel and wondered why we had not visited Istanbul before as it's a beautiful city. The great location of the hotel was exactly what we were looking for, it's close to all the sights, Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and the Topkapi Palace are within few minutes away . There are two tram stops near the hotel, which we used to visit the Grand Bazar and the city center Taksim. Around the hotel there are many restaurants that serves delicious Turkish cuisine. The room we stayed in was in decent size, not huge but not small either, it was comfortable and cleaned every day. Staff were so nice and friendly. We will share our good experience in Istanbul and at Ottoman Hotel Imperial with our friends and family. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: timmer53
Reviews.Content: There are many affirmative things to say about Ottoman Hotel Imperial, the breakfast buffet is very good with large variety of Turkish and International hot and cold food, the rooms are comfortable, well looked after and prepared with a great view of Agia Sofia, infact the hotel is located on a quite street along side Agia Sofia, the whole staff are very friendly and helpful. Wireless internet works properly. Most of the major sights are all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in town”
Reviews.Author: hillbilly56
Reviews.Content: If there is one place to stay in Istanbul that is close to the old city sights and is comfortable, quite, with helpful staff, Ottoman Hotel Imperial has to be it. We stayed in select room with views across a narrow street into Hagia Sofia, very comfortable and clean. Meals were of excellent quality. The hotel is so convenient for walking to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace , Hippodrome and Basilica Cistern, all within 3 to 5 minutes with the Grand Bazar and the Spice Market under 15 minutes. The efficient tram system is within 50 metres and can move you through the chaotic traffic so easily to across Galata Bridge to the new part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay , friendly staff, great service”
Reviews.Author: serena-3540
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an unbelievable find, it has an amazing location, walking distance from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Grand Bazar etc... the staff were ouystanding, friendly and charming. They helped plan our days and were aleays available for a friendly conversation and advise. The room was great and plenty of room forus. Rooms was very comfortable and clean and it had a very nice en suite bathroom. I would definitely recommend the hotel and if we were to visit Istanbul again we would for sure stay here again. Thank you to all Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff for making our visit very enjoyable and one to remember for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: lisafogel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within walking distance of Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Ayasofya, and the Bazaar. The room I stayed in was nicely appointed, but a friend's bathroom was out-dated and difficult to maneuver around. The staff is accomodating and want your visit to a favorable one. The breakfast buffet was good, large selection of different items for breakfast. Our one disappointment was dinner at the hotel. The meal was over-priced and our entrees were not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: oshea4540
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location on a quite cobble street just next to Hagia Sofia and a short walking distance from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and the Basilica Cistern. We enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, they were all lovely. My partner and I were there to celebrate our 8th year anniversary and requested a romantic room. Hotel decorated the room with roses and had a bouquet of flowers. It was very thoughtful of the hotel, we appreciate it alot, thank you very much. We loved the hotel so much we will recommend it to all our friends and family when we return back home.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Times”
Reviews.Author: sailblue
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect. Better than many hotels we have stayed during our trip around Europe. Located wonderfuly in the center of old town , all major sightseeing attractions are within short walk way. Rooms are very clean with comfortable bed, nice, cozy and attractive. Good breakfast buffet, many choice of both hot and cold dishes. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sunnyside32
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best possible location in Istanbul for seeing the main sights and has easy access to athe airport and rest of the city as the tram stop is only few minutes walk away. The hotel it's self is of a good standard, spotlessly clean and offers a varied buffet at breakfast which makes for a great start to the day. Rooms are very comfortable.I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for great value in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, great staff, would come back”
Reviews.Author: brookjwild
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Istanbul and Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff made it that much better. They are lovely people , friendly, kind and helpful. Hotel itself is in a perfect location for visiting all the sights without walking to far. Everything is so close by, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Grand Bazar, Spice Market, Bosphoruse, Gulhane Park, tram stop, restaurants etc.. and I could go on. Rooms are in good size, not very large but not very small either, just right, it's very comfortable has all the amenities you would need when your away from home. I would surely come back and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: simner2001
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Location is unfeatable, walking distance to the Grand Bazar, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Yerebatan Sarnici, Gulhane Park, Bibirdirect Sarnisci, Archeological Museum, Blue Mosque and much more. The staff will bend over backwards to make your stay a very enjoyable one. Do not hesiate to contact them or ask them for imformation, they will always have a warm smile and all their best attention to help out. Our room was wonderful. Breakfast was great, restaurant is nicely situated with a good view of the surrounding monuments.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, staff and the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: raja_shine
Reviews.Content: We stayad at Ottoman Hotel Imperial begining of November, we chose the Ottoman Hotel Imperial mainly due to it's central location- we made the roght choice. Our room and bathroom, though not large, were most comfortable, bright, quite and very clean. The staff were delightful, always polite and could not have been more helpful. Breakfast buffet was well presented. All your major attractions within short walk away. We hope to visit Istanbul again and we would definitely choose and recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial to friends. .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: factor2300
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is very good, most of the interesting places as Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and Grand Bazar are within walking distance away. Hotel staff were very helpful, friendly and polite. The rooms were comfortable, bright , airy and cleaned regularly every morning, our room was always clean, neat and tidy everytime we returned back to the hotel after sightseeing. Breakfast buffet which was included in the room rate had good choice of hot and cold dishes, hotel resaturant serves delicious Turkish cuisine which we had a chance to taste on our first night. Sultanahmet square has many restaurants for everyone's taste, even Mcdonals for the little ones is a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: inergy68
Reviews.Content: All aspect of our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial was wonderful. Hotel provided us a airport transfer service which was great , saved us the taxi cost. Location of the hotel is superb, right in the centre of Sultanahmet area on a quite cobble street. Short walk to all the major attractions. Our room was beautiful, nicely put together, well decorated, comfortable , clean, bright with robes and slippers and overlooking Hagia Sofia. Breakfast was a pleasent surprise , large buffet to suite all tastes. Staff were wonderful, all very helpful and friendly, spoke well english. Would highly recommend this hotel, we've already recommend it to some of our friends who are planning to visit Istanbul next year.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Travelteh
Reviews.Content: i find the location excellent. This place is right in the heart of Sultanahmet,and right next to Agia Sofia. All the important historical buildings are within short walking distance. The rooms are not very big, but nice. Staffs are friendly and eager to help. Well, couldn't ask for more. Do take feedback positively.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: teddybear59
Reviews.Content: Good location, good food, wonderful staff, especially the guest relations personal was brilliant. She booked up lots of things for us so we did not have to queue and was so enthusiastic and helpful. The restaurant the breakfast is served is very nice, with good choice of food. Our room was clean and comfortable. Close to all the major sights, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Undeground Cistern, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar are all within a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: bwgoneeast
Reviews.Content: Good location, just a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern. Upon arriving to the hotel one of the staff members provided us with a map of Istanbul and gave us excellent tips on what to see and how to get there. The room was clean, comfortable, in good size, bright and well decorated. Breakfast was good with a nice variety of food. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again if we return back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: snowtown_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the perfect location for visiting all the sights and museums. Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Spice Market, Bosphoruse, Underground Cistern,Tram stop etc... are all within a short walking distance away. Nice comfortable well decorated rooms, our room was a bit on the small side but no problem as we spent most of our days sightseeing onnly in the room to sleep. We have seen rooms in larger size, guess it depends on the rate you pay. Breakfast had good choice of food. All staff were nice, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location, great staff (especially the concierge), only OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: buffet boy
Reviews.Content: The staff did a marvelous job making us comfortable and the concierge along with her lovely Russian intern were most hospitable and helpful. Of course the location next to the Hagia Sophia makes it a prime place to begin touring Sultanhamet. But the rooms are oddly concieved with very short bathtubs that require a very high step-up to enter. Also, the way they are graded, standard, deluxe, etc. is strange with upgraded rooms looking less than an upgrade than standard. Would recommend mainly because of location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, top class service”
Reviews.Author: dsaw79
Reviews.Content: I wont go into to much details, just have to say this is a fabulous hotel to stay while visiting this wonderful city. Located perfectly close to all the major attractions, Hagia Sofia is right next to the hotel with The Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace few minute walk away. Staff are always friendly and helpful when ever you need them. Good size rooms, no so large and not so small, comfortable beds and very clean. All in all it's a very well runned hotel, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to get away for a short weekend break”
Reviews.Author: ramugistanbul
Reviews.Content: Group of 6 of us visited Istanbul for the first time for a weekend break , we all wondered why we had not visited this beautiful city before. We all decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial based on it's wondeful location and reading the positive reviews posted on travel sites. We loved the city and enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Hotel is located near to all the important sights , next to Hagia Sofia, short walk to Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. There are couple of tram stops near the hotel, which we used to take the tram to the Grand Bazar ( altough it can be walked, about 15 minutes ) and Taksim the city centre. Rooms are well decorated, in good size, beds are comfortable, everything is very clean. Breakfast buffet which was included in the rate was well presented, good choice of both international and turkish cuisine. All staff from the minute we walked in were very friendly and helpful, spoke well English.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, wonderful location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: flymoon22
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our short stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. It's centrally located, with easy access to all important historical attractions. We would have loved to stay longer. Our room was very comfortable and clean, overlooking Hagia Sofia which is located across the hotel. Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are within 2 minutes walk away. The staff are all extremly helpful, friendly and attentive. We had a dinner in the hotel restaurant on our first night the food was delicious and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A + For Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: willboy94
Reviews.Content: We are well travelled people, very fuzzy about hotel services. Just spend 5 nights at this hotel and was impressed with the quality of location, decor, service. Location is superb, across the street from Hagia Sofia near most important ancient sights, the Bosphorus and public transportation to many other city areas. The decor is very tasteful and clean, good beds and pillows, bright, clean and well appointed rooms with views increasingly beautiful as room categories increase. Wifi connection in rooms. Breakfast is very good, served in a beauriful terrace if the weather permits otherwise werved in the restaurant. The staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure”
Reviews.Author: sunborn69
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful city Istanbul is to visit, dont know why it took my wife and I this long to pay oue first visit. Anyway we booked Ottoman Hotel Imperial after reading the positive reviews on this site and for the ideal location. We were very happy with our stay no major problems, perfect location, close to all the historical sites, good size rooms , clean and comfortable, good choice of food on the breakfast buffet. We would stay here again and recommend the hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: marie8922
Reviews.Content: We were very happy we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial during our visit to Istanbul. The most perfect location for visiting major attractions , all of them are within few minutes walking distance of the hotel. Only time time we used public transportation is when we visited the city centre Taksin which we went with a taxi about 15 minutes and the Grand Bazar which we used the tram, there are two tram stops near the hotel. Hotel has wonderfully decorated rooms, nice comfortable bed and spotless clean. Staff are very friendly , helpful, kind and polite. Good choice of food for breakfast. Excellent hotel to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location and Beds”
Reviews.Author: svldc
Reviews.Content: While Sulanahmet is touristy for my taste, there is a reason -- much of Turkey's historic mosques, palaces, bazaars and the sea are nearby. The Ottoman lived up to its reviews on Trip Advisor. The staff was so helpful, and the hotel immaculate. We moved from an older room that was really nice. Its view was spectacular and you could clarly hear the call to prayer from several nearby mosques. The new renovation was much larger and accommodated a third person comfortably. Turkish breakfasts were good too.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul beauty”
Reviews.Author: 48luke
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a great experience because of the friendly and efficient staff, excellent location and the delicious food. We stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed beign right in the heart of Sultanahmet. The hotel is located next to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace so it's within easy walking distance to many mojor sights. We enjoyed an extensive and delicious breakfast buffet out on the terrace while listening traditional Turkish music. The staff were extremely helpful and thoughful during our stay. The rooms were clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, ideal location, pleasent staff”
Reviews.Author: ivan67_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial with our five years old son for 4 nights and we were immensely pleased with the hotel, the beautiful and tasteful decoration of the room, the professionalism of the staff and the excellent location of the hotel just across the street from Hagia Sofia and a few minutes walk through cobble streets from Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. The breakfast was very good and varied and nicely presented and the whole stay at the hotel was very pleasent. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Fantastic Location, Excellent Service, Warm and Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: LynnandErdal
Reviews.Content: A gorgeous hotel, our second stay here and we were not disappointed. Busy days enjoying the hustle and bustle of Istanbul and then a relaxing drink on the gorgeous terrace with just the tinkling of the fountains. Enjoyed a rich Turkish breakfast on the terrace under the heater with a complimentary blanket, a huge bonus and not expected in November ! Just as gorgeous as it was in June on our last visit. Perfect location two minutes from the Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque. We will definately be back to our beloved Istanbul and certainly to the Ottoman Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ilkmare99
Reviews.Content: Very charming and beautiful hotel, perfect location as your few steps away from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Rooms were wonderful, comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was delicious and offered variety of wonderful food. All staff were excellent. Guest Relation person came around and introduced herself to us when we were checking in and assked if they can help with planning our visit or make any reservation for us. They were all friendly and helpful, provided us with fantastic suggestions for restaurants and places to see. Comfortable rooms with all the amenities you would need during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great location, really warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: citybreakqueen
Reviews.Content: Just the perfect location. We had ambitious plans to go sight seeing further afield in Istanbul, but really everything you really want to see is within walking distance of this hotel. Lovely staff, and trustworthy. Breakfast isnt great, but all served with a smile and well presented. Lovely terrace for a beer. Would highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends. An employee named Erhan was particularly helpful. The taxi pick up from the airport was very good. But dont trust the yellow cabs. They will try and rip you off.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: wan8821
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for a short break , stayed at ottoman Hotel Imperial based on the reviews on this site, we were all very pleased with the hotel , wonderful location , marvelous staff, beautiful hotel. Location can not be beaten , right by Sultanahmet Square, the old town, all the historical sites are around you, dont have to walk far to visit them. Sultanahmet Square is full of excellent Turkish cuisine restaurants, wow some of the dishes are delicious. Rooms are in good condition, all the amenities are provided, free wifi in the room was a great bonus. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value”
Reviews.Author: adventurebuzz12
Reviews.Content: The family stayed here for only two nights and we were very impressed with the service provided. Staff bends over backward to make your stay one that you would remember and talk about for a long time. They are so helpful and friendly, very polite abd very professional. Other plus side of Ottoman Hotel Imperial is the perfect location, your steps away from all the historical sites and a tram or a cab ride to the city centre. Rooms are well furnished, nicely decorated, comfortable beds and super clean. Dont hesitate to book this hotel, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality, great location”
Reviews.Author: injeanious
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for my visit to Istanbul! It was walking distance to everything. You do have to walk alot in Istanbul but this hotel is up a steep street, so definitely take that into consideration when booking if thats a problem. I would not recommend the single room. I barely had room to open my suitcase and switched to a double after the first night. Double room was still small but decorated nicely. You could hear praying 5 times a day but I found it peaceful, although the room was noisy (stayed in the back part of the hotel behind the restaurant). The service was fabulous. Front desk and staff were so helpful, knowledgeable and hospitable. They helped with suggestions, my room change and even fixing my broken suitcase. I was very impressed. Breakfast was a reasonable selection, varied slightly day to day. The only other caution I might mention, is that its hard to get in and out of the tub/shower, you have to use a stepstool. Definitely take this into consideration if thats a problem. I also have a horrible experience with the shuttle service I booked through the hotel to the airport. They dropped me off at international not domestic, when I was going locally in Turkey and had given them this information twice. It was a long uphill walk with 3 suitcases and I was not happy! Internet in the room was spotty, although free, but the outdoor deck had internet connection and was a great place to relax with a pretty view. But I do want to end the review on a positive note because I just thought this hotel was was a pleasure! Great location and amazing hospitality!! I would take the cautions above in consideration but definitely would recommend it! I might also mention, I loved the Medusa restaurant right down the street from the hotel near the Basilica Cistern. The hotel is also convient to the trolley which the hotel gave me instructions for taking and was very direct and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosh227
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ottoman Hotel Park for its perfect location. We had arranged for someone from the hotel to pick us up at the airpot for a reasonable charge. When we arrive at the hotel we were told our room has been upgraded to the ones overlooking Hagia Sofia. Very stylish room, spacious, bright, extra small seating area and very clean. Breakfast which was included in the room rate offered a wide variety of Turkish and western style breakfast items. On our first night we decided to stay and eat our dinner in the hotel restaurant. The music and the Whirling Dervish were a nice addition. Everyone working at the hotel were pleasent and helpful. The concierge person provided us with all the maps and information we needed. We had read that the hotel was close to Hagia Sofia and the other major attractions, but we hadn't realized how close it was. Hagia Sofia is across the street from the hotel. Because of the hotel's location , we were able to enjoy them any time we wanted. We hope to return back to Istanbul in the future and we will definitely stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “we were very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: j94_bright
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Istanbul, staying at Ottoman Hotel imperial made our visit that much better. Big bonus is the location of this hotel, all the major sites are so close to the hotel. Aya Sofia is next to the hotel, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are a short walking distance away. Staff are so so nice, very helpful, gaved us many excellent suggestions on where to visit and how to get there etc... We had a very comfortable room, cozy and clean with all the amenities. Enjojed the breakfast buffet a lot, good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: normajean8801
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and basically went on the strenght of the reviews. We were very happy with the hotel, based in the old town it's a fantastic place to be based as every historical attarctions are within minute walk away. We had a very lovely room, very comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was good with variety of choices. Staff were very helpful and friendly especially the gentelmen in the reception who helped with our bags, halling a taxi for us etc.. I'm so sorry just can't remember his name. We thank him from bottom of our heart for all his help.

Reviews.Title: “Excelant reasonably priced hotel in the very center of everything”
Reviews.Author: Skewes
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel that was on a quiet street next to nearly everything to see. The staff was wonderful, especially Mr. Erhan Deger who made our stay very special. His thoughtfulness and assistance with all our needs was most appreciated. We recommend this hotel and Mr. Deger very highly. Bill and Anne Skewes

Reviews.Title: “Great view, room and especially great service”
Reviews.Author: Sport5639
Reviews.Content: Did not have the chance to especially thank the wonderful concierge at the hotel, who was not there when we left. This hotel is such good value, for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it- Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: qween061
Reviews.Content: All aspects of our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial were first class. A driver came to pick us up at the airport-saved us the taxi cost. The location is superb-right in the centre of Istanbul on a quite cobble street away from trams and trafic. Short walk to all the major attractions. Our room was lovely, overlooking Hagia Sofia, light, airy, clean, robes, slippers etc.. all the things you would like to have included while away. Breakfast was a most pleasent surprise.. huge buffet to suite all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay when visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lewdally67
Reviews.Content: Ottoman hotel Imperial is situated trully at the premium location in the old part of town Sultanahmet. All historical and cultural sites are all around you. Hagia Sofia is located next to the hotel and if your luck to get a room overlooking hagia Sofia as we were you'll be very pleased. Hotle is located in the heart of the Sultanahmet Square, Topkapi Palace is about three minutes away and the Blue Mosque is about 2 minutes away. One other plus side is it's close to the ataturk International Airport, at a non rush time and trafic it's about 20 minute cab ride. My wife and I spend 4 nights at the hotel, it was memorable experience. Very nice staff, excellent service, helpful, friendly, polite and kind. Rooms are very clean, our room was spacious with all the amenities and comfortable. Hotel has a wonderful restaurant serving delicious Turkish and International cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, good service”
Reviews.Author: IanMacPerthshire
Reviews.Content: By reading TripAdvisor reviews before booking a hotel, you can make a reasoned judgement on which positive/negative aspects matter to you. On that basis, therefore, we booked the Ottoman Imperial, so it was no surprise to find that the rooms were small, but the hotel excellently located for the Blue Mosque, the Cisterns etc. I suppose, however, that luck also comes into play, as others have noted problems with tram noise, we were on the other side of the hotel, and that factor didn't affect us. The aspect of the hotel which DID affect us was kitchen noise. Someone else noted this problem previously, and being on the ground floor with no effective sound deadening between the room and the (open) kitchen was quite irritating. After a few days, we decided to raise the matter with the hotel management. What can I say? Their response was one of the reasons behind this being an excellent 5-star review. Without going into detail (as they probably couldn't respond this way every time), they responded magnificently, and to our complete satisfaction. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “You will enjoy this hotel as much as we did”
Reviews.Author: wind56
Reviews.Content: We loved Ottoman Hotel Imperial, enjoyed every minute of our stay. Such a beautiful place, what a friendly and helpful staff. Nicely located for sight seeing all the major historical and touristic sites, all are very close within few minute walking distance. hagia Sofia is next to the hotel, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are couple of minute walk away. many restaurants and wonderful cafes are located near by the hotel, most of the restaurants serves delicious Turkish cuisine. Good choice of food for breakfast with good amount of variety. Good size room, it's not huge but it's not small either, larger than some of the other places we have stayed and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PoindexterTownsend
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be exceptional. The location is superb, our room was great, the bathroom was large and luxurious, the food at the restaurant was good, the staff were all helpful. I do want to acknowledge that some of the (few) negative reviews here do make a good point. The first room we got had a very small bathroom. That's OK, but the shower was incredibly difficult to climb in and, especially, out of. We asked to change rooms, and were switched to a room that was first rate. One negative reviews said there are lots of hotels with the same location. Obviously that's not true -- there is only one hotel at this location, and only one hotel this close to Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: istanbultreasure3456
Reviews.Content: I won't go into book size details, I just have to say this is fabulous hotel to stay while visiting this amazing city, located perfectly close to all the major attractions you would want to visit, staff are always there to help out in a second when ever you need them, nice rooms, not so small not so big, comfortable beds, all in all it's a very well runned establishment, highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: ashley6868
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough good things about ottoman Hotel Imperial. First of all the location is perfect, easily walkable to all the major sites as Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar and the Underground Cistern and if you want to visit the city centre area called Taksin it's only a short cab ride or can take the tram. Rooms are in good size, confortable bed and very clean. Excellent service, staff are wonderful very helpful and friendly. Good choice of food on the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: andy32w
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot as my partner and I are retired, this was our first visit to Istanbul, it was a city we always wanted to visit for one reason or another we didnt get the chance till now. We enjoyed ourselfs very much, hotel personal made our sstay that much better, they were always trying to help us out so we get the best of our four day stay. They are very friendly and helpful. Perfect I mean perfect location, you could walk to all the historical sites, every place you read about in the guide book. Rooms are comfortable and clean. We would for sure stay here again when we return back to Istanbul in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: aidmor
Reviews.Content: ottoman Hotel Imperial is wonderful. The location is excellent, across the street from Aya Sofia, perfect for exploring major historical sites like the Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace, Basilica Cistern, Archeological Museum, Grand Bazar etc.. as all of them are within a short walk away. If you want to vivit outside the Sultanahmet area like the city centre Taksin Square etc.. tram stop is anout 200m away. All staff are very helpful and friendly. There are two Guest Relation attendents who are very knowledgeable and very helpful. Good size rooms with comfortable bed and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, location it can not be beaten.”
Reviews.Author: hotspot33_10
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is trully located in one of the best spots in the Sultanahmet area. All major attractions are so close by, Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel, when you walk out the front door there it is, beautiful, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are two and three minutes away. Can't get a better location. Staff are out of this world, five star service, they are very lovely, friensly and helpful. Nicely decorated rooms, clean and comfortable. Good chioce of food on the breakfast buffet from Turkish to Inernational cuisines. Highly recommend this hotel, you'll love everything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit the...”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJKent
Reviews.Content: Great location to visit the sights,adjacent to Aya Sofia. The 5 stars go to Tuna the concierge/tourist consultant & her Russian assistant. Excellent service & advice on food and anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edwinhage
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in in Istanbul. Good sized rooms and bathrooms, very clean, staff is very helpful and friendly, close to many touristic attractions, and close to the tram. . Breakfast would be the only thing that could be improved.Breakfast is good but not great. Great value for money and would recommend everyone to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming, real Turkish experience”
Reviews.Author: NanMaggie
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ottoman Hotel Imperial for its location and the location is wonderful. Our travel agent had arranged for someone from the hotel to pick us up at the airport for a reasonable charge. We were with friends for a couple of days before joining a group and we wanted to visit the city at our leisure. When we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to the old building. The rooms are small but full of character. Breakfast, which was included, offered a wide variety of Turkish and western style breakfast items. Both evenings we decided to stay and eat in the hotel restaurant. The weather was perfect and we enjoyed cocktails and then dinner outside. The music and the Whirling Dervish were a nice addition. We can't say enough about the staff. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. We were pleased to meet Rita R., the concierge. She provided us with all the maps and information we needed. Erhan Deger, the bellman, was outstanding. On our last day there we had requested a cab at noon to move to the hotel where our group was meeting. It was raining and that made the crazy Istanbul traffic even worse. Yasar Celen, the manager, came to tell us that the cab driver had called and was stuck in a traffic jam. He offered to drive us to the other hotel himself. We were not in a hurry, so we declined his offer. While we waited, Erhan brought us Turkish coffee, then glasses of water. Twenty minutes later the cab had still not arrived, and Mr Celen reappeared, saying "Come. I'll drive you." I'm sure the round trip took him more than an hour because of the traffic. I had read that the hotel was close to Aya Sofya and other important places, but I hadn't realized how close. Aya Sofya is across the street from the hotel! Because of its proximity to several major sights, we were able to enjoy them any time we wanted. We visited the Basilica Cistern at 10 p.m. There were only a handful of visitors and the guards. Quite a difference from our first visit two years ago, when we went in the middle of the day. You could hardly move, it was so crowded. We hope to return to Istanbul in the not-to-distant future and when we do, we will definitely stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Allaround I would rate this hotel 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: christinwtravel
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel , my partner and I stayed for 3 nights and everyone in our party were very happy with all aspects of the hotel. Rooms were in good shape, clean and comfortable, do recommend paying a bit extra and get the nice large room. cant complaint about the location as it's within few minute walk away from all the historical attractions. Staff were excellent, full of energy , friendly , kind and very helpful. Brekafast buffet had a good choice of food

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: ywfl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. My husband and I, and 4 friends - it was our first time in Istanbul and I was responsible for making our lodging and touring arrangements. I had no idea where to start! Almost a year ahead of time, I started e-mailing this hotel for advice and guidance about what to see, the best way to hire a private guide and a driver, etc. I think I drove the staff crazy! Handan in Guest Relations was outstanding! Her advice was exactly what we needed. Her recommendations on where to have dinner each night were excellent. We loved each restaurant! The hotel is centrally located to all the important historic sights; the Haiga Sofia, the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Hippodrome are a short walk away. You will love the hotel and the outstanding staff. I can not give this hotel a higher recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: pnaymoth
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Location is unbeatable, walking distance to the Grand Bazar, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Staff will bend over backwards to help you from suggesting places to visit to making dinner reservations. Our room was wonderful, it was bright, spacious, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great and the terrace were it's served had bnice view too. This is a lovely and welcoming place .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: jw56
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed every minute of our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Perfect location, your not far away from all the major attractions, excellent staff, always there to answer any questions you might have, friendly and helpful. Nice size room , clean and comfortable, free wifiin the room was a good treat. Breakfast buffet has a plenty of vatiety of food both international and turkish. None of us would hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: scoobydow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very impressed with our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. The hotel is very clean , there is a great view from the terrace of the hotel of Cafera Medresi. We had dinner on the terrace on our last night stay and were very pleased with the food. The service provided by the hotel staff is top class. The hotel is immediately located besides Hagia Sofia and all the major touristic attractions. The Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are a stone throw away. Grand bazar and the Spice Market is a pleasent 15-20 minute walk away or a short 5 minute tram ride, there are two tram stops located near the hotel. Rooms are exceptional, clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: forex23
Reviews.Content: We knew we made the right choice by staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial soon as we arrived at the hotel. Very kind , welcoming, warm , helpful and friendly staff. They went out of their way to make us feel at home. Hard to beat the location, across the cobble street from Hagia Sofia and a very short walk to Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Underground Cistern. We had a lovely room, overlooking Hagia Sofia, it was clean, bright, in good size and comfortable. many choices of dishes on the breakfast buffet, both Turkish and International. You will not be disappointed by booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ideal location, great value”
Reviews.Author: inolan
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend this hote to anyone. Trully a wonderful experience. Everyone at the hotel knows how to treat a customer, very helpful in everyway. Thank you to all. Ideal location as you dont have to walk far to visit all the major attractions. Topkapi Palace , Aya Sofia, Underground Cistern and the Blue Mosque are very close to the hotel so is the Grans Bazar and the Spice Market. Bosphorus is a short tram ride down or it's a nice 15 minute walk, we walked. Rooms are fine, in giid size, clean and comfortable. Good choice of food for breakfast. Beautiful terrace in the back where you can chill out and enjoy a nice cold drink after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pie7890
Reviews.Content: We trully enjoyed our stay at ottoman Hotel Imperial, perfect location, close toall the major sites. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are all within few steps away. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Top class service, very friendly and helpful staff perfecr customer service. We will for sure recommend the hotel to all our friends and family back home.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: wicked99
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istanbul, went by the reviews on Trip Advisor and a recommendation from one of our friends who stayed at this hotel back in June. We were not disappointed, I have to say Turkish hospitality is one of the best around the world, very polite, kind, friendly and very helpful. Hotel is located in the centre of Sultanahmet Square, close to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Undeground Cistern, tram stops, restaurants and cafes. Very good staff, well trained, good English, always with a smile on their faces. Rooms are clean, bright and comfortable, some are a bit on the small side, but than again your only in the room to sleep. Has a wonderful back terrace where the breakfast is served.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kew2300
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying 4 nights in this beautiful hotel. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff were pleasent and helpful. The complementary breakfast was nice with enough choice of delicious food on the buffet. both hot and cold. The best thing of all was the location of the hotel as we were easily able to walk to all the historical sights in the Sultanahamet area. We would definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: AMPedr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time in Istambul and our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was the "cherry on the cake". Erhan, Merih and Handan were absolutely helpful, charming and very professional - always with a charming smile; always asking if there was anything else we needed, if we were comfortable, etc. The Hotel is so handy to everything and surrounded by great cafes, restaurants and shopping area. It's the perfect location! We felt safe and welcome and Turkish people are wonderful, warm and very friendly. Thank you for making our stay most enjoyable and for the wonderful freshly squeezed orange juice you so kindly fixed for us while waiting for our taxi. Adele & Manuel

Reviews.Title: “Well presented hotel, with good location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: gabyp010
Reviews.Content: Before we booked a hotel in istanbul, did many searches on google and read all the reviews, we wanted a place close to the historical sites, as I have problem with my foot and cant walk for to long. Ottoman Hotel Imperial is perfectly located, across the street from Hagia Sofia, a minute walk to Blue Mosque and few minutes away from Topkapi Palace. We had to take the tram to visit the grand Bazar and the Bosphoruse, tram stop is two minutes away. Rooms are well presented, comfortable, clean and nicely furnished. Good choice of food on the breakfast buffet. Staff are top class, very helpful, always willing to helpw you out to get the best of their beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “What a joy was to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: wickersl
Reviews.Content: Vacationing with my family we all agreed that the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a wonderful place to stay, has a fantastic location and very attentive and friendlu staff. You'll never get lost with Aya Sofia right next to the hotel. The Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are also closeby just a couple of minute walk away. the rooms are very clean with tall cealing, attractive furniture. We all enjoyed the garden in the back in the evening and for breakfast. Delighful experience to add to our memories of trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best services we received.”
Reviews.Author: air2273
Reviews.Content: We are a well travelled couple, pretty fussy about hotel services. We just spend 5 nights at this hotel and was impressed with the quality , location, decoration and the service. Location is superb, across the street from Hagia Sofia and near most important historical sights. The Bosphorus and public transportation to many other areas of the city are nearby. Room decor is tasteful and clean, good comfortable bed, good pillows, bright and clean, you also get the wifi connection in the room. Breakfast is very good, served in a beautiful terrace in the back. The staff are very helpful and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on location, good service”
Reviews.Author: bdav78
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul. Staff were always warm, friendly and helpful. Rooms were in good size, nicely decorated with well looked after every detail, comfortable and very clean. Location of the hotel is wonderful, we were able to walk to all the historical sights. Blue Mosque , Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia and Underground Cistern are within few steps away. Spice bazar and the the popular Grans bazar are within 10-15 minute walk. Many restaurants are located near the hotel serving delicious Turkish cuisine. Breakfast at the hotel was good with many Turkish and International food.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: matt67044
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for a week, it's a beautiful boutique hotel in the old part of Istanbul. There is not a better located hotel around, next to Hagia Sofia and few minutes walk to Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. Hotel sits on the same cobble stone street as Hagia Sofia. It's very clean, comfortable and well managed. Wonderful. wonderful staff, cant thank them enough, they go out of their way to make your stay comfortable, fun and enjoyable. This has to be one of the best hotels we have stayed from every angle, Customer service, good value, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “What a great value ! Top location”
Reviews.Author: amazonriver
Reviews.Content: This is trully a great place to stay, not only bacause of it's location, all the important touristic sites are front of the hotels door step, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque, but the staff of the hotel is perfect, they do their job very well, very helpful and friendly, now this is what I call great customer service. Nice comfortable rooms, excellent choice of food on the breakfast buffet, nice outdoor patio in the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: sankoi
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Istanbul, everyone at the hotel made us really felt like home. The staff is really nice, welcoming and always at your service. When you request something it's there the next minute. The rooms are spacious, airy, bright and the beds are very comfortable, we had a room with a small balcony overlooking the garden. Location is ideal for visiting all the major attractions, next to Aya Sofia and a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar and the Topkapi Palace. taksim Square, the city centre were you'll find all the bars, restaurants and clubs is about 10 minute away by cab. We would recommend this hotel to everyone...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: orac53
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Ottoman Imperial on a brief trip to Istanbul and were so lucky to find this great hotel. The location is just perfect for visiting the main attractions in the city. The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia are all within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The Grand Bazaar is about 10 -15 minutes walk away. The trams are also just 5 minutes walk away. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean and the staff are helpful and friendly. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cindygirl23
Reviews.Content: Big thank you goes out to all Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff who made our first visit to Istanbul a one to remember for a long time. They were very helpful in every way, made sure we got the best out of our visit to Istanbul. Hotel location is excellent, all major sites are walking distance away.
