Hagia Sofia is located next to the hotel, with Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace about two minute walk away. Sultanahmet Square is right by , full of delicious Turkish cuisine restaurants. Rooms are clean and comfortable, good choice of food on the breakfast buffet in the morning, terrace in the back is great to relax and have a nice cold drink or a hot Turkish tea or Turkish coffee .

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be close to all the major attractions , this is the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: rudymoyer
Reviews.Content: We really loved our short stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Fantastic location, close to all the important sites, all within walking distance. Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia are literally in front of the hotel. Rooms are spacious, comfortable, bright, airy and clean. Very friendly and helpful staff, full of great tips and information on how to get the best our of Istanbul on a shorty visit. Would definetely would stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Splended hotel, highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: sellterr20
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Ottoman Hotel Imperial, staff are friendly very helpful, polite and kind. Very nice rooms, clean, spacious, comfortable, comes with all the daily amenities you need. Excellent location, close to all the attractions, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace , Underground Cistern, Hagia Sofia, tram stop and some lovely Turkish cuisine restaurants are all within few minute walk away. We trully enjoyed our stay and would recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial to any visitor to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: romeroomer
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute of our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, good looking hote, perfect location, excellent staff. All historical sites are within few minute walk away. Nice size room, no problems, comfortable and clean. Good spread on the breakfast buffet. Would surelly recommend this hotel to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in perfect location, splended staff”
Reviews.Author: swimworld53
Reviews.Content: We stayed only for three night and wish it was a longer stay. You can't beat the location, food, cleaniness, but what come first is customer service. Very helpful and friendly staff, they make you feel at home. Perfect location, ideally located close to all the important sights, next to Aya Sofia , few meters away from Blue Mosque, two minutes to Topakpi Palace, Undergrounf Cistern is on the other side of the hote. Two tram stops are alos near by. Many restaurants in the Sultanahmet area are close by. You cant ask for a better location. Rooms are in good size, bright, comfortable and clean. We had the best service ever. Thank you to all Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RJWal
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Imperial is in the perfect location as a base for exploring the old city and for this reason I recommend it. Our room was well appointed and nicely decorated but rather cramped, however as we were only at the hotel for 2 nights and were out most of the time this wasn't really an issue. Breakfast was good although the waitresses mobile phone ringing constantly detracted from the peace!! We didn't eat dinner at the hotel but the menu looked good. Drinks on the patio accompanied by a local 3 piece band - zither(?) violin and tambour was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: playhard66
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had the pleasure of staying in this fantastic hotel for 3 nights. We were very impressed with the quality of service received at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Staff are charming, friendly and always helpful, no inquiry is to much, they have great information about the city and the surrounding area of Sultanahmet. Located ideally in the middle of all the historical sites. Hagia Sofia is across the street from the hotel, we had a beautiful room overlooking Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are within two minutes walking distance from the hotel, Grand Bazar is about 10 minutes away, Taksim the city centre which is full of nice cafes, restaurants, shops, cinemas etc.. is about 10 minute by taxi or about 15-20 minute by tram. Just a perfect location. Rooms are nice, bright, airy, spacious, comfortable and clean. Good choice of food on the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Feedback on employee performance”
Reviews.Author: photogirly
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed with Rita Raudoniute and her focus on the customer, enthusiasm, follow up on requests and her overall people skills. The biggest compliment we could give Rita is that if we owned a hotel we would hire her. This comes from a couple that has stayed in at least 300 hotels in the past 20 years. Erhan Deger also was a pleasure to interact with and was very helpful, which was appreciated after an all nite flite. Jeff and Pam St.Clair

Reviews.Title: “Lousy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PaulAnghel
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel is located next to the main attraction sites. It is just in front of Hagia Sophia and 300 meters from the Blue Mosk. The problem with the hotel is not its location but the fact that the management is trying hard to cut corners. Breakfast is a disgrace for Turkey. You need to pay 5 dollars for a decent coffee for otherwise you receive the same coffee you get in a Midwestern US gas station. Even the Sultan and Vizir rooms are extremely small. My advice - skip this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms too small and expensive”
Reviews.Author: NCV43
Reviews.Content: The situation of the hotel is superb, with a big sunny terrace and a nice restaurant. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. But the rooms we were offered were far too small and definitely not worth the rather high price. We had ordered a 'superior' room for two, but we could not even place our luggage opened up at the same time, there was too little floor space. We complained and got a bigger, very dark room facing a narrow inner court yard, where you from time to time could hear the fan from the kitchen. Not a great experience. Even if the rest of the hotel was pleasant next time we will try to find another one in the same district. - The internet connection was down most of the time and could not be used in the room, only in the court yard.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great experÄ±ence”
Reviews.Author: Pabloarmando
Reviews.Content: My name Ä±s ARMANDO STRANO and Ä± can comment that the hotel Ä±s around perfect location i like my room with aya sofya view, nice staff, guest relations girl rita was always advising about all the events and heplfull, all the staff were friendly..

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paceworld
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near by all the historical sights like Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace , Basilica Cistern and the Grand Bazar anmd Spice Market this is the place to stay. All of the sites are few minutes walking distance away. Matter afect Hagia Sofia is right across the hotel. City centre Taksim a short 15 minute cab ride, good place to see, it has many restaurants, bars, cafes, cinemas, shops etc.. Rooms are beautiful, some are a bit on the small sidebut than again you're only in the room to sleep. Very comfortable bed, nice en suite facilities. Breakfast delicious. All staff are very friendly, kind, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to visit all the historical sites”
Reviews.Author: adventuregirl32
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is in a great location down the street from the Topkapi Palace and behind the Blue Mosque, across from Hagia Sofia. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The restaurant ,which is also the breakfast lounge every morning is really nice and they put a good, diverse spread out each morning. The hotel room was a good size for our needs. The bed is very comfortable and the hotel offers several different kinds of pillows for those in need of a specific type. Everything was clean and tidy and the daily housekeeping was impeccable. The complimentary wireless internet access is a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “It was a real joy staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: rock1113
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at this hotel, in spite of many trips to Istanbul. Expectations were a bit high based on the great reviews on Trip Advisor regarding Ottoman Hotel Imperial, but the hotel absolutely justified the write-ups. Location very central, across Hagia Sofia and a short walk to the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Hotel itself is spotless, up to date and the staff are incredibly welcoming. All very smiley, helpful and friendly . Breakfast buffet as good/comprehensive as anything I've seen round the world. Dinner in the restaurant was delicious, better than many of the restaurants located in the Sultanahmet Square area. Room was good, comfortable, clean and well equipped including aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: parksal58
Reviews.Content: Being located just nearby Hagia Sofia, Ottoman Hotel Imperial staffs welcomed us with excellent Turkish hospitality , we felt very comfortable during our stay . Very convenient to most major sights Topkapi Palace, Archaeological Museum, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, etc.; you name it all are within walking distance from the hotel. Rooms are in good size, comfortable, cozy and clean, well decorated.Also its restaurant has a very nice view. This would be one of the most recommendable hotels of the best cost-performance.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute”
Reviews.Author: grayboy88
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial ver much, such a beautiful place to stay, what a friendly and helpful staff, thank you to each and everyone of them. Beautifuly located for sight seeing all the historical sites, all are so close within few minute walk ing distance from the hotel front door. Good choice of food for breakfast, nice variety. Good size room, It's not huge but it's not small either, comfortable and clean, air-con works well, boy do you need it as it was a scorcher.

Reviews.Title: “Erhan and front desk staff made our stay most enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: yayawood2
Reviews.Content: Location a big plus. Air conditioning as the heat was breaking records. But most of all Erhan who was helpful in so many ways: baggage, taxis, directions, suggestions, always with a smile.Taking time to explaining any cultural questions we mignt have. In all a five star employee.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly staff, professionally managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandy285
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located for visiting major sites. You are within few minutes away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Basilica Cistern, Gulhana park and the tram stops. Spice Market and the Bazar is about 20 minute walk, there are many restaurants around Sultanahmet Square that serves some amazing food. Staff are very helpful, especially the guest relation ladies who gaved us many good points about where to visit hoe to get there and how to get the best of our visit to Istanbul. Rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable and clean, size of the rooms depends on the type of room you book. We had booked a nice size room overlooking the Aya Sofia. Hotel does provide airport tranfer.

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hammertime002
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of hotel in Istanbul, Ottoman Hotel Imperial. They have wonderful staff, very friendly and always there to help, they are a good bonus to this establishment. Perfect location for visiting all the sites, hotel is located across the cobble street from Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are few hundred yards away. On the other side of the hotel Underground cistern is located, Grand Bazar and the Spice Market are not far away either, will take about 20 or so minutes by walking or can take the tram (there are 2 tram stops near the hotel). As you could tell hotel is in perfect location. Rooms are very nice and clean, beds are comfortable. Good variety of food for breakfast. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, location, and value.”
Reviews.Author: Valiam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were extremely impressed with our stay at the Ottoman Imperial Hotel. As soon as we arrived, hotel staff took us aside to show us a map of the area, explain the services at our disposal, and point out a variety of restaurants. The hotel was very clean and the view from the terrace of Caferaga Medresesi (a great cafe just behind the hotel) made our first days in Turkey. We ate on the terrace on our last night and were very happy with the food, the prices were either at or a little below the average prices for Sultanhamet. It is a beautiful hotel and the service quality makes it a great value. I would be remiss if I didn't mention that the hotel (and Erhan especially) went above and beyond our expectations. My wife and I left for a 5 day side trip to the south Aegean and didn't want to take all of our luggage. The Ottoman Hotel Imperial held half of our luggage free of charge despite the fact that we were returning to a different hotel in Istanbul. Erhan took our bags (they were heavy) to our room, held doors, hailed cabs, and was generally extremely helpful and did everything with a great big smile. The service is only half of the story though. This hotel is immediately beside the Haghia Sophia and all tourist sights in Sultanhamet are a stone's throw away. Despite the fact that we were immediately across from Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, we weren't woken once by call to prayer (something we were looking forward to, but appreciated when fighting jet lag). I truly can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful city, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: alanadventure
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 6 days with bunch of frirndss. Located in the heart of old town of Istanbul, right besides Aya Sofia and short walk to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The hotel staff are very friendly and the rooms are in good size. Each room has a safe deposit box and mini bar. Breakfast in the hotel was very nice, many variety of dishes, hot and cold, International and Turkish and it was included in the price of the room. Staff are superb in giving advice on where to go in Istanbul and they provide you maps and guide books if you need them. Another plus side to this hotel is the free wifi in the room and around the hotel which was fantastic and very fast.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: swaltzman
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the positive reviews on trip advisor and we were extremely happy with our stay. You can't beat the location as it's acroos the street from Hagia Sofia and a short walk to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Rooms are in good size, comfortable and clean. Staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine bargain”
Reviews.Author: Davescunningplan
Reviews.Content: I found this on Trip Advisor and basicaly went on the strength of the reviews. I was very very happy with the hotel. Based in the Old Town its a fab place to be based. Room was great and staff really helpful. Breakfast was pretty good too. Cant think of any bad points really.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: soonerg1200
Reviews.Content: We trully enjoyed our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. The entire staff was very helpful and friendly. The location was perfect, within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Topkapi Palace. The tram stop is close and we were able to go directly to the Dolmabahce Palace and other touristic attractions in the area like the Grand Bazar and the Spice Market. The breakfast buffet was delicious, we also had a superb dinner at the restaurant. Rooms are decent size with comfortable beds and pillows and it's very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Friendly/Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLola1983
Reviews.Content: I will try and keep this review short and sweet. The location was great, across the street for Hagia Sofia, and in the mix of all the top tourist attractions. The room was slightly small but fine. It was clean, nice decor, coffee, safe, tv, closet, fridge, free internet, what more do you need when you spent most of your day outside sight seeing. Breakfest is included with plently to eat. During the day you have complimentary juice or enjoy tea/coffee time on the patio. The staff is extremely friendly, speak english and can help with questions about the city. Interesting point, when we check-in they introduced us to a lady that gave us brochures of the city, helped us out with the map, booked any reservations we needed for restuarants and tours. She was always avaiable. There was also this extremely friendly and helpful staffer name Erhan Deger. He was awesome! He made our stay extra special. We always saw him around, opening doors, grabbing bags, waiting for the taxi and he did everything with a huge smile! He really stuck out in our minds as going the extra mile and we felt anything we needed he and the staff could assist us with.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, delighted with our stay”
Reviews.Author: saeworld99
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was fantastic. We had a beautiful room over looking Hagia Sofia, it was our 10 years old son's first visit to Istanbul. The staff were excellent, Handan at Guest Relations went out of her way to provide us full information to make our stay memorable one. Our room was very spacious, comfortable, clean and beautifully designed. breakfast was good with great choice of International and Turkish dishes. Location of the hotel is perfect , few minutes walking distance to all the sights we wanted to visit. Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are few minutes away. We would like to thank everyone at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location, Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTexatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul at the Ottoman Imperial July 12-15 before heading south to Bodrum and Gocek with our Turkish friends. The Ottoman Imperial has everything we love about smaller boutiquer hotels: charming, clean and comfortable rooms, a terrific and very friendly staff, and in this case, an unbeatabale location. The hotel fronts on a quiet side cobblestone street that is literally across the street from the wall arounf Aya Sofia. Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the archeology museum are 5-10 minutes away. Breakfast on the hotel terrace overlooking Istanbul roofs and a nearby mosque was delicious and peaceful. Very much worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, lovely staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: cesarwhisper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 5 nights, for the first time visitor to Istanbul you can't beat the location, which is directly across the street from Hagia Sofia and literally a few minutes walk to other major sites in Sultanahmet. Hotel sits on a very quite cobblestoned street and close by is the tram stop to the ferries or to Beyoglu. Also close by are the major bank ATM machines. The hotel itself is very spotless and comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The outdoor courtyard was a nice gathering place for something to drink or just relax before retiring and speak with fellow travelers. In all, it was a great stay and I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Ambiance and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: kmt69
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ottoman Imperial Hotel was a great experience because of the friendly/efficient staff, excellent location and great food. We stayed for a week and really enjoyed being right in the heart of Sultanahamet. This hotel is located next to the Hagia Sophia and Topaki Palace so it is within easy walking distance to many major sights. We enjoyed an extensive and delicious breakfast buffet out on the terrace while listening to traditional Turkish music. The staff were extremely helpful and thoughtful during our stay. The rooms were clean, air conditioned and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good find, extremely happy with our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: romaneatlas
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed if you chose to stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial during while visiting Istanbul. Location is marvelous, across Aya Sofia and it's a short walk to Topkapi palace and the Blue Mosque. The hotel is also located between two tram stops, comes handy when you want to visit the Grand Bazar and the Spice Market, although it is walkable, takes about 15-20 minutes, pending on how fasr you walk. Staff were very helpful organizing each of our day as to where to go and what to do. Rooms are very comfortable, cozy, nicely decorated and very clean. Hotel has a great outdoor patio in the back with cushioned chairs and outdoor television to relax and enjoy the atmosphere after a wondering around all day. Breakfast included wide variety of options as good selection of breads and rolls, yogurt and cereals, hot dishes includes scramble eggs, local sausages, hard boil eggs, tomatoes, olives and variety of cheeses. We're glad we chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial and would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: xpatsrus
Reviews.Content: Close to everything you need to see and do. Hagia Sofia right out the front door. On a quiet street and staff was great. The girl who helps you find things was a doll! Would love to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 37th
Reviews.Content: You can step out the door of this aptly noted 4-star hotel and walk 3 blocks to the Aya Sofia (or possibly view from your room). Itâ€™s about Â½ mile to the Topkapi Palace or go in the opposite direction for Â½ mile to the Blue Mosque. The hotel is located between two tram stations (6ish blocks either direction) down to the waterfront area where you can catch any of a plethora of private or public boat rides up the Bosphorous (Eminonu stop). The first few nights I had a single room that was clean and included hotel slippers and robe, but the bathroom was very small. My guess is that other hotels in the area of the same price may be similar. There were many restaurants only a few blocks away. When my cousin arrived, we were in a double (two twin bed) room that offered more bathroom space. We were there in early July and appreciated VERY MUCH the air conditioned room. The staff was very helpful in helping with directions, calling taxis for us and advising about local tour possibilities. They also set us up with a travel agent that helped with the next leg of our trip to Cappadocia and Kusadaysi, and Bodrum. The Grand Bazaar and Spice Market are a bit farther away, but still walk able (take the tram back (or down) for 1.5 Turkish Lira) . The outdoor patio included a nice setting, local view with cushioned chairs and outdoor Television in the evening. It was fun to watch the World Cup games on the terrace at night with other nationalities. Breakfast was served one up from the patio and included nearby building views. Weather permitting, sliding accordion doors could be opened giving it a more outdoor type of setting. Breakfast included a wide variety of options, several great breads or rolls, the local sesame bagel, yogurt, granolas and cereals. The hot dishes included scramble eggs, sausage (like sliced hot dogs, but tastier) hard boiled eggs, fresh cucumbers and tomatoes, cheeses, a variety of olives and fresh fruit. Very good breakfast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Warmly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dommeldange
Reviews.Content: July 2009: we stayed 10 days at Ottoman Imperial and liked it so much that we cam back in July 2010 for...15days! Mainly because of the very warm welcome we got the first time we stayed and also for the unique location of the hotel. Everything is at a 5mn walking distance! Including the tram. The restaurant is a wonderful place to end the day and the food id good. Personal of the hotel is highly educated in term of turism and they all do their best to make you feel well. Warmly recommended! The place to stay in Istanbul. Merci! Alain R. Luxembourg

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: erwinstyle
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Istanbul on business at very short notice and believe it or not selected this hotel completely blind from the internet. Tell you what I could not wished for more. The staff are so friendly, attentive and helpful. What a stunning location next to Aya Sofia and very close (as few minute walking distance away) to Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Rooms are spotless, comfortable bed, good set of amenities, free wifi. Special thanks goes out to all the staff for their advice and help. As I was in Istanbul on business, only stayed for one day but I will return back with my family to have a proper visit of this interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with the service”
Reviews.Author: kiwirub
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying in this wonderful hotel for 3 nights. We were very impressed of the quality of service received at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Staff are wonderful, friendly and always helpful, no inquiry is to much, they have great information about the city and the surrounding area of Sultanahmet. Located ideally in the middle of all the historical sites. Aya Sofia is across the street from the hotel, we had a beautiful room overlooking Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are within two minutes walking distance from the hotel, Grand Bazar is about 10 minutes away, Taksim the city centre which is full of nice cafes, restaurants, shops, cinemas etc.. is about 10 minute by taxi or about 15-20 minute by tram. Just a perfect location. Rooms are nice, bright, airy, spacious, comfortable and clean. Good choice of food on the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff -- wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNC55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Ottoman Imperial for the 4th of July week with my mother. It is a small, boutique hotel in the old section of the city. There is not a better located hotel for tourism in Istanbul. The hotel sits on the same cobble-stoned street as the Hagia Sofia. It is very clean and well-appointed. And the best part about the hotel is the incredibly friendly staff. They go out of their way to make your stay comfortable, fun and easy. One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler073
Reviews.Content: My father (in his late 70s) and I stayed at the Ottoman Imperial in April 2010. What a perfectly located jewel! We were able to walk to all the nearby sights (and close enough to walk back for a nap or to pick up or drop off items), plus the tram stop was a block or two away when we wanted to go further afield. Our accommodations were spacious and comfortable with a lovely view. There is a small bar with an Internet connection and laptop for guests' use. The hotel patio separating the main building from the other rooms was charming, and perfect for resting or reading in the afternoons. We liked the slightly more modern glass-windowed restaurant too, and loved the breakfast buffet - a generous start to the day and enough variety not to get bored. The staff were wonderful and made our stay truly special (and even took the time to teach me a little Turkish). When we ended up being stranded by the volcano ash for a few extra days, they couldn' t have been more helpful and arranged for us to stay til we had our flights rebooked. Visiting Istanbul was a magical trip and staying in this hotel made it really special.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, very good staff”
Reviews.Author: rymanb45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an excellent part of the old city, we were able to walk just about everywhere. Tram is nearby if you feel like using it to visit grand Bazar, ride is about 5 minutes, if you decide to walk, like we did, it's only around 10-15 minutes. All the major sites are just around the corner. Topkapi Palace is a few minute walk, Blue Mosque is twi minutes away and the Hagia Sofia dont have to go far as it's located across the hotel. There are many Turkish restaurants near the hotel that serves some fantastic dishes, mind you hotel ha an excellent restaurant that serves some delicious food, we did eat at the restaurant one night. The front reception staff were very helpful and friendly, all staff were excellent. Rooms are very comfortable, in good size and clean. They even provide you free use of laptop computer if you need one. Complementary breakfast buffet was more than enough, good variety of food. Overall we had a great experience in Istanbul and staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial more than worth the price paid, great value.

Reviews.Title: “This is the one, perfectly located, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: zarag20
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Location is unbeatable, walking distance to the Grand Bazar, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Yerebatan Sarnici, Gulhane Park, Bibirdirect Sarnici, Archeological Museum , Blue Mosque and lot more.. The staff will bend over backwards to make your stay a very enjoyable one. Do not hesitate to contact them or ask them for information, they will always have a warm smile and all their best intention to help you. Our room was wonderful. Breakfast was great , restaurant is nicely situated with a fine views of surrounding monuments

Reviews.Title: “This is our hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hotacer89
Reviews.Content: We've visited Istanbul few times and our third stay at this hotel so I thought I would finally write a review to share our experience with other travellers. The location of this hotel is perfect for tourism and also for business travel. As it was so convenient the major sites as , Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia are all within few minutes walking distance away from the hotel. Hotel is decorated in an old style and you can trully feel the Orient spirit. Rooms are wonderful, charming, airy, bright, spacious, comfortable and clean. fair choice of variety of food for breakfast. Lovely staff, all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: hayley94
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 3 nights. We chose this hotel mainly based on excellent reputation on this site. And I have to admit we were not disappointed. From the moment we arrived everyone at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Location was a big plus also as it's close to all the major sites and we were able to walk to all of them. Tram stop is not far from the hotel either, we used it to visit, Dolmahbahce Palace and Taksim Square (city centre) Rooms are very good, nice comfortable bed, cleaned each day, free wifi, good decoration and furniture. It has a wonderful outdoor terrace in the back were we had plenty of time to relax and enjoy a cold drink and Turkish tea. All in all we had a great experience at Ottoman Hotel Imperial

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: lurasf
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of historic Istanbul. Perfect for our first trip to the area when we wanted all the major sites within walking distance from our hotel. Hotel was clean. Our room was small but functional (however, we noticed that there were larger rooms as we wondered around the hotel). We never tried the restaurant as they stopped serving at 10 and on our first night we sat in the lounge area for 20 minutes before we were even acknowledged. Breakfast was okay, not exceptional. Overall staff were pleasant with one stand-out, Erhan Deger who went above and beyond by providing us with local eateries, general safety tips and even making sure our beer was re-filled when we were using the free internet in the bar. He totally made our stay at the Ottoman Hotel a memorable, special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarm7034
Reviews.Content: We realy enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. What a great location, close to all the sites. Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are literally in fron of the hotel doorstep. Rooms are spacious, very comfortable bed and very celan. Staff are wonderful, they are very friendly and helpful, all speak well English, they did teach me some words in Turkish, but sorry to say I forgot. We would recommend the hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to going back there”
Reviews.Author: SandraNsw
Reviews.Content: We had two stints at this hotel on the same trip and wished we could have stayed longer. The location is amazing. Our rooms looked out both times onto the magical Aya Sophia mosque. The varied and traditional Turkish breakfast was served in a sunny room looking out over the fascinating Sultanamet district. The hotel was very handy to everything in the old city with Topkapi palace around the corner, and the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern and the Grand Bizarre all within 5 to 10 minutes walk. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel building historic with simple, modern fittings. Despite being central it was very quiet, in a pretty little cobbled street. We would go back there for sure when in Istanbul and would recommend it highly (already have to friends and family).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: eddale
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of June. It's a very good hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Located perfectly, close to all the major attractions. Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, Blue Mosque is few hundred meters away and Topkapi Palace, around the back of the hotel few minutes away. There are many Turkish cuisine restaurants and good cafes within walking distance from the hotel. Tram stop is also nearby, matter effect there are two tram stops that are by the hotel. One of the stops is about 300 meters away and the other one is down the road , few minutes away. Rooms are very nice, in good size and the bed is very comfortable. Complementary breakfast had wide choice of food, both International and Turkish. Staff are very helpful. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Big_Boots_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, next to the Hagia Sophia and a minuteâ€™s walk from the Blue Mosque and all the nightlife and restaurants of the old town. However, the hotel was really bad. The staff were very unhelpful. The room was very small and the bathroom was smaller than my wardrobe at home. We had booked a large room with a view of the Hagia Sophia but arrived late due to delays with the flight (we arrived at 6pm instead of 4pm) and they gave us a small back room promising to move us in the morning. This happened every day until we left 5 days later, but they still charged us for the big room with the view as we had pre paid when we booked. Our room was at the back of the hotel over a very noisy bar and the curtains did not fit so a street light shone into the room all night. The breakfast buffet was the worst I have ever seen at a hotel. I donâ€™t think the hotel which claims to be 4 star is even 2 star quality. However, we had a great holiday in Istanbul which is a fantastic city and we will go back and stay in a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the city, loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: jensealover67
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a great choice. The staff met our every needs and the transfer to and from the airport was easy. The hotel provided the Sultan character of Turkey , beautifully designed and colorful. Breakfast buffet was delicious and the view from the dining area was great. We had our own private deck, which was great, our room had a queen size bed , which was very comfortable. I would say with confidence that all rooms are well located and quite. We were sad to leave Istanbul , if we had more time it would had been great as there are incredible historical value was needed to be more explored.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: duncan50b
Reviews.Content: We could not be more happier with our choice of hotel to stay in Istanbul. Ottoman Hotel Imperial trully a Istanbul delight. Outstanding location, within minutes of walking distance to important historical sites as Hagi Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Underground Cistern. Rooms are very stylish, bright ,spacious and comfortable. We had a room overlooking the Hagia Sofia museum. We stayed in the Premier Junior Suite, it was higher than the regular room rate but it was well worth it. Good variety of food for breakfast, almost everything you want. Hotel has a great restaurant serving delicious Turkish and Byzantine cuisine. Also it has a large garden arae in the back where you could relax , enjoy the sun, have a cold drink. Wonderful staff, all very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Acceptional hotel, above expectation, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: tedw6757
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial met all our needs. It's close to all the historical sites we wanted to visit. How good is the location, well Hagia Sofia is right across the hotel, Blue Mosque is mere few hundred yards away, Topkapi Palace is few minutes away , Basilica Cistern is on the other side of the hotel, Grand Bazar is about 20 minute walk away, Taksim the city centre is a short 10-15 minute cab ride or a tram ride or about 20-30 minute walk. It was perfect for us. Staff are very helpful, boy are they full of good tips, very friendly, polite and kind. Rooms are comfortable, decent size and very clean. Hotel has a great outdoor terrace in the back serving excellent Turkish and International cuisine or just have a nice cold drink after a long day of siteseeing. Excellent plave to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Premium location, great value”
Reviews.Author: wards90
Reviews.Content: well if location is important for you as it was for us this hotel ticks the box. Across from Hagia Sofia, few hundred meters from Blue Mosque and few minutes away from Topkapi Palace. The famous Bazar is about 15 minute walk away, it's a good walk as you get to see many locals. We took the tram up to the bazar, it only took 5 minutes and the tram stop is short walk away from the hotel. Many restaurants located near the hotel , serving wonderful Turkish food, our first night we ate at the hotel restaurant which was delicious, do recommend giving a try. Wonderful rooms , comfortable bed and very clean. Delicious breakfast buffet which was included in the rate, served in the garden terrace in the back of the hotel, it's also a great place to sit around to have a nice cold drink. Staff are very pleasent and helpful. Gave us great recommendation and suggestions to where to go to eat, where to visit outside the usual touristic area, showed us the way how to get to Princess Island for a day visit, which I would highly recommend doing while visiting istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again and highly recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: ruflyer
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial located in a wonderful position as you could walk to all the historical attractions. Our room was in a good size, decorated tastefully and reflected the Ottoman character and everything was very clean. Brekafast buffet was delicious. Hotel has a lovely patio for outdoor relaxation. The staff met our every needs and the transfer to and from the airport was easy. It's a well run establishment, would surelly stay here again and recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet, charm,helpful staff, good bed”
Reviews.Author: YogaFriend
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a charming building but everything in the rooms is new. The service is excellent. The staff can help with directions, guides, tours and more. The room was quiet. The breakfast was excellent. The hotels very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: marm89ma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel located in perfect location for visiting the main attractions. Aya Sofia is next to the hotel, I had a great view of the place from my room window, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are both within walking distance . Rooms are really beautiful, clean, bright, comfortable and clean. Brekafast buffet was delicious, offered variety of dishes. All staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous location, 5 Star service”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes65
Reviews.Content: We're so glad we've choice Ottoman Hotel Imperial, first of all location is perfect for visiting Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. All sites are within 2 to 3 minute walking distance, it was perfect for us as I have problem with my knee and cant walk for a long period of time. Staff were great, nothing is to much for them, they bent backwords to make your stay an enjoyable one. Very friendly and helpful, you could tell they love what they do and love their city, they have great information about the city . Rooms are fine, in suitable size, very clean and the bed is very comfortable. Delicious breakfast buffet. We would stay again if ever return back to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the centre of all the historical sights”
Reviews.Author: slokvina33
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Staff were very welcoming, warm, friendly and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. Located in the heart of all historical attractions. Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are few yards away, Hagia Sofia is right next to the hotel. There are 2 tram stops near the hotel, can take the tram to visit Taksim , the city centre, got some nice shops, restaurants, cinema's , cafees etc.. There are also many great restaurants around Sultanahamet were the hotel is located. For two nights we ate at the hotel's restaurant and had a delicious meal. Breakfast buffet offered a wide variety of choice. Beautiful terrace garden located at the back of the hotel, great to sit down to relax and have nice cold drink after a long day of sightseeing. Wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: SmithsMillValley_CA
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was an excellent experience. I've seen various reviews, some positive and some negative, depending on your room location. At the time we booked, we went directly to their site. There was only one option, basically booking the number of rooms you want, coordinated by an online booking site. With further investigation I realized we had a standard room (I believe all standards located in a 2nd building). I emailed the hotel directly and asked to be upgraded to the main building to a Premium Sultan or Premium Vezir room. They accommodated us and even located us on the courtyard side. The view was magnificent. This hotel was so centrally located and an easy walk to everything. The staff was amazing and the rooms clean and very Sultan. Our rooms each had a queen and a tiny room with a twin. If booked, check out a very charming Sheraton just around the corner. Small and Sultan in its decor. The Ottoman would still be my first choice. The breakfast buffet (included) was delicious and an evening cocktail on the patio, enjoying a live Kanum (zither) performance is so peaceful with views over the city. The restaurant right next to the Ottoman (Green Corner) is so great for lunch. Dinner also, I'm sure. Rather than ordering a la carte they suggested two gigantic platters, one a salad and one meats which was delicious and perfect for us and our two college students. Some reviews comment on the Call To Prayer at 5 am. Just turn your air conditioner on or enjoy this cultural and respected highlight of Turkey. The Hagia Sophia (2 min from hotel) alone is worth a trip to Istanbul. It's one of the most magnificent architectural feats in the world. Loved the Grand Bazaar, but if you can't tell real gold, silver or gemstones, stick to the textiles and Halloween costumes! We were ripped off on all !! And do negotiate. The Spice Bazaar was even better. Plan on hours there. Prices are listed, no negotiations. Skip the touristy dinner cruises. Food and entertainment very so so. A better option is the daytime ferry cruises where you stop for lunch along the way. Absolutely not to be missed are live and very authentic performances at the Hodjapasha Cultural Center. It was a 20 min walk from the hotel. Not easy to locate as in an alley just off main street. We attended a Whirling Dirvish performance and felt it was a real highlight of our trip. I wish we had another night to go back for a different performance called "Turkish Dance Night" on Tues and Thurs. Well worth it to plan on both. 70 min performance and fun restaurants to choose from on way back to hotel. We loved our visit to Istanbul and need to go back there and also explore outer areas. Don't forget to get your visa on arrival, before you get into the passport entry line. There's a short or no line at VOA, but long entry line. Enjoy the Ottoman Hotel Imperial and Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Compact yet cosmopolitan. Clean. Comfortable. Helpful staff. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: LadnerLady
Reviews.Content: We felt so lucky to come in from the hustle and bustle of the old city to find this charming oasis. A haven for weary travellers. The staff were gracious, warm and welcoming. The location is perfect, right in the heart of all you want to see. The downside to all this convenience is the residual noise from the cafes and the tram -- pack your earplugs and you won't hear a thing. The air conditioning created some white noise. We loved the open courtyard bar and restaurant (limited but adequate menu) and the live entertainment by a local musician. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom well equipped and very clean. Everything was very neat and clean in fact. What a find.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal location in Sultanahmet area”
Reviews.Author: smd22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from four days in Istanbul prior to a cruise. We had never been in Istanbul before, and were really pleased at the accomodations at the Ottoman Imperial Hotel. It was not the cheapest available, but a great value. It couldn't be in a better location to give access to the attactions of Sultanahmet. Most of the group we were with stayed in a much more expensive hotel that was not very close to the attractions. They wished they had stayed with us. The rooms were comfortable, and large by European standards we have experienced. The staff were very accomodating and helpful. The breakfast that was a part of the room price was pletiful and tasty. We appreciated the free transfer from the airport on arrival (booked through the hotel website. We wwill stay again at this hotel when we have the chance. I have not been a frequent poster to this forum, but have been a long time member and user of Tripadvisor.com. I am sure you will enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it, you will not be disappointed !!”
Reviews.Author: morego99
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul many times in the past, this was my partners and kids first visit there. I've stayed in many different hotels in Istanbul, Ottoman Hotel Imperial has to be one of the best hotels around Istanbul. The warm and friendly service provided by the staff makes this hotel what it is, excellent, beautiful, great value for your money. Perfect location, couple of steps away from Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Grand Bazar is 5 minute tram ride away or it would take you about 15-20 minute by foot. There are two tram stop close to the hotel. Sultanahmet area is full of restaurants that serves some of the most delicious food I had in a long time. Rooms are in good size, comfortable and clean. Good choice of food for breakfast, everything you need to full yourself up for a long day of sightseeing. Staff are numero uno, very friendly, full of joy and very helpful. They will give you excellent tips of where to go to eat and where to visit to get the best out of your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: philcodefisher
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located ideally for visitng all the historical attractions in the old city part of Istanbul, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are very close by also close to some great Turkish cuisine restaurants and the tram stop. We spend couple of nights at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, hotel is in excellent condition and the rooms were clean, airy, comfortable, beautiful decoration and well maintained. Staff were excellent in every way, very friendly, polite, kind and very helpfull. Sultanahmet square has some great restaurants to visit, do try some of the awsomeTurkish cuisine, also I would highly recommend the Turkish hammam, it's an experience. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: travbud1
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a great cÄ±ty to visit. I spent a lot of time (as usual) reading reviews and checking the various hotels and locations. This hotel probably has one of the best locations in the whole city. If the enterance to the Aya SophÄ±a was on the west side it would only be necessary to take 3 steps to be inside! We got an upgrade to a nicer room when we arrived which was excellent and at the back of the hotel. As everyone else says, the standard rooms are on the smaller side. The breakfast was good and the staff were pleasant. The only real knock is perhaps the lack of a rooftop terrace (which would be nice as the views are amazÄ±ng). But the inner garden is nice. Cannot go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Top”
Reviews.Author: Searover
Reviews.Content: Right in center of where you want to be in the Old City. 1-10 minute walk to top spots. Tour desk was helpful and all staff were attentive and professional. Rooms were little smaller than hoped for but that is usual in Old City. Green Cafe accross the street was very nice and friendly. Tram rides are easy to further spots. DO NOT bring a car.

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time”
Reviews.Author: MitsuWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial and found it even better than we remembered it from our visit last spring. The location just across a quiet side street from the west end of the Aya Sophia is extremely convenient for touring in the old city and also convenient to the tramway if you want to go other places. The decor is very attractive (ceramics and kaftans) and soothing. Our room was splendid and immaculate, with a view of the Aya Sophia (these are more expensive, but worth it). And most of all, the staff was unfailingly helpful and pleasant. We saw Orhan again, who helped us with our bags and brought us hot tea before the taxi picked us on at 6:15 in the morning to go to the airport. And Handan Kucuk (the customer relations staff) helped us figure out when things were open and the best way to get there. The front desk staff also helped with taxis and reservations. It was a pleasure to deal with all of them. We look forward to our third visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: paulandtoby
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Situated right across the street from the Hagia Sophia. Very friendly, clean rooms with all the amenities and great breakfast. Perfect place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - and excellent guest service”
Reviews.Author: PassportTherapy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is across a little cobblestone street from Haggia Sofiya....front desk staff and concierges were extremely helpful and friendly, gave wonderful recommendations for places to go and how to get there, and good restaurants to dine in. We found it to be extremely convenient for sightseeing in the old city, mosques, bazaars, etc. Rooms are a little small and our showers had some mold in them. Breakfast was excellent, with a beautiful view towards Haggia Sofiya. Dinner in hotel restaurant one night was only so so, much better dinners elsewhere. Would definitely stay there again if in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: janesworld069
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel. Located in the historical area of istanbul called the old town or Sultanahment. All the sites are within walking distance, Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, soon as you walk out the front door Blue Mosque is about few hundred yards away, Topkapi Palace is a five minute walk away, on the other side of the hotel is the Basilica Cistern. Rooms are good, in generous size, comfortable, nicely decorated and very clean. All food we had for breakfast was delicious, plenty of Turkish and International dishes. The staff are amazing, they are friendly, informative and very helpful. Also the hotel has a great terrace garden on the back where you could relax and enjoy a drink or food after a long day of visiting around. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, friendly staff, cant beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: capricorn007
Reviews.Content: After looking over the reviews on the site decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial due to the location as we wanted to visit Topkapi Palace , Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia and the good reviews it has been receiving. Still though did not trully know what to expect, this was our first trip to Istanbul. After arriving at the hotel, instantly we knew we had made the right choice as we were greeted with the most welcoming staff we had seen during our travel. They are all very friendly, helpful, always smiling full of great information, great suggestions and recommendations to get the best of your visit. Cant beat the location, Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel, Blue Mosque is 2 minutes and Topkapi Palace is 5 minutes walking distance away. The famous Grand Bazar is about 15 minute walk away, but you can take the tram as we did, tram stop is few hundred meters away from the hotel. Rooms are very clean, nice furniture, nice decor and very comfortable. Delicious choice of food for breakfast. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jojo990
Reviews.Content: If you want to be near by all the historical sights as Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Basilica Cistern, this is the place to stay. All of the sites are few minutes walking distance away. Matter afect Hagia Sofia is right across the hotel. Rooms are beautiful, some are a bit on the small sidebut than again you're only in the room to sleep. Very comfortable bed, nice en suite facilities. Breakfast delicious. All staff are very friendly, kind, polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: eviderova22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is plain and simple is a great place to stay. We were recommended Ottoman Hotel Imperial by one of our friends who stayed here last year and we were not disappointed, you wont be either. It's in one of the best spots in Sultanahmet as its close by to all the important attractions. Rooms are in good shape, nice size, clean and comfortable. Excellent service, all staff are very good.

Reviews.Title: “I would rate this hotel 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: sanjay99023
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this short and sweet, not write a long review like others. I'm going to rate this hotel a 10 as it's in perfect position for visiting all the historical sights, all of them are within few minute walking distance. Staff are excellent , very friendly and they go that extra mile to help you enjoy your stay. Rooms are good , comfortable, cleaned every day, towels and sheets are changed each day. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: sanzia
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul for 2 nights before we were heading off to Greece. Very nice hotel, what makes it great is that we didnt had to walk far to visit all the historical sites , saved us time due to short stay we had in Istanbul. I mean Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel with Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque within 2 minutes away. How much closer would you want. We had a nice size room, it was comfortable and clean. Good food for breakfast and the staff were all helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, superb staff, good service”
Reviews.Author: bradye97
Reviews.Content: All of us had an excellent time in Istanbul. What a beautiful and interesting city, full of history and many facinating places to visit. We were all very happy with the service we received from Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff. From the moment we arrived to check in they were very kind, friendly and very helpful. Loved the location of the hotel, dont need to walk far to visit all the historical sites. Hagia Sofia is almost at the door step of the hotel, right across, Topkapi palace, Blue Mosqu and the Basilica Cistern are all located within few minute walk away. Rooms are comfortable in good size and clean. Great choice of food for breakfast, has a great terrace at the back of the hotel to enjoy a drink or something to eat. All in all it's a good choice hotel in Istanbul. We all enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it, you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: crazyhorse76
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are at the end of our two week trip around Europe visiting very interesting cities. Hotel we chose to stay in Istanbul was Ottoman Hotel Imperial after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and doing our own researching also due to the location of the hotel as we only had couple of days and wanted to visit all the historical attractions or at least much as we can. Perfect location, next to Hagia Sofia, few steps away from Blue Mosque and a short 5 minute walk to Topkapi Palace, cant get closer than that. We took the tram to visit Grand Bazar , tram stop is a few minutes away. If you buy anything from the Bazar be ready to bargain, you'll get some great deals. Many restaurants and cafees are located close to the hotel that serves delicious Turkish cuisine. Rooms are good, in decent size, comfortable and clean. It has a mini bar and free wifii. Good amount of variety of food for breakfast, both hot and cold. Great staff, always smiling, very friendly and helpful. Hotel does provide airport transfer on request. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tdfayar
Reviews.Content: hotel had a great location, central to everything. had room 302 with small balcony and tiny extra bed off of main room. facilities were nice and very clean. the airport pickup was helpful not to fight the traffic after a long flight. a bargin if you can get a room for less than 150 euro per night. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spent few pleasant days at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: pskowski
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 days in Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Hotel is very cozy, quite and well situated for visiting all the historical sights, in the heart of the old city, just besides Hagia Sofia and short walk away fromTopkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, restaurants , Grand Bazar, Basilica Cistern and the tram stop. Our room was in good size, bright with a sitting area, very comfortable large bed, well decorated came with bath robe and slippers. Large variety of food available on the breakfast buffet. Excellent staff, very friendly, polite and helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home in Istanbul, excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clarksaw19
Reviews.Content: We have visited Istanbul before, each time we look for a hotel in the Sultanahmet area as we enjoy the surrounding and it's near all the historical sites. We wanted a good quality hotel, comfortable, clean and modestly priced. We found Ottoman Hotel Imperial and will stay here everytime we visit Istanbul. Managment and staff show they care about their guests. Location of the hotel is just perfect, located on a small cobble-stone street just next to Hagia Sofia. All the rest of the historical sights are so close, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, the Hippodrame, Archeological Museum, Grand Bazar, Spice Market, wonderful restaurants, tram stop are all short walk distance away. Also close by is the beautiful Bosphorus, highly recommend a boat ride around , it's amazing. If you want to get to the city centre Taksim, it's an short and easy tram ride away. The rooms feaure all the amenities you need, they are comfortable, attractive and very clean ( more than I could say for some of the hotels we've stayed around the world, along with the current hotel we're staying in UK ), anyway breakfast was good, served in the indoor dining room. The price is excellent value for what yo get back.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: eaguila
Reviews.Content: A great find. With all the main sites within walking distance., St Sofia, Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque... Windows overlooking St. Sofia. Friendly, attentive staff, from the chauffer, to the bell boy, to the reception, to guest services. Just ask, they deliver. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Positioned for visiting all the historical sights”
Reviews.Author: sorensontravel
Reviews.Content: I like to thank the hotel managment and staff for looking after us after getting caught during valcona distruption. We finally returned back about a week ago. Hotel is located in a perfect area of Sultanahmet, Hagia Sofia is located next to the hotel, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are short walkaway. Many restaurants and cafees of Sultanahmet Square are all within walking distance. Tram stop, matter effect two of them are close by also. Grand Bazar is about good 15-20 minute walk or with tram it's only about 5 minutes. Rooms are comfortable and clean, we had a large room on the upper with a great view of Hagia Sofia. Breakfast buffet was adequate with enough variety to choose from. Very friendly and helpful staff, always smiling , kind and professional. Helped us our alot during our stay. I would stay here again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “When can I move in?”
Reviews.Author: Katscamel
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said? From the start everything was fantastic and it isn't often I say that. Online reservation was painless and well handled, the airport transfer was fine and check in was very quick and easy and done with a smile. Throughout the stay I was made to feel very welcome despite a slightly unusual request I had and was always greeted by name - even at 3 o'clock in the morning. The staff were fantastic and it would be impossible to mention them all by name here. The room was a decent size, clean and very tastefully decorated. The only 'issues' I'd have was that the bathroom was very badly designed and wouldn't be suitable for anyone with a mobility problem and there was only one tv channel in English (BBC World). It wasn't a major problem but after a hectic days shopping it would have been nice to relax to. The food was ok - an average Turkish(ish) breakfast - would have been nicer with borek and proper Turkish tea, the evening meal I had wasn't the best but acceptable. Overall a fantastic hotel in a great location and certainly is on par with a lot more higher rated hotels I've stayed in. Just wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Made the right choice with Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: lullyjkipper
Reviews.Content: We spent a fantastic few days in end of March at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Pick-up from the airport was very smooth. Early check in to a beautiful well decorated very clean and comfortable private room on the 4th floor. which had a balcony facing Hagia Sophia. Continental breakfast was more than adequate with lots of variety both turkish and International dishes. Location to die for, next to Hagoa Sofia, few steps away from Blue Mosque and a short few minute walk to Topkapi Palace. Great front desk staff who were more than willing to recommend routes for walking and tours. We had a great time at the hotel and would recommend it to rest of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic short break”
Reviews.Author: ashnewdo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights at end of March. Location of the hotel is fantastic, beign right next to Hagia Sofia and only a short walk to Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque and it's only about 100 metres from the tram stop. The staff were very friendly. The rooms were good , comfortable bed and very clean. Breakfast was good. All in all it was a good stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the service we received, best location.”
Reviews.Author: simonh69
Reviews.Content: We found the Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a wonderful place to stay . One of the top reason is the location of the hotel, it's within few minute walk to number of Istanbul's glorious attractions, Aya Sofia is next to the hotel, Blue Mosque, three minutes walk, Topkapi Palace and the Archeology Museum are five minute walk away. It has a charming outdoor patio to relax have a drink or get something to eat. Comfortable rooms , clean, well decorated. The free breakfast was quite good, flavorful with Turkish and other cuisines represented. Staff are very friendly and helpful , provided many suggestions for me and my famility to enjoy our stay in Istanbul. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family back home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ericp22
Reviews.Content: Hotel was an excellent location for the major sights of Istanbul. Short walk to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. Several good restaurants are near the hotel, serves delicious turkish cuisine. Staff are all very friendly, kind, polite and very helpful. The rooms are modern, clean and very comfortable. Good breakfast. Would stay here again. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sankowskik
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3nights beginning of April. It's a nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. What makes it even better is it's so close to all the major attractions you dont have to walk far. Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, Blue Mosque is about couple hundred meters away and Topkapi Palace is few minutes away, on the other side of the hotel Basilica Cistern is located. Many restaurants and cafes are a mere two minutes away and the tram stop is about 300 meters away, matter effect there is another tram stop located down the road from the hotel, few minute walk away. Rooms are very nice, spacious and the bed is very comfortable. Complementary breakfast has wide choice of food both international and Turkish cuisine. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Also hotel does provide airport transfer on request.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Istanbul, ideal location for sighteeing”
Reviews.Author: edwardsk60
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul after a week long tour of Turkey, we chose this hotel after reading the recommendations on Trip Advisor and were very happy with everything about the hotel. We had a room just off of the garden was clean, large with nice shower, flat screen television and free wifi. Staff were very friendly and helpful , recommended many places to visit and some great places to eat. One of the best thing about the hotel is the location, located on a quite side cobble street with spectacular view of Hagia Sofia. The Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are just minutes away. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value, happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: jbjason49
Reviews.Content: It's trully hard to select a hotel in Istanbul as a first time visitor as theres a lot to choose from. We all finally decided to be in the thick of things and chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial in the old part of Istanbul. Location of the hotel is unbeatable, the Basilica Cistern and Hagia Sofia are few metres away. The Blue Mosque is across the garden opposite the hotel and Topkapi Palace around the back of the hotel, no more than few minute walk. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and everything is so clean. Our room was not that large, however the bed was large and very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was ideal, large choice of hot and cold dishes. The tram stop is nearby, allowing you to travel down to Bosphorus for a ferry ride or up to the famous Grand Bazar. We all enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial and would recommend it to future visitors to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Good choice Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: livejenny
Reviews.Content: We tried to get away to a bit warmer place for a long weekend and didnt want to go far so we decided on Istanbul as we've never been there before. It's a beautiful city, full of history. Hotel is located in the heart of the old city, part called Sultanahmet, next to Hagia Sofia and few steps away from Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque, also short walk away are all the restaurants and cafees of Sultanahamet area. Tram stop is 200m away to get to the famous Grand Bazar, although if you walk it would only take about 10-15 minutes. Rooms are comfortable and clean, nice size LCD tv, minibar and free wifii. Breakfast was good with many choices of Turkish and International dishes. We had arranged airport transfer with the hotel and we were picked up on time as the driver was waiting for us. Great staff, very friendly and helpful, Ozlem on Guest Relations provided many useful information and suggested many different things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Topnotch Hotel, It's terrific”
Reviews.Author: fsmart34
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. We had a terrific room overlooking Hagia Sofia, it was nicely decorated, roomy enough, very clean with nice large comfortable bed and comfortable pillows.. I dont know if all rooms are the same or pending on price. Breakfast buffet was fullt stocked with both hot and cold choices of dishes and they all tasted very good. The entire staff were wonderful, very friendly and helpful, almost everyday we were talking to them for about 15-20 minutes, especially the Guest Relation lady who was giving us excellent advise on places to visit and recommending many restaurants and activities for us to do. One of the reasons I rate this hotel as topnotch is the location. Close to all the sites, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are short walkaway and Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel. Many restaurants and tram stop are also nearby. Good hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best situated hotel and very welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Peetkaur
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Istanbul and it was the first time that I really felt like home! The staff is really nice, welcoming, and always at your service. When you request something, it is there the next second! The beds are very very comfortable. There's even a little balcony in your room (depending on the room). The hotel is very well situated, it is just next to Saint Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazaar, etc.. It's only 10 minutes by cab to the main town called Taksim where you'll find all bars and restaurant and clubs. I would recommend this hotel to everybody... and I loved it so much that I'm going back to Istanbul in October.. and will stay in Ottoman Hotel Imperial only!!!! Priti Thambyrajah

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Top Class Service”
Reviews.Author: rosjule45
Reviews.Content: After reading the recommendations on Trip Advisor site, we booked 4 nights at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. This boutique hotel has an amazing location , it's on a side cobble street next to Hagia Sofia. Also it's only few steps walk to Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Underground Cistern and Archeology Museum. The staff tries very hard to please you, nery helpful in everyway. The Premium rooms are quite comfortable and large, thanks to the hotel Manager we had a great room overlooking Hagia Sofia. Complementary breakfast buffet was good with good choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place!”
Reviews.Author: Pavel007
Reviews.Content: The hotel in a very good location. Plus is free wifi. The rooms are very small and the walls are thin so you hear everything what is going on on the other end of the hotel. Shower in the bathroom was broken and one evening no hot water. I stayed there in the early April and it was cold in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit, exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: jasmos90
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is wonderful. The location is excellent, across from Hagia Sofia, prfect for exploring the important historical sights like Blue mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Archaeological museum, Grand Bazar as all of them are within few minutes walk away. If you want to visit areas outside of the Sultanahamet Square area, tram stop is about 200m away. Staff all around the hotel, from reception to housekeeping to restaurant workers are all very friendly and helpful. There are two " Guest Relantionship " attendents who are very knowledgeable and very helpful. Good size rooms, comfortable and clean. The breakfast buffet was very delicious, variety if amazing Turkish specialties as well as the usual international cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: melindaistanbul
Reviews.Content: Very charming and beautiful hotel, superb location as your few steps away from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Rooms were lovely, comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was delicious and offered variety of wonderful food. All staff were excellent, Guest Relation person Ozlem came around and introduced herself to us when we were checking in and asked if they can help with planning your visit or make any reservations for us. Very nice touch. They were all friendly and helpful, provided us with fantastic suggestions for restaurants and places to see. Comfortable rooms with all the amenities you would need during your stay,

Reviews.Title: “Central location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: atkins38
Reviews.Content: Good hotel to stay while visiting istanbul, it has an amazing location, walking distance to Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Underground Cistern and Spice Market. All staff were outstanding, friendly and charming. They help plan our days, recommended and suggested places to visit. Our room was very nice with enough space, comfortable and very clean. Great choice of both Turkish and International food for breakfast. We would recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial to everyone that are planning to visit Istanbul and dont want to be far away from all the historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul treat”
Reviews.Author: williams50
Reviews.Content: Very charming, lovely, beautiful hotel, with very pleasent , kind, friendly and very helpful staff. We've stayed in many hotels around the world during our travel, even though this is not a 5 star hotel, but you are treated like your in a five star hotel, we have stayed in 5 star hotels on our trip the staff where not this helpful and friendly, kind, polite. I could go on and on about the quality of people that works in this beautiful hotel. Location is another huge plus, cause you dont have to walk far to get to all the historical sites like Hagia Sofia which is right next to the hotel, Blue Mosque is few steps from the hotel as you can see it as you leave the hotel and Topkapi Palace is few minutes walk away. There is also a beautiful park called Gulhana near the hotel, good for a nice walk, other side of the park leads you to Bosphorus. There are many restaurants serving delicious Turkish cuisine near the hotel. Nice, spacious , bright rooms, comfortable and clean, we were lucky enough to get a room over looking Hagia Sofia. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: vasilevn
Reviews.Content: I've been three times in this hotel and certainly this is the my hotel in Istanbul. The location is perfect for a tourism and also for business travel, still more that there have a place to park the car. The hotel is decorate in an old style and you can feel the Orient's spirit. Usually the rooms are not ready before noon, so if you arrive earlier you must have to wait or to walk to some of the closer sights around. You will not regret for this. The hotel is a little bit expensive, but the location and the atmosphere will compensate this. I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vondrand
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, It's a fabulous hotel, perfect location as it's right by Hagia Sofia and other historical sites as Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern are all few minutes walk away. Grand Bazar is about 20 minute walk away or you can take the tram which will only take about 5 minutes. Tram stop is close to the hotel. Good staff, full of energy, friendly and very helpful with full of good information on places to visit. Rooms are good, comfortable, plenty of room, nice en suite bathroom and clean. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: baldwinge
Reviews.Content: We realy enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Good location, close to all the important sites. Hagia Sofia , Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace literally are in front of the hotel doorstep. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. Very friendly and helpful staff, they go that extra mile mile to make your stay a happy one. Will recommend the hotel to all my friends and family back home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiretraveler00
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly hotel with staff who aim to help and advise. The room was luxurious and comfortable and the breakfasts and evening meals were plentyful and good choices. We were pleased to find we were right in the heart of Old Istabul with all the attractions only minutes away. We have stayed in hotels in lots of countries but the staff here were the best.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: touring25
Reviews.Content: We spend a fantastic 3 nights beginning of March in Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Airport pick up was very smooth, since we arrived before check in time, but was no problem as they let us check in early into a wonderful room on the 3rd floor facing Hagia Sofia. Rooms are immaculate, spacious, comfortable and very clean. Continental breakfast was more than adequate. Great location as your not too far away from all the touristic and historical sites. Across the hotel is Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace is 5 minute walk away and Blue Mosque is two minute walk away. Very charmimg and lovely staff who were more than willing to recommend thigs to do. Overall excellent stay in Istanbul and at Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, strongly recommended, great location”
Reviews.Author: leebanr
