Reviews.Content: My partner and I attended a wedding in Istanbul, during our time there we stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. We were very impressed with the staff. They could not have been more welcoming or more helpful to us during our stay. It was clear that everyone from the front desk staff, to breakfast wait staff to housekeeping were proud of their work, their hotel and the city. You cant beat the location of the hotel, literally you are couple of minutes away from all the main touristic attractions. About two minutes away is Blue Mosque and Tokapi Palace, across the hotel is Hagia Sofia. Centrally located in Sultanahmet Square, old part of Istanbul, full of great turkish restaursnt and caffees. The rooms were very comfortable, beautifully decorated and clean, the free wireless internet was a bonus. We highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, fantastic location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: oceanfree030
Reviews.Content: Hotel is positioned ideally for visitng all the historical attractions in the old city part of Istanbul, close to some great Turkish cuisinem restaurants and the tram stop. I spend 3 nights at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, hotel is in excellent condition and the rooms were clean, airy, comfortable, fantastic decoration and well maintained. Staff were excellent in every way, very friendly, polite, kind and very helpfull. Amazing location, you could walk to all the historical sites as Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace , Aya Sofia and Underground Cistern are within minutes away. Grand Bazar is also nearby, if you wanted to walk it would take about 10-15 minutes, but you could take the tram, it only takes around 5 minutes. Sultanahmet square has some great restaurants, do try some of the great Turkish cuisine, also I would recommend the Turkish hammam. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: robin22London
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a cobble side street next to Hagia Sofia, within fwe minutes walk to Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern. Tram stop and Gulhane Park are also short walk away. Rooms are very comfortable in good size and very clean, comes with all the daily amenities you need for your stay. Great breakfast buffet, lots of choices of cooked breakfast and cold cuts , cereal, yougurt. Staff are very lovely, friendly and helpfull, recommended many areas for us to visit outside of the usual touristic sites. Would recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: seasider53
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ottoman for 4 nights and cant believe how lucky we were to find such a hotel. The service we received was excellent, being a synic I thought that this was a thing of the past but the staff were so kind and helpful it was an absolute pleasure to return at the end of each day. Breakfast was served each morning by very plesant staff who always greeted us wit a smile. Ozagur on the reception was very helpful, thankyou. The only down side we had was that our room was at ground level directly opposite reception whch could be a little noisy. A group of American tourists, aged in their 20's assembled outside our door each morning, discussed the night before before being joined by the tour guide who then gave them a run down of the days activities!! We were already up and awake but it could prove problematic if you wanted to sleep. The location of the hotel is ideal, everyting is so close by. I highly recommend the Ottoman Imperial and hope it wont be too long till we return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: paul_darwish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial with our five years old son for 2 nights couple of weeks ago and we were immensely pleased with the hotel with beautiful and tastefuly decorated rooms. Location of the hotel is excellent just across the street from Hagia Sofia and a few minutes walk through cobble street from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque is two minutes away. Staff are excellent, very professional, kind, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good and varied and nicely presented. Rooms are cozy, comfortable and clean. We would definitely highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: kelleristanbul
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial was great. Everything about the hotel from cleanliness, comfort, wonderful food and the staff attention was fantastic. Hotel location is excellent about few minute walk to everything you want to visit in Sultanahmet, quite side cobble street across Aya Sofia. Hotel staff especially Handan was very helpful, attentive and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sharw292
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived into Ottoman Hotel Imperial, we were treated very warm like one of the member of the family. We found this hotel to be one of the best we stayed during our travel, we do travel often. Rooms are beautiful, nicely decorated, spacious, clean and comfortable. We had a room with a great view of Hagia Sofia. Location is perfect as you could walk to all the historical sites like Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia ( across the hotel ) in minutes. Hotel staff are excellent, very professional, kind, friendly and helpful. If we should visit Istanbul again we would for sure stay at this hotel again, will recommend it to our friends back home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and even more perfect service”
Reviews.Author: BaluMunich
Reviews.Content: Located in direct neighbourhood of Hagia Sophia, and within five minutes walking distance to the Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque, the Ottoman Imperial Hotel is the ideal base for sightseeing in the Sultanahmet-area. Going to the Galata quarters is esay because of the tram stopping close to the hotel, too. The individually furnished boutique hotel offers a neat and familiar charme. The most impressive at last: the service offered by the reception and the guest relations desk which should have earned far more than the five stars the form accepts above! The people are not only deeply professional and fulfil of all your wishes, but also give you the feeling of being treated more as a personal friend than just a guest. Even for a regular business traveller in 4* and 5* star hotels a unique experience!!! Thank you once again - the Ottoman Imperial will be my only choice for Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fobulous location, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlyode
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Istanbul. Staff were always warm , friendly and very helpful. Our room was in good size well decorated with care taking to every detail, comfortable and very clean. Location of the hotel is fabulous, we were able to walk to all the historical sights. Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are short walk away, Aya Sofia is right by the hotel, Basillica Cistern is on the other side of the hotel. Spice Bazar and Grand Bazar are within 10-15 minute walkaway, you can also take the tram if needed, tram stop is 2 minutes from the hotel. Many restaurants are located near the hotel serving delicious turkish food. Breakfast at the hotel was good with many different turkish and international food.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: deanw45
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is great place to stay, met all our expectations. Hotel has everything you would want and expect, wonderful rooms, great location, very friendly and helpful staff, free wi-fi and much more. Location of the hotel could not be any better, right next to Hagia Sofia, 2 minutes away from Blue Mosque and about 5 minutes away from Topkapi Palace. Grand Bazar and Spice Market are about 10-15 minute walk away. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast buffet was delicious, plenty to choose from. Staff are great, always willing to help you and recommend areas and places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, pleasent experience, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: thandy57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for four nights and had a great experience. The staff were very wellcoming, friendly and helpful. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, the rooms and the bathroom are spacious and comfortable and very clean. Location of the hotel is very convenient as it's close to all the historical and touristic attractions. Hagia Sofia is located right across the hotel, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mccarthym
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is in perfect location for visiting all the historical sights. We've stayed at this hotel total of 3 nights, 2 nights on arriving to Istanbul , after visiting the south cost, stayed here one more night on our departing Turkey. Staff are so friendly and helpful, very kind, polite with a smile on their faces. Excellent location, your steps away from Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sofia, which is located next to the hotel, also restaurants and tram line are within few minutes away. Rooms are in good size, clean and comfortable. Assorted variety of food for breakfast. We would stay here again on our next visit to Istnbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveller_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights. You cannot ask more for the location, only steps away from all the main historic sites. However, we were unlucky to be put up at a room facing the main street. I could not get much sleep on the first night due to the constant noises from the street (frequent trams, cars going over bumps, etc.) even with the windows shut and also noises from the next doors (the walls appear to be quite thin) The room we stayed was very compact. Nothng was wrong apart from the noise level but I would say it was nothing special either.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: travelware
Reviews.Content: We realy enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Good location as it's close to all the important historical sights so we didnt have to walk far. Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, room we were staying you ca see it out the window. Topkapi Palace is few minutes walk away . Blue Mosque is about two minutes away and Undergrounf Cistern is on the other side of the hotel, two minutes away. Sultanahmet Square, restaurants, cafees and tram stop are all so close by within minutes of the hotel. Rooms are clean, good decoration, full amenities and comfortable. Do spend a little more and book a room overlooking Hagia Sofia, highly recommend it. Staff are very friendly and helpfull. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming, classy hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelken061
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be one of the classiest hotel we've stayed, my wife and I travel often as we can to visit places we have not had time in the past. For us it ticked all the boxes. You cant get a better location, in the heart of Sultanahmet square, dont have to walk far to visit all the historical sites. Hagia Sofia is right next to the hotel, Blue Mosque is 2 minutes away, soon as you walk out the front door you can see the Blue Mosque, Topkapi palace is 3 minute walk away. Grand bazar, Spice Market, tram stop and Bosphorus are close by also. Therefore Ottoman Hotel Imperial gets our top mark for location. Staff are great, friendly, very helpful and kind. Rooms are very well decorated, our room was overlooking Hagia Sofia, comfortable and clean. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality, great location”
Reviews.Author: greenleaf081
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul, when we arrived to the hotel we were all pleasantly surprised and happy we made the decision to stay at this hotel. Great location to visit all the historical sites. Hotel is located next to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace is around 5 minute walk away with Blue Mosque was just in front of the hotel, Grand Bazar is near by also, about 15 minute walk or few minutes by tram, by the way the tram stop is close to the hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful throughout our stay and the guest relation person Handan gave us some good suggestion about where to go and what to visit. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Boutique Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nguliad54
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at this magnificent hotel. If you have not visited Istanbul before and thinking about about going there in the future, I can highly recommend this hotel. We enjoyed the comfortable room, good size and very clean, they leave a little box of Turkish Delight by the bed, it's delicious. Breakfast is more than you can ask for, absoulately delicious. Excellent staff, they will guide you and explain to you all that you need to know about Istanbul to have the best experience. Excellent location, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia, turkish art museum, undergrong cistern, gulhane park, archeological museum and much more are all within 3 minutes walking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located close to all important sites”
Reviews.Author: ward99Uxbridge
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial very much, perfectly located in the centre of Sultanahmet, close to all the important sites, it's next to Hagia Sofia and few minutes walking to Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, when we first arrive they provided us brief information about the city and recommended many places to visit. Rooms were very tasteful, good decoration, clean and enough space. Breakfast was good, nothing to complain about, plenty of hot and cold food both Turkish and International and a lot of Turkish tea. They do provide airport transfer upon request, our transfer arranged by the hotel was waiting for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great service, excelent location”
Reviews.Author: hviero999
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with superb location. Hagia Sofia is literally few steps away, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are only 5 minute walk away, tram stop is a mere 5 minutes away. Great breakfast buffet, good selection of Turkish food as well as International breakfast items, hot buffet with real honeycomb. The rooms are comfortable, clean, tidy but dont expect to be huge.Room amenities are more than plentiful with everything from coffee maker to Turkish Delight, toothbrush, shaving foam to original olive oit soap. The outdoor terrace garden is lovely, but it's rather cool during the winter months. The staff were great, friendly, courteous, kind . always with a smile on their face. Great service and top location. If we go back to Istanbul one day again, will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotrip89
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time in Istanbul, what a beautiful city, full of history and many facinating things. We were all very pleased with the service we received at Ottoman Imperial. All staff from the time we arrived were kind, friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the location of the hotel as we didnt have to walk far to visit all the important sites. It's close to all the sites, Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel , Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Basilica are all located within few minutes walk away. Rooms are very comfortable, good and very clean. Great choice of food for breakfast, has a great terrace garden at the back to enjoy a drink or something to eat, if it's not to cold outside of course. Good choice hotel in Istanbul, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Visitor2001
Reviews.Content: Had to go to Istanbul (first time in Turkey for me) on business at very short notice (12 hours) and selected this hotel completely blind from the internet. I couldn't have wished for more. The staff were very friendly and attentive. Stunning location next to Aja Sofya and very close to the Blue Mosque. Rooms and hotel were spotless. Special thanks to Erham (Handan Merih) for his help and advice. Highly recommended. Will take my wife next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andi1979
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial is located right next to Aya Sophia in Sultanahmet. In terms of location it is the best hotel to explore this beautiful part of the city of Istanbul. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and I would definitely recommend this to my friends and family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: ThugBoy55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days in this hotel. I was the first time in istanbul. when I went inside the hotel, I saw that I am at the right place. Then Mrs. merih at the reception with a smile .. I felt at home .. The room was perfect with jacuzi there .. Hotel is located in Sultanahmet. You can go anywhere by foot or by tram or metro. Staff of the hotel were really friendly, especially Mrs. merih, Hakki and Mrs. Hendan .. they love to help .. I would like to thank them. So if you go to Istanbul - Sultanahmet goes .. I recommend to everybody in the Ottoman Imperial Hotel to stay ..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld058
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, majority of main historical sites are within easy walking distance. Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are few minutes away, Hagia Sofia is located next to the hotel. All the staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. Thank you to Ozlem , guest relation person for recommending and arranging many outing for us, we especially like the Turkish Night program, it was amazing. Terrace area at the back of the hotel was good to sit and enjoy a hot cup of turkish tea. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Great Service, Room not as expected”
Reviews.Author: shpydah
Reviews.Content: This lovely boutique hotel is in a great location down the street from the Topkapi Palace and behind the Blue Mosque. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, going so far as to get a cake for my wife's 30th birthday. The restaurant (which is also the breakfast lounge every morning) is really nice and they put a good, diverse spread out each morning. It was January, and snowing/raining most of our visit, but it is clear this dining room has a great view. The hotel room was a good size for our needs, but located at the back of the building and consequently had no view. Definitely try to get a room with a view if you can. The bed is very comfortable and the hotel offers several different kinds of pillows for those in need of a specific type. Everything was clean and tidy and the daily housekeeping was impeccable. The complimentary wireless internet access is a definite plus. A Few Issues: - The doors and windows (to the outside) in the room did not seal properly and allowed the cigarette smoke from neighboring guests smoking outside to filter into the room periodically. - The wing our room was located in (three floors of a few rooms each floor) had a pretty consistent smell of cooking food for the duration of our stay, not particularly unpleasant, but definitely strong and noticeable. - The bathroom tub/shower leaked out onto the tile floor from somewhere underneath the unit for the duration of our stay and as a result of this clearly chronic condition there was mold in the grout in some places. Also in general the bathroom workmanship was shoddy with very messy silicone sealing and so on. - Thin walls and false, shared ceiling spaces mean that you can hear your neighbors talking. The location and service really make this place great, but be aware of the limitations of some rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Location”
Reviews.Author: agamy1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, close to all the attractions in the Sultanahamet area. All the important historical sites are around the corner, BlueMosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Undergound Basilica. Hotel is stylishly decorated and all staff very helpful and kind. Room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was good, with plenty of food to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: speng40
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was fantastic. We had a beautiful room over looking the back terrace. It was our mime years old son's first visit to Istanbul. Staff were perfect, Ozgur at reception and Handan at Guest Relations wemt out of their way to provide us full of information to make our stay memorable one. We felt special. Our room was very spacious, comfortable, clean and beautifully designed. Breakfast was good with great choice of international and turkish dishes. Location is perfect. Within few minutes walking distance to all the sights we wanted to visit. Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace are few minutes away. Thank you for a great stay .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, near all important sites”
Reviews.Author: warnerk42
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a wonderful hotel. Centrally located in Sultanahmet Square, next to Hagia Sofia and close to Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar and Spice Bazar. Tram stop and Bosphorus are also close by. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, with all the ammenities. Staff were were excellent, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good with fresh fruits, breads and hot and cold choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Tsusan
Reviews.Content: Being located just nearby Aya Sophia, Ottoman Hotel Imperial staffs will welcomed us with excellent hospitality therefore we felt very warm during the stay even though it was snowing cold season. Very convenient to the most major sight seeing spots (Topkapi Palace, Archaeological Museum, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, etc.; you name it!) Also its restaurant has a very nice view. I would advise only that the shower room of us was not so spacious however still one of the most recommendable hotels of the best cost-performance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with great location”
Reviews.Author: smoottravel
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time reading all sorts of hotel reviews on this site and other hotel sites before making a decision where to stay. Ottoman Hotel Imperial provided everything we were looking for, and the service and friendliness of the hotel staff were exceptional. I'm happy to recommend this hotel to all my friends and family. Location of the hotel is perfect for walking to visit all the important sights. Hagia Sofia is located across from the hotel, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque is about 2 minutes away. Close to tram stop and all the restaurants and cafees around Sultanahment Square. The staff are always helpful and friendly, very polite, kind and professional, all understands and speaks english very well. Breakfast offers variety of food and fresh ingredient Rooms are bright, clean and comfortable. We had a wonderful room on the 3rd floor overlooking Hagia Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very friendly staff, large rooms, clean, in 1 word fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Genapely
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend Istanbul. We stayed 2 nights in the Ottoman Imperial hotel and if we go to Istanbul again we will definitely return to this hotel. After arrival our transfer, arranged by the hotel, was waiting for us. In the hotel we got a brief information about the city and possibilities. Rooms were very tasteful decorated, clean and enough space. Breakfast also nothing to complain about. The staff is very very nice, almost everybody speaks English and they all were very help full. The location in the old part of the city is unique, next to Hagia Sophia and only a few minutes of walking to the blue mosque. We thank you very much for making our stay this pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Ronedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this boutique hotel, literally next door to the Hagia Sophia and yet on quiet side street. Because our flight arrived early in the morning, the staff allowed us to check in at about 9 AM. I mentioned in the reservation that we were celebrating our 2nd wedding anniversary; upon returning to our room that afternoon, there were fresh roses on the pillows, a beautiful candle, confetti on the bed and a fruit basket awaiting us! Although they did not have a "business center" per se, they allowed me to use their own computer to check my email and print some documents. The staff were helpful in giving us directions to local sites and advising us on restaurant choices. The breakfast was delicious, and the room was very comfortable with a charming view of the neighborhood from our balcony. We were withing walking distance of almost everywhere we wanted to go. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Top location, close to all important sights.”
Reviews.Author: karoljam36
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my fiance at this hotel for a romantic weekend in Istanbul and we absolutely loved it. Everything was great, room was perfectly clean and even the little details in the room made the difference like coffee maker, fruit basket, bathrobe, slippers, fresh flowers. Staff were extremely nice and helpful and the breakfast was fantastic. Perfectly located, our room was overlooking Hagia Sofia. We were walking distance away from Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Sultanahmet Square is just minutes away with great restaurants and cefes. We enjoyed our weekend very much. Thank you to all Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed everything about the hotel”
Reviews.Author: franksi74
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a gem in so many ways. It's a boutique hotel located on a side cobble street next to Aya Sofia. Situated in the heart of many of the major sites in Istanbul. Close to the tram line, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Breakfast which was included had great selection of local and international foods, exceeded our expectation, it was delicious. Our room was comfortable and clean, overlooking Aya Sofia. We were more than pleased with our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial

Reviews.Title: “Well presented, best location, very good service”
Reviews.Author: prettygirl74
Reviews.Content: My partner and I met one of our close friends in Istanbul for a short holiday as we had never been to Istanbul before, we loved Istanbul and enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. The hotel is beautiful. Front receptionist Mehmet and Ozlem guest relation were very helpful, they spoke well English. Location is one of the best, right across from Hagia Sofia, and within couple of blocks of other attractions in the Sultanahmet area. Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are within few minutes away. Rooms are comfortable and clean , comes with all the daily amenities you need. We upgraded to a larger room overlooking Hagia Sofia for a bit extra but it was well worth it. Has a great garden area in the back for relaxing and meals, I'm sure it's much better in the summer time to hang out there as January is not the best time of the year, although still the weather was much better than back home in UK. Breakfast buffet had more than enough choice of food on the table. Very happy with our visit and our stay, will be back for sure in the summer to visit the Mediterranean part of Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, near all important sights.”
Reviews.Author: rowingbell
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, I was able to walk just about everywhere. Tram stop is also nearby if you feel like using the tram to go visit Grand Bazar, ride is about 5 minutes, if you decide to walk it's around 10-15 minutes. All the historical sights are just around the corner. Topkapi Palace is a few minute walk, Blue Mosque is two minute walk, Hagia Sofia dont have to walk far as it's next to the hotel. There are many restaurants and cafes near the hotel. The front reception staff Ozgur and Mehmet was very helpful and friendly, all staff were excellent. Rooms are comfortable, in decent size and clean. They even provide you free use of laptop computer if you need one. No complaint regarding the breakfast buffet, it was more than enough. Overall it was a great experience in Istanbul and staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, more than worth the price paid, good value.

Reviews.Title: “This is an exceptional hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: whuwels
Reviews.Content: You feel like being the most important person ! thank you Erhon, Handan, Elif and Ozlem ! I'll remember my stay !

Reviews.Title: “We would not hesitate to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ballackm10
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful,very relaxing. Room was very clean, cozy, warm, inviting and comfortable. Very romantic gataway, can't wait togo again some day. The hotel has a great location, it's very close to historical sights, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque are all short walk away. Staff are very helpful and friendly, thank you to Ozgur who works at reception, was very helpful. Choice of food for breakfast was more than enough. Great garden terrace to relax and enjoy a nice hot cup of turkish tea or coffee. We would not hesitate to stay here again on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent”
Reviews.Author: DUKE622
Reviews.Content: Have travelled extensively, third trip to Turkey, have stay at the Four Seasons, price was too high for all of our group, chose the Ottoman, because of location, it could not be better right across the street from the Aya Sophia. The price, rooms, and service was all top notch, in fact I have never been in a hotel where the staff was so helpful and friendly. Erhan the concierge, Elif the reservation and desk manager and Handan the man friday all went out of their way to make sure you enjoyed your stay and were ever ready to answer any questions or solve any problems you might have, airport pick up, car reservation. etc etc. The dinning room was fun with a whirling dervish show, I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: cruzm58
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location within walking distance of all the major attractions as Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi Palace. Room was clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Very good standard continental breakfast was served with great filter coffee. Ozlem who is the Guest Relation person helped us with arranging daily activities for us and made sure we got the best out of our short visit. We trully enjoyed our brief stay in Istanbul and would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others who want to visit Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: rgnyc21
Reviews.Content: We saw the place and fell in love with it. Great, peaceful surroundings. The rooms are fantastic. Beautiful furnishings and great design. The food was fantastic. We had a great breakfast both mornings. It was better then I could have imagined. Everything was so tasty and presented beautifully. The Ottoman Hotel Imperial is easy access, it' s in great location. Close to Blue Mosque, across from Hagia Sofia and a short walk to Topkapi Palace. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We have greatly enjoyed our stay. Guest services staff were really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, good location, good service.”
Reviews.Author: webbristol
Reviews.Content: We found the Ottoman Hotel Imperial a wonderful place to stay . It's located within few minutes walk of a number of most glorious attractions. Hagia Sofia is located next to the hotel the Blue Mosque is three minute away, Topkapi Palace and the Archeology Museum are five minute walk. It has a beautiful outdoor terrace which is great for breakfast, dining or just sitting around between sightseeing after a long day. Breakfast was great, flavorful with Turkish and other cuisines. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they recommended many restaurants and places to visit. Rooms are comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: borosm67
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing location, walking distance from Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, Underground Cistern ( ron the othet side of the hotel ) and Hagia Sofia ( next to the hotel ). The staff were outstanding, very friendly and charming, they helped with arranging many activities for us to make sure we got the best out of our visit. They were always there to provide you with good advise. Room was nice with plenty enough room, comfortable and clean with decent size ensuite bathroom. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay here again if I ever return back to Istanbul. Also breakfast was good, terrace were the breakfast was served was very charming, great place to relax after long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend break”
Reviews.Author: casj40
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my girlfriends birthday in Istanbul few weeks ago, it was one of the cities we always wanted to see but never got around to it. It's a very interesting city, divides Europe and Asia by couple of bridges. We went over the Bosphorus Bridge at night and what a beautiful scene covered in constantly changing coloured lights that drew my eye and the view of another continent wow. Hotel has great staff, from the moment we walked in they greeted us with open arms and smile on their faces. Mr Ozgur who works at reception and Miss Handan who is the guest relation person helped us out a lot during our stay, thank yo to both. Hotel is nicely located close to all the historical and touristic sights. Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are all close by. Grand Bazar which is also short distance away is place worth seeing. I was informed it has around 5000 vendors under one beautiful roof. Rooms are comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast buffet had many variety of international and turkish dishes. Overall it's a good hotel to stay if you're thinking of visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: triggerUBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: Location great for sight seeing. Very good, clean and well appointed accomodation. Extremely helpful and friendly reception staff

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, very professional staff”
Reviews.Author: sallmiami
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is fabulous, you dont have to walk far to visit Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia as they are short walk away, matter effect hotel is located next to Hagia Sofia on a very beautiful cobble street. You're in the middle of the old part of Istanbul, Sultanahmet area. Many restaurants, nice cafes to have a great cup of turkish tea or turkish coffee, boy that is strong. Tram stop is close by also along with Grans Bazar and the Spice Bazar, walkdown the main road to get to Bosphoruse, so the location is great. Staff are very professional, friendly and very helpful. Always there to make sure you're getting the best of your visit. They can arrange all type of activities to get the best out of your visit to Istanbul while you're there. They arranged a beautiful bosphorus dinner cruise for us , what a delight that was, we would like to thank Miss Ozlem for arranging it, trully bosphorus is a magnificent sight to see especially in the evening when all the lights come on on both bridges,. Rooms are well laid out, comfortable, roomy and clean. Breakfast buffet is fabulous, full of different international and turkish dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a fantastic location with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: catherineandlucy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within minutes walk of all of the key historic sights in Istanbul which makes it the perfect base for exploring the city. We were upgraded on arrival and the room was spacial, immaculate and even had a balcony overlooking the city. On arrival we were immediately offered a drink and Ozlum on Guest Services provided us with all of the information we could possibly need with details about key sights to visit, opening times, excellent restaurant reccommendations and even where to buy good carpets!! The hotel exceeded all expectations and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: audryw
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this hotel, everyone makes us feel like part of the family. Perfect location, on the doorstep of Hagia Sofia and walking distance to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Rooms are in good size, clean and comfortable, on advise, try not to get a room on the lobby level as it could be little noisy. On our first stay at the hotel we had a room on the lobby level, then the next day they moved us to an upstairs room which was better. Good staff with great turkish hospitality, looked after us very well, thank to to everyone at Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Breakfast buffet was good, full choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “Well located next to Aya Sofia”
Reviews.Author: kaneboston
Reviews.Content: Great location in the Sultanahmet neighborhood, this boutique hotel is close to Aya Sophia, Gulhane Park,Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Also nearby are Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar and tram stop is 2 minutes away. They have great turkish restaurants in the Sultanahmet area close to the hotel right by the tram stop, excellent variety of turkish cuisine, waiters and owners of the restaurant stand in front to try to lure customers to their place. Good rooms, clean, comfortable and well presented, it has wireless internet in the room, air conditioned, although you dont need it during these days, heater works great. They do provide airport transportation on request, we took the taxi from the airport, wasnt much, but cant remember. Awesome staff, very helpful and friendly. Mr. Ozgur was great at the reception, very helpful organizing activities for us.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: ER101
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a great treat. Everything about the hotel from cleanliness, amenities, and comforts, through the personal attention and wonderful food was absolutely fantastic. I was traveling with my two teenagers, and regretfully only had one night to spend in Istanbul. Like other reviewrs noted, the room was not the most spacious, but it was great to have a door to a semi private balcony overlooking the city, aya sofia, and the blue mosuqe. The hotel is partically in the back yard of both, and a 5 minute walk from everything else you may want to see in Sultanahmet, on a very quiet cobblestone-lined street. Yet, above all, the hotel staff (especially Mehemet, Handan, and Ozlem) were incredibly helpful, attentive, and friendly. I made contact with them via email in advance of our trip and they were able to arrange for a shuttle from the airport, recommend sites, arrange for a private tour guide, and even send me information on hours of operations of some of the sites we wanted to visit (in some cases this info was not listed on the sites' websites). I was even escorted to the nearest ATM to help me find it quickly so that we can get on with our day without much delay! I am so very greatful. Highly recommended! I'm sure you'll enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- I hope to stay there again soon.”
Reviews.Author: niczhou
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Ottoman Imperial, on my way back home from Antalya. I had 3 guests instead of 2, and they waived the extra guest fee- very nice of them. Stayed in one of the triple rooms, which was a little small, but fit us all nicely, and the room was well appointed and very clean. They also arranged for a complimentary breakfast for us since we were leaving very early in the morning the next day, which was very pleasant. Helpful concierge made my night in Istanbul very convenient. The location is excellent for sightseeing- good for my friends and I since we had such limited time. Excellent location for all Sultanahmet sites, which are probably the most important in Istanbul. Stunning views of the Hagia Sophia, although we did not get to visit since it was closed on the Monday we were there. Looking forward to coming back!

Reviews.Title: “I wish if I would stayed longer!!”
Reviews.Author: Sam22virginia
Reviews.Content: I stayed only for one night and wish it was a longer stay. You can't beat the location, food, cleaniness, but what come first is customer service. Very helpful and friendly staff, they make you feel at home. After I checked out and was waiting, with my wife for my ride to airport, I was called to the bar area to find out that they had a cake and the whole crew start singing happy birthday. I was speachless. I had the best service ever with only one night stay. I will be back in the summer to stay for a week. Thank you Mehmet and Handen for you superior service.

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman Hotel Imperial Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vnelly16
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and few of our close friends decided to spend New Years eve in Istanbul this year. Stayed at ottoman Hotel Imperial, which is a great hotel. Hotel location was awesome, next to Aya Sofia and minutes away from Underground Cistern, Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque. City centre Taksim where we went to see the fire works is about 15 minutes away by taxi or tram. Rooms are in fair size, comfortable and clean, they do very in size according to rates. No problem with the breakfast buffe, good choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “UNRIVALLED LOCATION LET DOWN BY DISAPPOINTING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: sodesa
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at this Hotel. The strength of this Hotel is its unrivaled Location next to the St Sophia and very close to the SultanAhmet square. The restaurant is nicely situated in a bright room with fine views of surrounding monuments.The rooms are relatively small but this is to be expected from such a boutique Hotel What is inexplicable is why they do not provide English channel TV on a regular basis, given they are supposed to have an international clientele.Another setback is the lack of a public seating area. However, my biggest gripe is I found the front office staff consistently "unfriendly" and unhelpful, which is unfortunate given that Istanbul is not easy to move around. This experience of ours is at odds with many of the other reviews on this Hotel. As such, I do not intend to return to this Hotel although its Location is truly outstanding. A Pity!

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodations and servicein an enchanted setting!”
Reviews.Author: Majomike
Reviews.Content: What an exquisite hotel! The service is flawless. Wonderful dining, set in the most ideal location available in Istanbul. We could not have been happier with our stay, and would stay there again should we return to this wonderfully exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Time well spend good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanel16
Reviews.Content: Beautiful city Istanbul, worth a visit. Good hotel to stay as it's close to all the sites we wanted to visit. Aya Sofia is across the hotel and other sites as Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque are walking distance away. Rooms are adequate, clean , cozy and comfortable. Nice staff, very helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet was ok too.

Reviews.Title: “One hotel, endless great experiences...”
Reviews.Author: mimito84
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you that this is the second time I stay at this magnificent hotel... So, it might give you an idea of how amazing it is... If you haven't been to Istanbul before, I can highly recommend you this hotel, nothing is going to happen if you pick another one, but I can tell you for sure that your experience if you stay here is going to be the greatest in your life, it would change your ideas of how a host can be... You just have to live it and then you know what I am talking about. If you make your reservations through their web page and stay more than three nights (you have to check if they still have this available at the moment you do it), they will include one way from the airport to the hotel (or from the hotel to the airport), their site on internet is very friendly and have several options to offer, it's up to you. From the moment to get to the hotel you will feel the warm welcome that they'll give you, you have to know that the Turkish hosts are the best of the world, their culture is reflected in that warm smile and the care they take of you in order to make you feel even better than home... You will enjoy their comfortable rooms (try the Turkish Delight they will leave it near the bed, absolutely fantastic), take a warm bath in the lovely bathroom, they will have all you need to feel in your own relaxing place... Every morning if you listen carefully, you can't miss the wonderful sound that comes from the mosques... For us it was the best way for waking up and feel the energy and the peace that can be heard all over the city several times during the day... I haven't experienced anything similar in any other country I have ever visited... The breakfast is more than you can ask for... anything you feel like trying is going to be absolutely delicious, if you want a sweet breakfast, try the cake, the sweets, if you like eggs, make a choice, they are all great and tasty, if you love bread, this is the perfect time to eat them all... (by the way, try the simit, it's great), if you rather something light, try the yogurt or the fruits... do you like orange juice, the tea or the coffee?? It doesn't matter which one you choose, it's going to be the best tea, the best coffee or the best orange juice you have ever had... besides a great view to enjoy and the great and warm staff that always keep coming with more great food... believe me, it's going to be hard to make a choice everyday... but, you must try a bit of everything, it is worth it! At night don't miss the performance of the traditional Sufi dance (it isn't actually a dance, it's more some kind of prayer), and try the food from the restaurant, try the lamb, the natural juices and the deserts (don't forget to try the backlava). Since you get to the hotel, the fabulous staff will guide you and explain to you all that you need to know to have the best experience in the city... they are able to make all the reservations you need in order to take advantage of your time in the city... Do not hesitate to contact them or ask them for information, they will always have a warm smile and all their best intention to help you, believe me, even if you have a list of all the places you don't want to miss in your visit, talk to them, you might be surprised to know that the day you planned to go there, the place is closed, so, they might suggest another activity and I can assure you that they can give you great details about their own city, such as taking the Bosforo trip in boat until Anadolu Kavagi... Wow!! This was the best... We really enjoyed it so much... If you are wondering about the location of the hotel, I will give you the following example: We went to Hagia Sophia (it's next to the hotel literally, yes, look at it in google maps if you don't believe in the "literally" I mean), after we bought the tickets and we were inside of it, we realized that we didn't take the battery of camera (don't worry after all we could take pics with the video camera), so, when we left the museum before going to the Blue Mosque, we went to the hotel and in less than five minutes we were taking pictures again with our camera... it was great! We were really glad that the hotel was so near... What else is near?: The islam and turkish art museum, the Blue Mosque, Yerebatan Sarnici, Topkapi Museum, GÃ¼lhane park, Binbirdirek Sarnici, Mosaic Museum, Archeological Museum, and a lot more... even if you want to go farther you can take the tram, it's very very close to the hotel, about three minutes walking... I think there's only one way to understand this all and that's only living it... I am sure that you will want to come back as I did... as I do... Maybe we can meet there next year... Have a great time in the best city of the world... AM.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Location”
Reviews.Author: nyeretov12
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial , excellent location, we were able to walk to all the important sites, tram stop is about a block away. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms and the bathroom area are a bit small, but then again we were only in the room to go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: worldwide55
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. All the historical sites were within walking distance as were restaurants, shops and cafes. Tram stop was only a short walk away to get to the famous Grand Bazar if you decide to take the tram or it takes about 15 minutes if you walk. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was plentiful with good choice of food. Excellent staff, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel Loved it”
Reviews.Author: miles87021
Reviews.Content: Good friend and I met up in Istanbul for a short weekend holiday and we enjoyed our stay at ottoman Hotel Imperial. Hotel is beautiful, front desk attendants were very helpful arranged many activities for us, they spoke very well english. The location is ideal, right across from Aya Sofia and within walking distance of other attractions in Sultanahmet area, Topkapi Palace, underground cistern, Blue Mosque etc... Be sure to book a room overlooking Aya Sofia, there more quiter and better but a bit extra. Nice spread for breakfast, delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, warm and friendly hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: donnaf39
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial has a great location and it's close to many of the historical attractions around Sultanahmet area. Very stylish and nicely decorated. Staff are very helpful, kind, polite and professional. Our room was comfortable and clean, housekeeping was excellent. Breakfast was good with variety of turkish and international food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Business or Holiday”
Reviews.Author: bunited
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading some of the reviews on the site, stayed at this hotel only for one night, I was very pleased with it, good size, nicely decorated room , as I saw it's located close to important sites around Sultanahmet area, across from my room was the beautiful view of Hagia Sofia. Breakfast buffet was rich, both international and turkish food on hand, has a great garden terrace to relax and enjoy a nice cold drink after a lond day of sightseeing or in my case a long day of meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended To All”
Reviews.Author: helentravel59
Reviews.Content: Cosy hotel, located on the side cobble street next to Hagia Sofia, perfectly located to visit all the historical sites. This is our second visit to Istanbul and our second time staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial and were very happy with it again. Great staff, very helpful and friendly. Blue Mosque, Grand bazar, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern are all nearby. Rooms are cosy, clean and comfortable. Large selection of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: hibberuk
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, every historical sites are close by. Matter affect when you look out the window of some of the rooms you get a great view of Hagia Sofia, by the way we would like to thank the hotel manager again for upgrading our room . Our room was excellent, great view, comfortable, good size and clean. We hada good choice of turkish and international food for breakfast, had great food at the hotel restaurant, which soorry to say forgot the name, amazing food, think I had to much of raki ( which is one their popular drink, it was my first time trying and I dont think I would try it again ). Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: swiserb32
Reviews.Content: Nicely located in the heart of the old part of Istanbul, great place to stay to visit Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Spice Market, all within walk away. Famous Bosphorus which devides Asia from Europe is near by, it was great taking a boat ride around , you start from the europe side and comes back from the asia side so you get to see the shores of both sides. Rooms are comfortable and clean, has all the amenities. Great staff, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cartmark1002
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel, it was in a beautiful location, right by all the historical sites the family wanted to visit, rooms were nice, ok size and clean, only thing was that the walls are on the thin side, they had good choice of food for breakfast on the breakfast bufe, staff were very helpful looked after us very well. I would come back to this hotel if we decide to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wollaston
Reviews.Content: Excellent traditional turkish hospitality provided by the staff, they are great, they help arrange many daily activities for us, made sure we made the best of our visit to Istanbul. Great location too, across Hagia Sofia, short walk to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. Grand Bazar is close by also, if you decide to walk it would take about 15 minutes I would say, you can also take the tram which only be about 5 minutes, tram stop is 2 minutes from the hotel. Comfortable rooms but on the small side, great choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: coles79
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for a stag weekend for one of my friends, we chose ottoman hotel imperial due to great location, we though since we're there we'll do some culture sighseeing also. Hotel is located in the middle of all the important sites you dont have to go far to reach Topkapi palace, hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. Excellent staff, had a great time, thank you so much to all the personal that nade our stay fun and exciting. Good rooms, clean and comfortable, the groom to be had the best room though, large size over looking hagia sofia. Do recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive hotel - not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: katsry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is sadly not what it seems...and has been the worst hotel on our month long trip. Amazing location but this is where the 4 stars ends. We were given a room which was so small you couldn't have your luggage open and walk around the bed and was nothing like the pictures on the website. It was like a sauna as the air con only pumped out hot air, but with windows open we only got about 3 hours sleep a night as was so noisy due to the trams. The worst aspect of the room was the bathroom - it was virtually unusable and for the first morning we had to go without using the shower. Â Â It was so small that you couldn't sit on the toilet properly as the shower/bath was in the way. Being a Turkish style half bath/shower it is too high to get in without having a step, so they provide you with a cheap, broken plastic one. We took it to reception & asked for a new one & after 3 hours we still hadn't received a new one. Called them and they brought us another broken one! We said it was no good & they then walked into each room in our area (3 were occupied by guests but no-one was in... Nice breach of privacy there!) and took their foot stools to try and find one which wasn't broken. On the third attempt they found an unbroken one for us but as soon as we put one foot on it, it broke. We gave up & dragged the chair into the bathroom to use, but with space so small we couldn't get to the toilet. Nightmare! Breakfast was poor for a 4 star hotel, poor choice, no milk for cereal, no bowls for the stale cereal, bad service, things not topped up, bottled water syphoned from a large tank using a hose.. Â Â  Â Sadly this hotel was not what we hoped for, and after booking Â & paying 6 months in advance we feel very ripped off. As a Travel Agent , this hotel will never be recommended to my clients, so the Ottoman Imperial has lost a lot of potential business.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbhayes
Reviews.Content: I visit Turkey and Istanbul many times over the period of a year on bussiness and stayed in many hotels in Istanbul and around Turkey, I have to say ottoman hotel imperial is one of the better hotels I've stayed in Istanbul due to location, great value, home like atmosphere, kind, polite, friendly and very helpfull staff. Location is great for people visiting Istanbul for the first time and wants to be close to all the historical sites. Rooms are fine, comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location - everything you need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: adilmalik
Reviews.Content: Simply put if you need a hotel right in the heart of Sultanahmet look no further. As everyone before has mentioned it is central to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and both the Spice and Grand Bazaar. Walking was very easy from here and only took a few hours to familiarise ourselves with the area. The staff were extremely friendly as we were greeted by the very friendly clerks Mehmet and Erhan, and also the friendliest porter you will ever meet, Hak Baba. Also if like me you had no idea what you where to go first, just speak to Handan and Ozlem, the in house one stop tourist guides. They will provide leaflets on all the tourist attractions and restaurants, and will make your reservations and travel arrangements if need be. If i have forgotten to mention anyones names I apologise as they were so friendly they all deserve a mention. P.S. if you enjoy the night life make sure you ask about Istiklal Caddesi in Taksim Square, its just a short taxi drive away and is buzzing untl the early hours of the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Friendliness Abound”
Reviews.Author: PCVagabond
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is near Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Excellent location on a quiet street. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was small but very clean and quite adequate. Some of our group had much larger rooms. They were all comfortable and clean. There's a cozy bar and a restaurant (with Whirling Dervish entertainment!). Full breakfast is served in the restaurant in the morning and was very nice. I'd definitely go again. Loved Istanbul, btw!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, next to Hagia Sofia”
Reviews.Author: parksg45
Reviews.Content: You cant get better location than this hotel, across from Hagia Sofia ,Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque are short walk away. We stayed in a room where the rates were little higher than regular rooms, but it was worth it. Our room was over looking Hagia Sofia, greta view to wake up to in the morning. Room was in good size and well decorated and kept. Breakfast food was good, cant complain. Staff are warm, kind and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: gonewest45
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed every minute of my stay at Ottoma Hotel Imperial, great turkish hospitality, staff are very helpful and friendly. Hotel is located next to Hagia Sofia and short walk away from Topkapi Palace and Blu Mosque, Grand Bazar is also close by, if you decide to walk it's about 15 minutes or with the tram it's about 5 minutes. Good size rooms, comfortable and clean. Breakfast is good, they have many different items of international and turkish food.

Reviews.Title: “an ottoman experience”
Reviews.Author: sagittarius54
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Istanbul and when we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is next to Hagi Sophia, Topkapi Palace a 5 mins walk away, The Blue Mosque was just in front of us and last but not least The Grand Bazaar so near , everything was within walking distance. The staff throughout our stay, were so friendly and Ozlem took us to one side and gave us some really good hints and tips about where to go and what to see. The hotel was spotless, the breakfast was ample,although the room was slightly small, it was really clean and comfortable.It was a memorable experience,and recommended 110%

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: friends1900
Reviews.Content: Very lovely hotel, we stayed for 4 nights and everyone in the party were very happy with all aspects of the hotel. Rooms were nice, clean and comfortable, do recommend paying a bit extra and take the larger room. No complaint with the location as it's near all the sites we wanted to visit. Staff are very nice, breakfast bufe had a good choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In The Old Part Of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: worldrussel
Reviews.Content: Bunch of us came down to Istanbul for a long weekend gateaway, we chose this hotel to be honest with you for no reason at all but I'm so glad we did. This was our first visit to Istanbul and the hotel staff made our visit one to remember for a long time. I thank all the personal for a great experience, they help organized very lovely activities. Excellent location, near to all the important sites, next to Hagia Sofia, close to Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, oh yehh the Grand Bazar, be careful dont get ripped off, you must bargain strongly is also close by. Rooms are in good size , ours was fine but couple of other friends had small rooms. Good food choice for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel... made our stay a memorable one”
Reviews.Author: Zain83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an unbelievable find. It has an amazing location (walking distance from Hagi Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, etc...!). The staff were outstanding... friendly and charming. They were really welcoming and it almost felt like a home away from home. They helped plan our days and were always available for a friendly chat and advice. The room (triple room) was nice and had plenty of room for the three of us. They were comfortable and clean with a very nice en suite bathroom. I would definitely recommend the hotel and if I were to go back to Istanbul I would not hesitate to stay there again! Thank you Ottoman Imperial staff... you are all wonderful and we will always remember our trip because of you!

Reviews.Title: “Almost like home”
Reviews.Author: world58
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were amazing, they made us feel like we were at home. They went out of there way to make our stay an enjoyable one, thank you so much. It helps the hotel is located near to all the sites we wanted to visit. Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are few minutes away, Hagia Sofia is right next door, matter affect our room was over looking Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazar is about 20 minutes walk away but you could take the tram , it only takes 5 minutes. Spice Bazar is within walking distance, Bosphorus is within walking distance, to be brief location is excellent. We had a great room , comfortable and clean. Do try the hotels Padisah restaurant one night, delicious food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sharkj77
Reviews.Content: First of all I dont know why this hotel is not rated higher , it's a beautiful hotel with amazing location, in the old part of the city, accross Hagia Sofia and close by to Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar ( be strong here when you bargain ). Rooms are ok, clean , comfortable but it was on the small side, we could have upgraded to a superior room but no big deal as most of the time we were out sightseeing. Very helpful staff, polite and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay”
Reviews.Author: whaz74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel few days when I first arrived to Istanbul also on my last say before I returned. I have no complaints, good staff, clean and pleasent room, good choice of food for breakfast, location is excellent in the heart of the old city almost next door to all the touristic sites. Would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knightr99
Reviews.Content: One of the classiest hotels I've stayed in. It just about ticks all the boxes. Location is great, next to Hagia Sofia, short distance away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Spice Market, Bosphoruse. Staff are great, helpful, polite, professional always have a smile on their face. Rooms are well decorated, comfortable. Also you get a good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: keen38
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, staff were excellent, made our stay very enjoyable. they were very helpful organizing many event for us. Hotel is located in a great area of sultanahmet, all historical sites are within minutes walking distance away. Rooms are bright, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul delight”
Reviews.Author: ajulian68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the better hotels we stayed around the world. Location is great, close to all the historical sites we wanted to visit, hagia Sofia is next door, Topkapi palace and Blue Mosque are walking distance away. Rooms are clean and comfortable, although our kids room were bit on the small side, no big deal. Excellent staff, good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: helenr15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend our wedding anniversary in Istanbul this past September. Chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial due to the reviews on this site. We were very pleased, when they found out we were there to celebrate our anniversary they up graded our room to a suite which was out of this world. Room was huge with a sitting area , very comfortable large bed, nicely decorated, with bath robe and slippers. We would like to thank the management for the thought. Good location, near all thge historiacal sites, excellent staff, very nice, polite and friendly. Will recommend this hotel to all our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENT CHOISE”
Reviews.Author: kostasCorfu
Reviews.Content: We had 3 wonderfull days in Ottoman Imperial, a very cosy, quiet, well situated and - most important - with extremely warm personel. Just besides Agya Sofia Museum, in the heart of the old city. Everybody has a smile for you, even after midnight !!! We would definetely stay there next time we will visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “AS I WERE HOME...!”
Reviews.Author: izk
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and smiley staff!! What you need abroad to feel comfortable!! A cozy-warm place to stay, clean and tidy as well as fully equipped. HOPEFULLY WE WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: OzzieTravellerUae
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located to enable walking access to all of Sultanahmet's attractions yet quiet and out of the hussle and bustle. Very friendly, helpful staff. Our room, although small was clean, quiet and comfortable - bed was excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: jessb1500
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like the complement the staff of ottoman hotel imperial as made our stay a pleasent one, they were all very helpful. Rooms are comfortable and clean, it does very in size according to the price. Has a great terrace to relax with a nice drink after visiting all the sites around sultanahmet. Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque are all cloes by, Hagia Sofia is next to the hotel. Popular grand bazar is about 15 minutes walk away. Spice market and bosphoruse is near by, I do recommend taking a boat trip around bosphoruse, it's cheap, it's woth it.

Reviews.Title: “A small jewel in the centre of the Old City of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tina041
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial with my nine year old daughter for 3 nights at the end of November and I was immensely pleased with the hotel, the beautiful and tasteful decoration of the room, the professionalism of the staff and the superb location of the hotel just across the street from the Aya Sophia and a few minutes' walk through cobbled streets from the Topkapi Palace. At times one had the impression of having been transported several centuries back in time, especially when hearing the prayers from a nearby minaret in the early morning hours. The breakfast was very good and varied and nicely presented and the whole stay at the hotel was imbued with that very special atmosphere that makes one wish to go back again as soon as possible. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid time at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: bwilliam63
Reviews.Content: Took my partner to Istanbul on a romantic short gateaway. Chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial after reading reviews of many other hotels in the area as we wanted to be close to the historical sites. Beautiful hotel, hotel manager upgraded our room to a room over looking Hagia Sofia, thank you so much, 10 out of 10 fo the room, it was comfortable and good size. Location is excellent, within minutes to Topkapi Palce and Blue Mosque. Great choice of food for breakfast. Thank you Ottoman Hotel Imperial for making our stay a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: zorach
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so well situated that it is possible to walk to the major heritage sites within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I rediscovered Constantinople!”
Reviews.Author: mantra777
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff, superb location and the suites are very nice and cosy....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: miller6918
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is one of the better hotels we stayed during our three week travel. Staff are great, always there to help you with any queries, friendly and polite. Location is great, right smack in the middle of all the historical sites, Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are within couple of minutes away. Rooms are comfortable and clean, room size though does very according to the price, we went for the the large room over looking Hagia Sofia and it was fantastic. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend - fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CoffeegirlUk
Reviews.Content: All aspects of our stay at the Ottoman Imperial were first class..A driver came to pick us up from the airport - saved getting a Taxi. The location was superb - right in the centre of Istanbul, yet on a quiet street away from the trams and traffic. The staff were excellent - nothing was too much trouble and they were very friendly and professional. The room was lovely - light, airy, clean, robes, slippers etc etc all the things you would like to have included whilst away were there. Breakfast was a most pleasant surprise too.. a huge buffet to suit all tastes (even my Husband who is particularly fussy!). To top it all, there was a short Sufi-dancing (i.e. Whirling Dervish) presentation in the restaurant which was absolutely incredible. If you've never seen it before you HAVE to go. The beauty of it also was the fact it was right there - you don't have to make a special trip to see it, it only lasted 20 minutes, which didn't impede on our evening out, and it was very personal.. only about 6 of us watching. Beguiling and powerful to say the least. All in all a fabulous hotel, I would go back there and I would recommend anyone going to Istanbul to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PS1348
Reviews.Content: I loved every moment of my stay in this place. It is strategically located in old part of Istanbul near all historical places. The rooms are clean,comfortable and air-conditioned. The real asset of this hotel is its staff . They are all very helpful, polite and friendly. I want to specially thank guest relations ladies, Ozlem and Handan. These ladies are very knowledgeable and go beyond their duties to help you to find your way in Istanbul and make necessary reservations for you. Besides you can always enjoy their kind smile ! I would like to thank Erhan and Ozgur for their help and gentle behaviour. The showers are rather high and some rooms that facing the streets could be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier”
Reviews.Author: Bella1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I don't think you could choose a better hotel to stay in in Istanbul. It is brilliantly located with all the major sites and shopping in walking distance. The Hagia Sophia was outside my bedroom window!. The rooms are spotlessly clean, really comfortable, obviously newly refurbished and the brand new bathrooms sported showers with incredible pressure. Coming from drought stricken Australia that was a real treat. Oldies may struggle as mine was over the bath but a minor issue. It still mantains character and the staff are helpful, fun and friendly. The laughing Ozlem entertained us no end. We felt completely at home and I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The airport pick up is a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Located in a perfect spot of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: alsonm
Reviews.Content: Well you cant beat the location of ottoman Hotel Imperial, located on a quite side street next to Hagia Sofia, other historical sites as Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern are close by, stone throw away. Tram line is close by, use it to visit the Grand bazar, the famous Bosphoruse is not far aweay either. Staff are great, they made our stay very pleasent , thank you so much. Rooms are comfortable, nicely decorated and clean, altough size of the room varies according to the price. Good choice of food for breakfast. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good standard of room”
Reviews.Author: Citygirl-on-tour
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the hotel to be upgraded to a suite, which had a view of the Aya Sofia which you could not beat. The hotel had a lovely cool outside area, which was a great escape from the busy city outside. I would not say the drinks were cheap, but the location makes it possible to come back throughout the day. We have friends in Istanbul, so I would suggest getting out to Bebek & Besiktas where the locals socialise (but unfortunaltely this takes a 2 hour round taxi ride for the traffic, not expensive but timely). The Grand Bazaar is definitely a highlight, just try to blend in so you are not treated and charged as a tourist. This is 2- mins from the hotel, with Topaki & Aya Sofia on the doorstep. In summary grt location, okay breakfast., worth a go for a first visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love the location of Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: walkers72
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for a short time as we didn't have much time left on our schedule, as we are into seeing the historical side of each city, this hotel was perfect for all the important sites in Istanbul. Location is great, you're right across hagia sofia and minutes away from topkapi palace, blue mosque, underground cistern. Tram line is close by also if you wanted to visit the popular grand bazar and the spice bazar, although you can walk to it, I would say it'll take about 15 minutes. Bosphorus is close by, I would recommend taking the boat ride, it's not expensive. Staff are lovely, always there to help you out. they can also organize many events for you. Rooms are clean and comfortable. I would choose this hotel again If I come back to Istanbul one day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and very pleasant and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Steveola
Reviews.Content: This was one of the stops my wife and I made on our honeymoon. We had a lovely suite. The hotel knew it was our honeymoon and gave us an amazing room with an incredible view of St. Sophia right outside of our window. There were roses and jewels on our pillows and chocolates waiting for us on the bed. Later they sent up a really nice fruit basket. All of the staff were more than friendly and knowledgeable about the area. They went out of their way to meet all of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bberbs
Reviews.Content: I searched for the perfect reasonably priced lodging and I found it at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial - a lovely boutique hotel on a quiet street facing Hagia Sofia and within 5 minutes of Topkapi and the Blue Mosque. A perfect location!! The staff is welcoming, especially Merih, the receptionist and Ozlem, who handles guest relations. Both of them are constantly busy advising/assisting guests to make their stay most enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast served in an enclosed terrace is excellent and comprehensive (even includes honeycomb). A relaxing outdoor terrace not only is perfect for meals, but also offers cocktails and entertainment in the evening. One night a whirling dervish entertained us. The rooms are, as you might guess, decorated Ottoman style and are very clean and airy. If you need more space, reserve a premium room (some of them face Hagia Sofia). Ammenities in bathroom, bathrobes etc. Even receive turkish delight in an adorable turkish candy dish placed on your bed. I would absolutely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid time in Istanbul at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: williams92
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time in Istanbul, Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff made it that much better. There always willing to make that extra effort to make your stay a memorable one. Thank you to each and every one of the hotel staff and the managment team. Location is very good, close to all the historical sites, across from Hagia Sofia, minutes walking distance away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, tram line, restaurants and cafee's. We would sure recommend this hotel to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “The best marriage between east and west”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam77
Reviews.Content: There is no other place to stay when you visit Istanbul. This beautifull hotel with friendly and professional staff who will take every effort to make your stay even more pleasent. Locationwise you couldn't do any better as the hotel is located across from Hagia Sofia and next to a small mosque also built by the great architect Sinan. At night this area of Istanbul is as friendly and safe as in daytime, so you can go out and enjoy Instabul any way you like it. We especially enjoyed the beautifull sunsets from Galatabridge and smoking waterpipe on terrass at a graveyard. At night the muezzin calls for the fist time at 5 o'clock which sounds mystical through the dark Istanbul night. For a short or long stay this is the hotel to stay at. I don't believe you can find friendlier staff or better rooms anywhere else. The terasses are great and the hotel organises typical turkish events on them like live turkish music or Soufi-dancers. Breakfast is a perfect marriage between east and west: a buffet with all the ingredients for a traditional turkish breakfast but also buns, rolls, scrambeld eggs, sausages etc. Enjoy your stay, I'm sure you will enjoy it as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: jerryp082
