Reviews.Content: We had a superb experience at the Ottoman Imperial. The rooms were spacious and clean, staff was very helpful and you can not get a better location, right near all of the historic sites. We had a non hotel related problem and the staff was very co-operative in helping us out.

Reviews.Title: “Great City to visit.”
Reviews.Author: warnerf87
Reviews.Content: This is not my first time to Istanbul, I've visited here on many accessions, everytime I'm back it leaves me with a great feeling. Also this is our third time staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, it's a great hotel with excellent staff with great turkish hospitality, they make you feel almost like at home. Rooms are great comfortable, clean and good size, location is outstanding as you're minutes away from all the historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very pleasant time at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: falice96
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Istanbul, it was our first visit to this beautiful city, full of history. Ottoman Hotel Imperial made our stay that much extra special. Staff are superb, very friendly and helpful, arranged a lot of activities for us. Rooms are clean and comfortable, our room was overlooking Hagia Sofia, what a beautiful view. Location is perfect, close to all the historical sites as Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern and as mentioned Hagia Sofia, which is right across. Good choice of variety of International and Turkish food for breakfast and has a great restaurant for dinner that serves excellent Turkish cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service-great location with huge breakfast and GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: LaurieLev
Reviews.Content: I have now found my home away from home and can't wait to return to Istanbul and this hotel. My sister and family and myself and my family came in the summer of 2007 when they first opened. Once the assistant general manager Yasar Celen discovered that, he treated me like visiting family, as did his well trained staff. One of the bellboys Erhan even fixed a small suitcase I had bought in Cappodochia that broke the night before I was headed to the airport to return home which saved me a LOT of aggravation. I can't say enough about the kind, helpful, and generous spirit of the staff. Mehmet , the night reception desk manager shared with me me his favorite baklava. Ozlem customer service ALWAYS had a happy smile on her face. The room was fine, had flat screen TV with remote, minibar, the usual but the last night I returned from the Ukraine, they upgraded me to a suite with a jacuzzi in the room which was heavenly! And a great surprise. The location is right behind the Hagia Sofia, and close to the Blue Mosque, and a short walk from the Grand Bazaar and a tram or walk from the spice market and many of the famous sites. The breakfast was tasty, large, and had a little bit of everything you could ask for. It was HUGE!! I get hungry thinking of it. They have evening entertainment, free internet in the bar, a nice spacious lobby, and the decorations are very attractive and well thought out. I will NEVER stay at another hotel when I come to Istanbul and because they are all so warm, I look forward to my next visit with my daughter and husband!! And they just opened a second hotel the new Ottoman Hotel Park in Sultanamet which I'm sure with the same management will be equally as wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Again a great stay, just as good as last year's visit”
Reviews.Author: BigO1981
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at Ottoman Hotel Imperial this year again in september when we came to visit my family. The location is prime, the hotel is well run with knowledgable and friendly employees. It is right next to the Hagia Sofia and across from Sultan Ahmet (blue mosque) square. The employees try their best to help you, meet and exceed your expectations. The included breakfast buffet features Turkish favorites for breakfast to european and American classics for breakfast. the restaurant is great for dinner as well. we will stay here again and keep recommending this excellent venue to our friends and family. No wonder they won the Tourism award for 2008. Wouldn't be surprised if they win this year either.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: billingw
Reviews.Content: Terrific stay beginning with welcoming orientation (no sales), great breakfast, free wi-fi and clean spacious rooms. The staff was very friendly and service was great. The location is perfect for most of Istanbul's major sites - within 10 minutes walk from many.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish delight ?”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldManchester
Reviews.Content: It is almost impossible to select a hotel in Istanbul on a first visit without becoming agitated : such a lot to choose from. We finally decided to be in the thick of things and chose the Ottoman Imperial in Sultanahmet. The location is unbeatable; the Byzantine cisterns and Aya Sofia a few metres away. The Blue Mosque is across the gardens opposite, and Topkapi Palace round the back of the hotel, no more than a 5-minute walk. Amazing. You can get to these famous sights before the huge coaches arrive ( just) and go back later to watch the sun set, when the multitudes have melted away. The hotel is compact, the staff friendly and helpful, and everything spotless.. Breakfasts are good and served in a very pleasant raised room with large windows that let in the morning light and a view of the surrounding buildings ( NOT the Aya Sofia as seems the case on the website).There is a pretty terrace too for a drink, but the food for dinner is average and overpriced for what it is ( eg we were given stale bread ). We had a premium room in the main building ( standard rooms are in the annex across the terrace, and can be vulnerable to street noise, like the tram, or one we saw faced a solid wall !). Our room was not big, though the bed was large and comfortable. However, the bathroom was miniscule. My husband is 6 ft tall, and I wasnt sure how he would be able to have a shower without risking if not life certainly limb. You have to climb into the shower and then be an acrobat to get out again without the aid of a safety grip. I certainly found every morning a challenge and we stayed 6 nights so this was not ideal. Other guests also mentioned the size of their bathrooms in negative terms. The other annoyance, basically because of poor design, is that even in the permium rooms our bedhead was on the same wall as the bedhead of the next room. We were woken up, sometimes in the middle of the night, by guests talking,sometimes loudly, but not unreasonably, in their own bed ! But the location of the hotel is perfect. The tram is nearby, allowing guests to travel down to the Bosphorus ferries or up towards the university and the Suleimaniya Mosque ( have lunch at the Ali Baba cafe, but see the menu first for prices !) Take a commuter ferry from Serkeci to the Asian shore ( a mere 3 TL return, set fare,) to eat in Uskadur, or Karadoy where the locals eat. Walk to the Galata Bidge (20 minutes). Eat a fish sandwich near the bridge and enjoy this vibrant, bustling city. Or just stroll around Sultanahmet. It's all very accessible from the Ottoman Imperial, and the staff will give you all the information you need. We took the stress out of arrival by ordering a hotel car to meet us at Attaturk airport . It's a 25-minute drive, and costs 50 TL. A good idea, and you know you'll get there without an unexpected detour.

Reviews.Title: “good location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: karenanddave55
Reviews.Content: Good location, average food. staff very nice. Ozlem (guest relations) was brilliant- she booked up lots of things for us so we did not have to queue, and was so enthusiastic and helpful. the restaurant where breakfast is served is very nice, with a good choice. our room was a little on the small side with a terible view from the balcony, but it was clean and had all the amenities you expect from a 4 star hotel. the excellent location right in the heart of the old town was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Almost like home”
Reviews.Author: phutchingson
Reviews.Content: Staff at this hotel trully make you feel like you're at home, they help you with everything from arranging a Turkish Night show to suggesting a nice restaurant to visit in the area. Location is great, close to all the important sites, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace all within walking distance. Rooms are clean and comfortable. although our room was on the bit small side. I do recommend this hotel, excellent staff, good value , great location and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bobt42
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, staff are great, always willing to go that extra mile to make you feel at home. Another good point of this hotel is the location, located in the heart of the old city Sultanahmet, you are within minutes away from all the historical sites. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonSandS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial on our first trip to Istanbul. The hotel's location couldn't be better - it's right next to the Aya Sofya in the middle of the tourist area of Sultan Ahmet. The Blue Mosque is just 5 mins away and the Grand Bazaar is a ten minute walk. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms are well appointed with a lovely welcome of Turkish Delight, robes and slippers. One warning - be sure to ask NOT to be put in room 101 as it's right by the reception area. We spent our first night in that room and were kept awake all night by the noise from people coming and going. The next day we asked to be moved and spent the second night in a lovely, bigger room on the third floor. No compensation was offered but we were given the upgraded room for free. The rooms were on the small side - we had to pay extra for our good-sized rooms. I think this would be a problem throughout the city though as it's a very busy place. Other reviews have mentioned the noise. I think it's unrealistic to expect a good night's sleep in Istanbul without ear plugs and even then it's a very noisy city. The morning call to prayer is around 5am and sounds across the whole city, plus there are dogs barking and other noises all night. However, none of these are the hotel's fault and would be a problem all over the city. It probably didn't help that we were there during Eid so the city was in full celebratory swing. The breakfast was lovely and the whole hotel is friendly, warm and beautifully decorated. I would definitely recommend this hotel to first time visitors to the city, and people wanting a special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great location”
Reviews.Author: doverr
Reviews.Content: We were amazed of Ottoman Hotel Imperial location, all the important sites are at your door step. Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Underground Cistern are within two minutes away, Hagia Sofia is across the hotel, also close to all the restaurants and cafes of Sultanahmet , tram stop is close by also, you can use it to travel to Taksim ( the city centre ), Grand Bazar is also close by, what can I say, excellent location. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff are excellent, very friendly , helpfull and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brown18
Reviews.Content: I would rate Ottoman Hotel highly recommended. Staff made our stay a very plasent one, very helpfull, always there to answer all our questions and helped arrange a lot of activities for us. Rooms are clean and comfortable nicely decorated. Beautiful outdoor terrace to relax, have nice cold drink. Breakfast was good vith many international and turkish food. Close to all the important historical sites around Sultanahamet area, all within few steps away. I would recommend visiting the popular Grand Bazar and the Spice bazar which are not to far from tha hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a short weekend gateaway”
Reviews.Author: hayley_lisa
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a great place to getaway for a weekend. Ottoman hotel Imperial is located so close to all the sites it makes it great place to stay. Across from Hagia Sofia, two minutes away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, tram line, restaurants and cafees around Sultanahmet area. Rooms are comfortable and staff are great. Good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to begin and end a trip to Turkey”
Reviews.Author: sperlman215
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul is in the heart of Sultanahmet - literally in the backyard of the Aya Sofya. You can't beat this location, the rooms are gorgeous, the breakfast generous. But the best reason to stay here is the staff. We began our trip to Turkey at this hotel and returned to it at the end of our trip. When we first arrived, we were received with warm smiles, typical of the Turkish people. The concierge and reception staff were extremely helpful with travel information and reservations. We didn't get all of their names, but Erhan, super special bellhop and all the rest, made a great impression. When we came back to Istanbul after traveling around Turkey, we were welcomed like family. And when we left, we knew we would miss them and we do. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sallyj80
Reviews.Content: Istanbul trully is a beautiful city, this was our first visit to Istanbul and it wont be the last. Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a great hotel to stay during your visit to Istanbul. We chose this hotel through tripadvisor site and we were very delighted. Location is perfect, near to all the important sites, Aya Sofia is right across, Topkapi Palace , Blue Mosque and Underground Cistern are within few minutes walk. Tram stop is close by also so you can easly reach other parts of Istanbul. Rooms are clean, air-conditioned and comfortable. Excellent restaurant at the hotel, serves great international and Turkish cuisine. has a great garden terrace to relax after a lond day of site visiting, have a nice cold dring. Will recommend Ottoma Hotel Imperial to rest of my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wdarren65
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good location. Located by all the important historical sites around Sultanahmet area. You dont have to walk far to get to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque etc.. Great service, staff are very good , very helpful, very professional. Rooms are comfortable and clean, decent size. Nice terrace garden to relax, have a drink or a nice dinner from the hotel great restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nicolosit99
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by our friend who stayed there for few nights last year on their holiday. It was a good choice, location wise it's perfect, near to all the important sites, in few minutes you could get to Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia is right next to the hotel. Tram line is also close by , you could take it to get to grand bazar, taksim area which is the city centre. Bosphorus is close by also, I do recommend the short bosphoruse tour. Rooms are clean, nicely decorated, air-conditioned and comfortable, bit on the small side, but you can upgrade to an larger room for a small extra charge. We were thinking about it but at the decided not to as we were out sight seeing most of the day only return to the room to sleep. Beautiful terrace to relax and enjoy a nice cold drink or a romantic dinner, restaurant serves great food, has both international and turkish cuisine menue. Staff are great, very helpfull, made us feel right at home from the start.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: adamsk_9
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a fantastic location this hotel is located, if you dont want to walk far to see the historical sites in Istanbul , Ottoman Hotel Imperial is ideal. Located in the old part of Istanbul, across Aya Sofia museum, few minutes away to Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Tram line is close by so it's easy to get to city centre Taksim, which is on the new part of Istanbul, Grand Bazar is about 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, pending on how fast you walk or take the tram. Staff are great, very helpfull, kind , polite, always have a smile on their face. Rooms are good, clean, comfortable and air-coditioned with good working tv. Has a great terrace for relaxing or a cold drink after a walking around under the hot sun. Great restaurant serving international and turkish food.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: TWFB
Reviews.Content: I want to personally thank everyone at the Imperial hotel for making our stay relaxing, enjoyable and above all memorable. There is a certain apprehension that goes with going somewhere new, having no idea of what to expect and wanting to experience a culture but enjoying the comforts of "home". From the car service at the airport to every smile that greeted me everywhere I went I can honestly say the hotel and staff have managed to exceed lofty expectations and add value to everything we wanted to do and did. (example: We were celebrating a birthday, and as a surprise on the big day, they brought a beautiful (locally made) cake and bottle of wine to the lucky persons room) (and if you are wondering, yes! it was delicious) We came with no real itinerary, but the staff took the time to explain all the options and even developed a personal touring programme. And the private guide they were able to get for us was FANTASTIC. We did a group tour one day, but unfortunately there were some barriers in the language. Our private guide (Taner) had no such problems, he provided fantastic insights, took us to the best Kebap in town, and gave us all a new appreciation for the country, its history and traditions. The girls of the front desk, what can I say. They are charming, very attractive, friendly and love to have a good laugh. I doubt you will find a more helpful staff in Constantinople. We did not have dinner in the hotel, but with a little local insight we did taste some of the finest food in all the city. I can highly recommend Poseidon (restaurant serves the freshest fish, sits ON the water with fantastic views and the food is phenomenal) Also worth a trip is Sunset!!!! The cab driver couldn't find it, (went to several shops to ask help) but we got there, no problem :) Once at the restaurant, East definitely meets West. Heated lamps, everyone sitting outside, great service, delicious food and the most scintillating views. An exquisite menu and wine list to choose from and I think it is fair to say that at neither of these restaurants did I see any tourists. This was where the locals came to eat! Reservations and taxi's were all arranged by the hotel (and I am not sure how easy they were to get) The hotel rooms were clean, it was great having air conditioning and nice to see linens being cleaned daily for a change again. The location is second to none, from the cobbled streets to Aya Sophia everything is a stones throw away, most of it even closer than you think. I would recommend all those visiting this beautiful city to stay in the old town if going for pleasure and sightseeing. After a long day it really is lovely to sit on the hotel terrace with a good stiff drink! I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and fully intend on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good as Gold”
Reviews.Author: litehosep
Reviews.Content: About 10 of us stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial towards end July for 4 days on our final portion of our long holiday. I have to say this is a beautiful hotel, we did not know what to expect as one of our other family member made all the accommodation arrangments for our trip and at the end he was not able to make it, but we were more than pleased with the hotel. Staff are great, friendly, helpfull, polite, helped us out with many things. Rooms are very clean, air-conditioned and comfortable, but I do have to say some of the rooms were small, therefore if you're looking for a larger room, you need to pay a little extra, but than again you spaend most of the outside site seeing. Has a beautiful terrace to relax, have a cold drink or turkish tea or coffee ( warn you it is strong ). Great restaurant for dinner and lunch, serves delicious international and turkish cuisine. Excellent location, close by to all the historical sites as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, tram line, grand bazar etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great value”
Reviews.Author: janetm48
Reviews.Content: Spend a weekend with my friends in Istanbul at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, chose this hotel based on reviews on trip advisor site. Hotel is located perfectly in the heart of all the important sites as Aya Sofia museum, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Bosphoruse is close by, restaurants, tram line etc.. Staff are great, helped with any inquiry we had, arranged a lot of extra activities for us. Rooms are comfortable, clean, air-conditioned, little small but no problem as we spend most of our time outside exploring the beautiful city. Breakfast was great, has a nice terrace to have a nice cold drink and socialize.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but it could be a great one with a few changes.”
Reviews.Author: chaells
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to Aya Sofia in Sultanahmet. The staff were top notch - the concierge behind the desk, the hostess who gave us an overview of things to do and see in the city, the restaurant staff, the porters... I'd like to especially mention Erhan Deger, who went above and beyond with his warm, friendly service. We were not charged for tea on our last evening in the restaurant, and we were even presented with small token gifts by some restaurant staff the night before our departure. The outdoor restaurant had amazing views and ambience with candlelight and live reed flute playing. Breakfasts were wonderful. Now for the "needs improvement": the room a/c was clearly malfunctioning - the room stayed fairly warm and the a/c unit sprayed water droplets into the room and onto the bed. The bar fridge did not keep things cold enough. There were spots of mold in the shower stall corners. Finally, the restaurant: lovely ambience and service as mentioned, but it was very low quality food at dinner. Not nearly worth the hefty bill. Restaurant management have to get their act together. That aside, nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, equally fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Korehan
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is so well situated. It is in a busy area where noise is no issue at all. The rooms and facilities that the Hotel provides is what each Guest needs. The Staff, starting from the assistant Manager Yasar Bey, Reception staff Ebru, Concierge Erhan and the Restaurant staff together with House Keeping are so Hospitable and friendly. They will help you out with whatever your requirements are.I would without any hesitation recoment this hotel to anyone who wishes to enjoy the City of multiple Cultures and absorb the History. To all in the Ottoman Hotel that gave us great service while staying in 204 and 203 from 10/08/09 - 17/08/09, THANK YOU VERY MUCH. We will all be back next year INSALLAH. Regards, Korehan Dora - London

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time in Istanbul, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: steveryder66
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the managment and the staff of Ottoman Hotel Imperial who made our stay a very pleasent one. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, they look after you like family. You could get to all the important historical sites in minutes, location is perfect. Rooms are clean, air-conditioned and comfortable. Breakfast is great, you have a large variety choices of food both international and turkish. Lovely terace to enjoy a drink , lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cozy...”
Reviews.Author: carmen621
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our honeymoon. It was a wonderful experience. The property is really charming and is directly behind Hagia Sophia which means it's very close to everything you'll want to see in Istanbul. When we arrived, the front desk and the guest relations lady were very helpful and friendly. The porter, Erhan, was also very helpful and it was particularly nice that he remembered our names and was very timely in helping if there were any questions. Rooms were clean (which is my biggest hangup) and the service was excellent. We really enjoyed our stay here and we would definitely return if we are able to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel to stay for business travel”
Reviews.Author: sarahmiami74
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to good reviews on trip advisor site, didnt know what to expect, I was only in Istanbul for 3 nights on business, to my pleasent surprise I was very pleased with Ottoman Hotel Imperial, the room was good, clean , comfortable and air conditioned, you need the air-condition at this time of the year in Istanbul as it's very hot, good spread for breakfast, close to all the important historical sites although I did not have much time to visit any of them, next time I'll come back for a proper visit. Staff are great, very helpfull and friendly, hotel provides airport transfer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rovshana
Reviews.Content: We spent weeks before our trip to Istanbul trying to find a decent place to stay in Sultahahmet and after reading lots of good reviews on Trip Adviser Ottoman Imperial was the one that we decided to with. Perfect location, right behind the Hagia Sofia, very close to all the historical sites, good restaurants and tram line, that you can use to reach other parts of Istanbul. Very cozy and very very clean hotel, beautiful terrace, friendly staff, great buffet breakfast. However we had few little problems. Rooms were nice, but very small. Bathrooms even smaller. We had our shower door broken and had to use it that way all 3 days. The A/C was not cooling our room very efficiently. Besides, since you have to remove the card key every time you leave the room (energy saving) there is no way you can leave for the day and keep the A/C running. So when you come back in the evening it takes few hours min to cool your room, which is quite a problem considering an extremely hot weather in Istanbul in August. Other than that everything was fine. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: scubasam501
Reviews.Content: Excellent little boutique hotel right behind Hajia Sophia. Walk to the Blue Mosque, Hajia Sofia the Grand Bazaar and the Topkapi Palace. one block from the tram line. Excellent restaurants within a short walk. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Full breakfast included. Reasonably priced and beautifully decorated. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed”
Reviews.Author: ewings19
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed in many different types of hotels around the world during our holidays, from a 3 star hotel in Egypt to a 5 star hotel in Thailand, I would say this one rates top on our list. Very friendly and helpfull staff, they arranged many activities for us, hotel is close to all the historical sites as hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, underground cistern, grand bazar, bosphoruse, tram line. Rooms are clean and comfortable, only thing is a bit on the small side so is the bathroom, but no problem as you're only in the room to go to sleep. Has a great terrace, to wind down after a long day sightseeing, have a cold drink to cool of or you can have your dinner there. I could go on and go on, to keep it short I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: swebber01
Reviews.Content: I was in Turkey for 2 weeks, spend one week in Istanbul at Ottoman Hotel Imperial, I would highly recommend this hotel. Within minutes from all the important sites as Hagia Sofia ( across the hotel ), two minutes to Blue Mosque and few minutes from Topkapi palace, tram line is close by if you want to visit the Taksim area which is the city centre full of bars and resturants. Satff were great, helpfull and friendly, rooms are ok, clean and comfortable, good choice of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: bhandarisonal
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this hotel after reading some of th reviews on this site. The location of the hotel is great as all the sites are within walking distance, however, the hotel stay as such did not offer much. The staff was pleasant but not very helpful. Rooms are too small and bathrooms even smaller Moreover, the room we were given had maintainence issues. The clothes hook/ toilet paper stand, etc. were all coming off. Instead of offering to change the room, a repair person was sent after an hour or so. The AC in room was barely effective and too much noise comes from the street. Overall not a great stay. Only for those who will want to be located next to the historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, warm service”
Reviews.Author: MIAGUYMIAMI
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The location is unbeatable, as other reviewers have stated. 3 of the most important tourist sights in Istanbul are within 3-5 minutes walk. The staff is extremely friendly and warm and make you feel at home, especially Merie and Erhan (sorry if misspelled) Breakfast is very enjoyable and there is free Internet access via a laptop in the bar. And the call of the muezzin at 5:15 a.m. didn't even disturb me! A great base for visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: EMJUk
Reviews.Content: If you want to visit the old part of Istanbul this is the hotel to stay at. Situated on a 'quiet' road [and there are not many of these in Istanblul] near to the Topkapi Museum and the Blue Mosque, it is the ideal location for a sight seeing visit, and the inner courtyard a perfect location to sit in the sun and enjoy a beer or glass of wine at the end of a tiring day. If I wanted to make any criticism it would perhaps be the size of the room, although ours looked to be one of the smallest. Decent breakfast and the evening meal was good value for money. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality, accurate and with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Familiyman
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Imperial is the best hotel in Istanbul when you wish to explore Istanbul; close to all major sights - all on walking distance. The Hotel itself is very beautiful and the staff is very friendly, accurate and service with a smile. Especially Merih, Handan and Erhan made us feel really at home. They served above self.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: Jorsalfar
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in an old redecorated building. Nice room (a little on the small side) with good beds. A fine backyard/bar/garden/ restaurant where we in the evening could enjoy the sunset, and later the stars, the moon and the birds rising from the minarets of The Blue Mosque when the loudspeakers called for worship. Hotel ideally situated near Hagia Sofia, The Blue Mosgue and The Tokapi Palace. The employees of the hotel are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location . Very helpul and pleasant personnel”
Reviews.Author: PghTraveler5
Reviews.Content: Great location for visiting major sites and avoiding daily Istanbul traffic. The employees were incredibly helpful. The courtyard was a great place to unwind and relax.Great value

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel right at home”
Reviews.Author: smcnair
Reviews.Content: From the time they picked us up from the airport Ottoman Hotel Imperial staff made you feel right at home till our last day. Staff are great, very helpful, friendly, excellent service. You can't beat the location either, right in the middle of Sultanahmet close to all the important attractions. Our room was over looking Hagia Sofia, clean and comfortable. Great terrace garden to relax after visiting all the sites. You can have something to drink or have your meal. Good selection of food for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a tourist!”
Reviews.Author: cyncity74
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, the service is mostly good and the rooms are decent - good size flat screen TV and a jacuzzi bath tub :-) I had a view of Haya Sofia from my window, and itÂ´s fairly easy to get around to the tourist spots around the city. Only issue, it is far from all non-touristy things like good shopping and partying.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Great Location - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: andreab25
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading many hotel reviews on the site and we wanted to be close to all the sites we wanted to visit. Although there are many hotels in Sultanahmet area we decided on Ottoman Hotel Imperial due to it"s location and good value. We were not disappointed, hotel is right by Hagia Sofia and short walk away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, tram line, restaurants and cafes. We had a nice room, little on the small side but the bathroom was nice size. Rooms are clean, air-conditioned and comfortable. Excellent staff, very helpful and polite. Our airport transfer to the hotel was included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, in every respect”
Reviews.Author: gjcm
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The location is good being close to attractions, the own website descriptions are entirely accurate. The staff could not have been more helpful, cheerful and generally charming. The terrace is a delight whether it be for a cool drink, tea in the afternoon or dinner in the evening. The breakfast buffet was excellent and always looked good. The hotel is close enough to main attractions for you to pop back and enjoy the air conditioning when its hot, and then pop out again once you have regained composure. I do not hesitate to recommend this value for money hotel and I spend about 80 nights a year in hotels. The only watch point would be if you have any mobility issues, discuss them with the hotel first. I found them most accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in Istanbul at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: psummers52
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I decided to take my mother for a long weekend getaway for her birthday, we decided to visit Istanbul as we have not been there yet. We chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial by chance and we're so glad we did. Location is so great as it's a short distance walk to Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, across from Hagia Sofia. Grand bazar and Bosphoruse are near by also, you could either walk or take the tram. Rooms are clean and comfortable, cleaned every day and fresh towels supplied each day. staff are great at this hotel, they make you feel right at home, they arranged many visits for us. Good choice of variety of food for breakfast. I would recommend ottoman Hotel Imperial to my friends and rest of my family.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: vgoodrich
Reviews.Content: During my business trip to Istanbul I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 2 nights, to bad I didnt have much time to see any historical sites, because this hotel is located close to all the historical sites. Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Underground Cistern all within short distance away, you're not far from restaurants and shops of Sultanhamet. Rooms are clean and comfortable, room size does vary on price. Staff are great, very helpful. Provides airport transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: hruby
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet, very lovely hotel, ideally located in the old part of Istanbul, you can reach all the important historical sites within minutes. Staff are very helpful, polite, spoke excellent english, rooms are clean, decent size, comfortable, breakfast choice was good, nice terrace to lounge and have your tea or a drink, good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: sthompson51
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a month holiday , stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul the 3 nights of our holiday. Istanbul is a great place to visit, it was our first trip there and we'll be back again. Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a very good hotel with great location, excellent staff. Rooms are good, clean, comfortable and air-conditioned. Close by to all the important sites to visit. Tram line is few steps away from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Good value, Located in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: vrandall
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in many hotels around the world, Ottoman Hotel Imperial has to be one of the best hotel we stayed. We stayed in Istanbul for 4 nights, chose Ottoman Hotel Imperial after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. I'm we did, good value, excellent location, friendly staff. Located in Sultanahmet, close by to all the important site, couple of us had a room over looking the Hagia Sofia, ofcourse we had to pay little extra but it was worth it. Our room was clean very comfortable, nice size, air conditioned, breakfast was great with variety of choices, great terrace to unwine and have a nice cold drink. Hote's restaurant, Padisah restaurant is great, serves Ottoman cuisine, it was delicious. I do recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: citygroup
Reviews.Content: Although I only stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for only 2 nights during my business trip to Istanbul, I was very pleased with the hotel. Location is great if you're looking to visit the historical sites, all within few minutes walking distance. Hagia Sofia is right across the hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable, good choice of food for breakfast, staff are very helpful , they provided me with airport transfer. Did not have time to visit the historical sites due to my business schedule but I'll go back for a proper visit next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location, Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: edwardjames55
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Istanbul, large family group of 8 of us went there for a long weekend, friend of mine back home recommended Ottoma Hotel Imperial to me as her and her husband had stayed there last year. Hotel is located right in the middle of all the important sites in the hart of Sultanahmet. Topkapi Palace. Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Underground Cistern, Bosphoruse, Grand Bazar, restaurants, cafee's, tram line all within short walking distance. Staff are great, very helpfull and friendly, they always go that extra mile to make your experience a pleasent one. Rooms are very clean, air-conditioned and comfortable. Also they provide air port transfer. I highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ALCanberra
Reviews.Content: Excellent locataion in a quiet street in the older part of Istanbul with the Aya Sofya at your doorstep. The staff Gulan, Merih and Erhan were very friendly and helpful and they spoke very good English. Newly refurbished with great beds and a good breakfast. We were delighted with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “don't overlook this hotel...great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: adaytripper2
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that I am just getting around to writing this review, because this hotel is truly wonderful. My friend and I made the long trek to Istanbul, welcomed by this quaint and spacious hotel. The staff was very friendly and escorted us to our room which had an unbelievable view of Aya Sofia. Being in Sultanahmet made seeing many of the sights very convenient. Strangely, for its busy location, I found the hotel to be quiet at night. The rooms were clean and well-appointed. If I had one complaint, it was the shower. The step off from the shower to the floor required a step stool. It was okay for us, but if you have difficulty transferring out of the shower because of physical ailments, this will be a problem. Otherwise, I would stay here again. I have stayed at some of the most beautiful hotels in the world, and this quaint little gem is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “What a Beauty”
Reviews.Author: jian75
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great staff makes you feel right at home from the minute you walk in. Excellent location if you're into visiting all the historical sites, lovely decor, rooms are clean and comfortable and air-conditioned, great choice of food for breakfast. They provide pick up service from the airport which was great.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel at a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: msilveira
Reviews.Content: It was a experience very special. The hotel has a great garden terrace to relax and have a drink. The breakfast selection is great, try the great Turkish cuisine in the hotel restaurant it's delicious. Splendid location. The best of Istanbul. A special congratulation for the staff. Very good service based on Turkish hospitality. And also a special thanks to Mehmet. Mauricio and Rebeca from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bstalworth
Reviews.Content: Located in the excellent position of old town. All the important historical sites are all walking distance away. Staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast selection is great, try the great Turkish cuisine in the hotel restaurant Padisha Restaurant, it's delicious. Great garden terrace to relax and have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “a tranquil beautiful hotel in the perfect location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: teny
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel ottoman for only 2 nights, it may not be the cheapest hotel in sultanahmet but a quiet haven right in the middle and due to the fantastic location really close to all the major sights and tram stops i feel that it is worth every penny. the rooms in this boutique hotel are lovely clean and modern but somehow you feel that you are in traditional istanbul. After a busy day sight seeing the perfect end to perfect days. all in all a perfect city center hotel. Breakfast continental but very good. the staff very helpful and friendly. My only complaint was that i didnt spend more time there!!!! I would not stay anywhere else in sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful City , Lovely Hotel in Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: brucenewman42
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul after hearing so many beautiful things from our friends. They recommended we stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for many reasons, mostly good value for your money, outstanding location, near to all the historical sites we wanted see as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar ( do bargain on the price when you go there, be strong, dont give into them at the end you will buy it for the price you want to pay ), very nice and friendly staff , rooms are clean and comfortable. I do recommend this hotel if you're palnning a trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home,you are around freinds and people who are like family”
Reviews.Author: bontie
Reviews.Content: I had the unpleasant experience of loosing my wallet with my air tickect money and passport lost/stolen at the grand bazaar.I am South African and the nearset embassy is in Ankara which is a five hour drive from Istanbul. The The General Manger of the Ottoman Hotel Imperial Mr Yasar Celeen took control of my situation without once making me feel uncormfortable. Thanks to him and his friendly staff I arrived home safely.I will always be grateful to him and would highly recommend th Ottoman Hotel Imperial for friendliness, value for money and a great location. Bernadette Ash

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travellerdavid_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial with friends for 3 nights in April, staff are great, very professional, polite, friendly, they go out of their way to make you feel relaxed and at home. You cant beat the location, next to Hagia Sofia, few minutes away from Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque, tram ride away to Grand Bazar, although you could walk there it only takes about 10-15 minutes. Walking distance to Bosphoruse, take a walk there and take the boat ride around bosphoruse, it's great. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. good choice of food breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: JohnDanburyCT
Reviews.Content: There is no way to be in a better location for visiting the most important sights in Istanbul--all within easy walking distance. The front office/ front desk staff was always available to help with any questions and very friendly. Pick up at the airport was on time and very proffesional. Our room faced the garden and had access to a large balcony shared by one other room. We had booked a Premium Sultan room and were upgraded to the next level room which was a good size. The airconditioning system was very good--control of temperature fan speed etc. Breakfast was very good in both quality and quantity and in a very nice glassed in room with a nice view of the immediate neighborhood. The hotel also provided access to a PC with high speed internet connection. The only negative experience was the bathroom which was small and had a very weak shower.

Reviews.Title: “A great Experience by all means”
Reviews.Author: PERYSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week ( 23-30thMay ) in the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. Even before my arrival, after booking my room, I had some questions and requests. All was attended to in a prompt, kind and professional manner. From the friendly pick up at the airport till the drop on departure it was a wonderful experience. The check in was warm and their Guest Relation Team & Front Office Staff are one of the best I ever came across, multilingual, courteous and most helpful. Their staff ,all in all, are very courteous, friendly and professional. I was upgraded upon check-in and the room was very clean, spacious, comfortable and delightful, with a beautiful view and very authentic decoration. The turkish delight in the room was a nice gesture and delicious. The Hotel Bathroom Amneities are of very good quality. The hotel has a prime location in the Old City ie The Sultanahmet Area of Istanbul ( Aya Sophia, Sultanahmet Mosque, Topkapi, Hippodrome & Grand Bazzar to name a few), but still lies on a quiet street within 2 minutes from the tram line. Their Restaurant and Garden are delightful, one can spend the whole day lazing around drinking their traditional tea or coffee that is served in authentic Ottoman Silverware or sipping a drink and enjoying the atmosphere. Even the background music rhymes. Breakfast offers a good and tasty variety. Their menu for Lunch and Dinner is deversified and contains delicious authentic Turkish Dishes at competitive prices.The service is impeccable. My stay was a great experience.The Ottoman Hotel Imperial Staff and Management look after you in a perfect manner, making you feel at home away from home. They sure make your stay : A STAY TO REMEMBER !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonywatson
Reviews.Content: Wow you cant beat the location, next to Hagia Sofia and within few minutes walk to all the beautiful historical sites. Staff are so great, friendly, helpful always have a smile on their face. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, but some rooms are small. pending on the price, I do recommend the large rooms over looking Hagia Sofia, they do cost a little extra but its worth it. We've stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 4 nights on a short break to Istanbul, I would recommend this hotel to all my friens and family.

Reviews.Title: “I think it's one of the top hotels in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: foxlullu
Reviews.Content: I've been to Istanbul many times for business and holiday and stayed in different hotels, I have to say Ottoman Hotel Istanbul is one of the best I've stayed in. Near by to all the historical attractions, across from Hagia Sofia, close to Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazar, Bosphorus and tram line is a minute away. Staff are great very professional and friendly, rooms are clean and comfortable, good choice of food for breakfast. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: punhiking
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Istanbul at the Ottoman Imperial. Other than the small rooms, this hotel can't be beat! It is adjacent to the Hagia Sophia, has excellent service, is within walking distance of all the major attractions in Istanbul, staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms are well appointed, and the hotel now offers free internet access via laptops they keep at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Shona2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great value for money. Ideally situated close to all the tourist sites, restaurants and shops. Rooms are well appointed and housekeeping is excellent. The garden terrace is a lovely spot to relax or catch up with friends and the breakfast is very good. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful and I would be happy to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: SussexVoyager
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Ottoman Imperial after reading reviews on Trip Advisor, and with the warnings of small rooms we booked a Premium Vezir room which costs a little more. When we arrived we were upgraded to a Premium Sultan room. Wow! Haghia Sophia right outside the room window! For the record, the Premium rooms are plenty big enough and very comfortable. This is a great hotel, location manages to be both quiet and close to the main tourist sights, staff charming and helpful. A tip - try the hotel restaurant, excellent food, no more expensive than the touristy restaurants around Sultanahmet and much more pleasant and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable and cosy hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: ValideSultane
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from friendly and helpful staff, cosy and impeccably clean room, lovely classic decoration, good breakfast buffet with free newspaper in English, quiet restaurant terrace and a fantastic location to boot (literally next to the Aya Sofya) !

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Istanbul while exploring the beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: allanstamatis
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel close by to all the important historical sites in Istanbul, I would highly recommend this hotel. I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during my bussiness trip to Istanbul, stayed on through the weekend to explore the beautiful historical sites in Istanbul, hotel is located right accross Hagia Sofia and a short walk away from Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Bosphorus, tram line, restaurants and cafee's. Very friendly and helpfull satff, always with smiles on their faces, comfortable rooms. very clean, do go for the larger room. Breakfast was great, you could have your breakfast on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nealbrown
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for many reasons for everyone that are planning to visit Istanbul. Staff are excellent, friendly and attentive, clean and comfortable rooms, great location for sightseeing all the important sites as Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar, Bosphorus, all within short walk away, good breakfast food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: anneaxter
Reviews.Content: Thank you for everrything. I can honestly say this hotel is one of the best in Istanbul, due to it's great service, friendly, helpful staff, always have a smile on their faces, always willing to go that extra mile to help out. Excellent location, how can you go wrong when you're within 2 minutes walking distance to all the important sites. Rooms are nice, comfortable and clean, breakfast was great, choice of International and Turkish foods. Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a great place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel! - Great Staff! - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: globetrreker
Reviews.Content: We have been doing a lot of traveling for the last two years - Greece - China - Italia - France - Egypt - Jordan - And now Turkey. My wife and I, have our own rating system game. And, I have to say, she really loves a good hotel experience. Well, the Ottoman ranked extremely high on the list of hotels that we have stayed in over the years. The location could not get any better - Located in the old section of the city - Behind the old wall. The Blue Mosque - Hagia Sophia -Topkapi -The Hippodrome, are all with walking distance of the Ottoman Imperial Hotel. Not to mention the Grand Bazaar, for all you shoppers out there. :-) Restaurant, and shops close by as well. So, if you are looking for a great hotel, in a great location, with one of the most professional, friendly, and accommodating staffs. Handan Kucuk, as well as her co-workers, were so friendly, knowledgable, & helpful. I highly recommend the Ottoman Imperial Hotel! BTW, Great Breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosalinae
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I were in Istanbul for hen weekend, we chose to stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial after looking over many hotel sites, to be honest for no particular reason. I'm glad we did, it's a beautiful hotel and what makes it so beautiful is the wonderful staff, they are very polite, friendly, helpfull. Location is great, you can get to all the important sites as Hagia Sofia, Tokapi Palace, Blue Mosque within minutes, you could also get to city centre Taksim within 10-15 minutes depending on traffic. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, although some of our rooms were bit on the small side. Good choice of food for breakfast. I would like to thank the hotel managment and staff for putting up with us.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stuartf0x
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay at Ottoma Hotel Imperial. Rooms are clean and roomy, decoration of the rooms are very nice, the view is great, I do recommend getting the rooms over looking Saint Sofia Cathedral, the terrace garden is very nice and relaxing for meals and drinks. Staffs are very polite and friendly, they go out of their way to make you feel at home and enjoy your stay. Hotel is close by to all the historical sites, Top Kapi Palace, Blue Mosque, excellent view of the Caferaga Medrese, underground cistern is minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: putakko
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul, Turkey for many reasons. I being interested in the great Turkish history appreciate the location of the hotel. Only the stone wall separates the traveller staying at the hotel from the ancient amazing Hagia Sofia. Topkapi with its treasures is in a five to ten minutes walking distance. While walking to Topkapi you can admire and enjoy beautiful wooden houses. Wishing to visit Taksim area it is no problem to take a tram. The personnel in the hotel is nice and friendly polite. I have extra needs having glutenfree diet and the hotel did its best to make my breakfasts and dinners suitable for me. I even had glutenfree bread. I have contacted Finnish keliakia-coalic -association and put a word of favour forward. When e-mailing of this need of glutenfree diet in advance I had the return e-mails very quickly with no delay which seemed to be the overall way of acting of the hotel. Still I find it important to give a warning for those having difficulties in steps, even a few of them can be of nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “Trully a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janesummer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in istanbul over the Easter holiday, this was our third time there and Ottoman Hotel Imperial was recommended to us by our close friends who stayed at this hotel last year. Tell you what they were spot on, beautiful hotel, in the centre of all the important sites, across from Hagia Sofia, few minutes away from both Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque, tram line is close by also. Rooms are clean and nice, hotel staff are very friendly and helpfull, good choice of food for breakfast. I do recommend you take the time to visit the Grand Bazar, which is about 15 minutes walk away or few minutes tram ride.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JRK50
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ottoman Imperial while on a vacation to Turkey. The room was a bit smallish, but nicely furnished and reasonably priced. It was clean and kept well serviced throughout our stay. The hotel provides a great breakfast in an glass enclosed room looking out at the Sultan Ahmet neighborhood. There is outside seating if weather permits. The hotel entrance is across the street from the wall surrounding the Aya Sofia and a bock from the entrance, four blocks from the entrance to Topkapi Palace, two blocks from the entrance to the cistern and four blocks from the entrance to the Blue Mosque. Staff was friendly and helpful. Overall a good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent service, Istanbul delight”
Reviews.Author: kaminskisarah
Reviews.Content: Ottoman Hotel Imperial trully is an Istanbul delight. Beautifully located in the heart of all the important sites. Blue Mosque is 2 minutes away, Topkapi Palace is about 3 minutes away, Hagia Sofia is right across the hotel, the famous Grand Bazar is a good 15 - 20 minute walk or you could take the tram ( tarm stop is located near the hotel ). Staff of the hotel is lovely, always smiling and very helpfull, excellent choice of food for breakfast, rooms are clean and very comfortable. One of the best hotels I've stayed in around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: hazeljNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a beautiful surprise, my wife and I chose this hotel after looking over many on the site, as you know all hotels show pictures of their best rooms on sites, trying to make you think all rooms are like that. Well we were happy to see Ottoma Hotel Imperial turned out to be very pleasent, nice clean rooms, very friendly staff always willing to help out, they even picked us up from the airport. You can't beat the location as it's close to all the historical sites we wanted to see, to make it better it's right across Hagia Sofia, within in walking distance to Bosporus. Good choice of food for breakfast, must try their Turkish cuisine at the restaurant, it's very delicious. I would recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: aclair
Reviews.Content: Visited Istanbul with friends in March, we were very pleased with the hotel, especially the location, close to all the historical attractions, right by Hagia Sofia, a minute away from Topkapi Palace, a minute away from Blue Mosque, close to the tram line and about 20 minute walk to Grand Bazar ( do bargain there, do not accept their first price ). Hotel staff was nice and friendly, breakfast was good, beds were comfortable, rooms clean. I would stay there again if I return back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A very good surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Nico-London
Reviews.Content: I actually didnâ€™t expect such a good hotel!! Well first the location, it is quite hard to find a better one, just opposite Hagia Sofia (30metres). You get out of the hotel that is the only thing you see. It is in the heart of Sultanamet, so easy access to everything you need to see in the old Istanbul! Just perfect location!! The staff is very good, very sympathetic polite, smiling, always asking is everything is ok. The room: I had a premium room, with a direct view on the Hagia Sofia. Large bed, flat screen, well the usual. Still quite important are all the details, delicious Turkish delicacy on your bed, toothbrush, razor, Bathtub etc... And theses services are the same for standard or premium rooms. Very clean rooms. The breakfast is very good, with a wide range for the continental breakfast, with sweet and salty food. I tried the restaurant once as well, (the first night) and it was just great food, donâ€™t remembered the name of the dish (lamb and eggplant) but it was just fantastic!! I had a problem with my laptopâ€™s battery, and they land me one for free; with of course free Wi-Fi. I was really enthusiastic about this hotel, as I travel quite often (at least twice a month for business), and do not have most of the time this kind of services (even in some 5 star) From the location, to the staff, the room and the food, this hotel has nothing to envy to other 4 star hotel and some 5 star hotel. I would of course recommend this hotel, for anyone looking to enjoy Istanbul in a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: oterry42
Reviews.Content: Company I work for booked this hotel for me, I stayed there for a week, it was a very nice experience. Ottoman Hotel Imperial's location is excellent as all the major sites are within walking distance, if you wanted to get to the city centre you could either take a public transportation or a cab ride will cost you very little. Room I stayed in was nice, clean, comfortable bed and had a view of Hagia Sofia, I believe it did cost little more than the other rooms. Good variety of food for breakfast, friendly and professional staff always willing to help out. I would recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial either for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,pleasant staff,small rooms,tiny bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: Hilary14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within walking distance of all the main sights and places of interest.Because it is a historic building, there is a very pleasant atmosphere, with a lovely terrace and up-to-date decor.The staff are very helpful and eager to please. The breakfast is plentiful with a good choice. Tthe rooms are small but they are extremely clean, with comfortable beds. The main downfall is the lack of cupboard space and the tiny bathroom with a strange shower/bath arrangement which is difficult to get in and out of. My elderly mother,who is very active and mobile, found this really awkward and I thought it was unsafe.I would not recommend the hotel to anyone with any mobilty problems for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay. Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sandyjchicago
Reviews.Content: During our trip around Europe in Istanbul my partner and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 3 nights. I highly recommend this hotel, we've stayed in many hotels around the world, this is one of the hotels we enjoyed and will recommend. Rooms are nice and clean, our room was on the small size, no problem, good staff, friendly and helpfull, you can not beat the location as all the historical sites are near by as Top Kapi palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Underground cistern, grand Bazar and the tram line is few steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ianb1948
Reviews.Content: Location, location and location as they say, Ottoman Hotel Imperial is located in the old part of Istanbul called Sultanahmet, great location, within walking distance of all the important touristic sites as Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagi Sofia ( accross from the hotel ), tram line close by and the well known Grand Bazar, be ready to bargain there, dont let them take you for a ride. Rooms are comfortable and clean, but some of them are small, good friendly staff, breakfast was good, variety of international and Turkish food, do try the restaurant at least once for lunch or dinner, excellent food. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spencer_mark97
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this review short and sweet. I was in Istanbul on bussiness and stayed at ottoman hotel imperial for 2 nights. If you're looking for location, to be near to all the important sites than you cant get better than this hotel. As my time did not permit me to have a proper visit, Ottoma Hotel Imperial is close to all the touristic sites as Topkapi palace, short walk away from Blue Mosque, across from Hagia Sofia ( where my room was over looking ), tram and the Grand Bazar. Rooms are good and comfortable, altough size of the rooms does vary according to price I believe. Breakfast was good, I had dinner at the hotel restaurant on my first night and it was excellent. Staff are friendly. I will have to return back to Istanbul and have a proper visit. I highly recommend Ottoman Hotel Imperial

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marys067
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with group of friends in March, we were in Istanbul for a short gateaway break, it was our first time visiting Istanbul, we looked into many other hotels before deciding on Ottoman Hotel Imperial due to the location. I'm glad we did as we had the best experience. Location of the hotel is superb, close to Topkapi Palace, across from Hagia Sofia, close to Blue Mosque and walking distance to the popular Grand Bazar. Very friendly and helpfull staff, rooms were very comfortable and clean, breakfast was good. I would recommend this hotel to my family and other friends. Hope to come back to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Wanderful location and breakfast room, pay attention to the hotel's "tips"”
Reviews.Author: An_old_traveller
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is really excellent, just a couple of minutes walk from most of the "must see" in Istanbul. Most of the other locations can be easily and very quickly reached by tram, which can be taken from the nearby station (by the way, try to avoid taxi drivers in Istanbul; they are typically incompetent - not aware of any destination except for the "big ones", stop the car in order to get directions form other locals, and almost inevitably try to trick you). The hotel in itself is nice, but nothing extraordinary. We stayed there for several nights. Our room was small, with a view to some backside houses. Every morning the cleaning personnel talked very loudly and inevitably woke us up with their chat. It goes without saying that the walls are quite thin and noises fly freely. We were lucky that it was in spring and there were not "tones" of tourists. However, in the first night I heard a neighbor snoring. The personnel is very friendly, but not in all respects. For example, not flexible in respect of late breakfast. For example, if you fancy a longer sleep in the morning, you will need to buy your breakfast else where. In addition, pay attention to the Turkish friendship. To all trips or programs they arrange from the hotel, they add substantial commissions, without making you aware of. For example, we went one evening to a Derwiches dance (Mevlevi ceremony). The hotel kindly offered to book us the tickets. When we arrived at the place, we surprisingly saw tickets being officially sold at a cheaper price. This is also valid for trip boats. You can buy them directly in the harbor at cheaper prices. You can take all the brochures and advice from the hotel, but it would be safer for your pocket to go for them directly and not via hotel. In respect of restaurants, the hotel will also make some recommendations. If you are prepared to pay the Paris or London prices for something nice, but average, go for it. Don't expect to find any local as customers, as the recommended places are "dedicated" to tourists. Alternatively, if you really want something really nice and with Turkish prices, go to places like Daruzziyafe Restaurant (located in the old annexes of the Suleymanyie mosque) or Hamdi Restaurant (with wonderful view on the harbor and bridge). Conclusion: the hotel is recommended if the location is keen, in general ok, but pay attention to some of the issues above.

Reviews.Title: “Small and nice, beautifull hotel with a excellent and friendly Personall”
Reviews.Author: agas1
Reviews.Content: We found a well organized Hotel directly in the old city of Istanbul. It was a pleasure to do the reservation, we got immediately the confirmation and also they offered the service to pick us up late night from the airport for free. After the first night we were unhappy with the location of our room in the newer part of the hotel- no problem, we got on the next day another room. The rooms are, as usual in Istanbul small, but equipped with all the necessary things, including tea and coffee. The location is perfect in Sultanahmed for sightseeing of the old town. The tram is about 3 min. away. We appreciate most the friendly and helpful people in hotel!!!!! We cannot critize anything.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay at the right price”
Reviews.Author: zetarome
Reviews.Content: Ask for rooms looking to Santa sophia. The suggestions of the desk are good for tourism The staff is very gentle and ready to help . Very large and good breakfast full of everything. No espresso available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in the centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ankobean
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend this hotel for visitors to Istanbul for several reasons; the clean/stylish rooms, hot showers, a pillow menu, friendly/attentive staff, free WI-FI, great location for sightseeing and a good breakfast spread. I would have given 5 stars, but was a little disappointed with the restaurant, which didn't match the quality of the hotel because of its uninspired menu.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravler
Reviews.Content: Blind luck and their website lead me to the Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul. My trip was planned several months in advance and over that time the hotel staff promptly answered any questions. Attractive, clean, friendly and in a great location to walk almost anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel staff was always glad to meet any request. I'll stay there again and will recommend the Ottoman Hotel Imperial to all my friends. Andrea Mason

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a Great Location and Excellent Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: BatANDBall1
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the hotel and were well looked after. The hotel and restaurant were spotless and the staff very friendly and helpful.From check-in to check-out we could not fault either the staff are the hotel itself. The rooms are modern, clean and well equipped, not huge, but of adequate size. The location however, is where the hotel really excels as all of the major old town attractions are minutes away by foot. Food in the restaurant was OK, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: alice002
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels i have stayed in staff are very friendly and helpful the hotel it self is very nice, it was a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Istanbul staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial.”
Reviews.Author: Julzie41
Reviews.Content: The location and view from the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was ideal and my stay here was enhanced by the friendly and helpful staff who provided information on activities and sightseeing so that I could make the most of my time in Istanbul. I could walk to a lot of tourist locations and I enjoyed the buzz and colour of the city life and the friendly people I met during my stay. I'd love to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight..”
Reviews.Author: dogancan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the period between 14 - 17 feb. at the OTTOMAN HOTEL IMPERIAL, and it's been a great joy for me. What the most important thing for me is when i'm staying in a hotel, that the rooms are very clean and the staff is friendly and helpfull. I can say with all my haert that this hotel made me feel at home and the tideness, cleaning was really perfect. The location of the OTTOMAN IMPERIAL is mostly central, all of the important cultural and touristic spots are in the area. For people who visit ISTANBUL for the first time, this hotel is a perfect place to be. I would also give my regards to the staff and the managment of this hotel because or their concern and attention. I have stayed at several hotels in ISTANBUL but the OTTOMAN IMPERIAL HOTEL is my favorite one. This is a recommandable hotel. Yonca Soner// HOLLAND

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel that makes business travel friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip to Istanbul, I stayed first at the Radisson SAS Hotel Bosphorous, before switching to the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. It was fantastic and invigorating to be next to the Aya Sophia and in the heart of Sultanhamet. Hotel staff was extremely friendly and I was welcomed with a hot tea at the check-in desk. Breakfast was perfect and the views are unbeatable. Enjoy this friendly treasure on your next trip, business or pleasure, and you will experience a friendlier, more authentic version of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeTulip
Reviews.Content: To me Ottoman Hotel Imperial is like a home away from home. I love the simplicity but yet classic interior decoration. All the staffs were very friendly and attentive. I felt very welcomed and relax throughout my stayed in this hotel. My room has a wonderful veiw of Aya Sofya from the balcony, words simply cannot describe such a feeling. One more thing, its location is very convenient and walking distance to historical places, Grand Bazaar, good restaurants, etc., I enjoyed my stayed in Ottoman Hotel Imperial very much. From Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Monty_Aisha
Reviews.Content: Further to reading the reviews of Ottoman Hotel Imperial, I decided to book this hotel as a treat for my family and to spend some quality time around the New Year. We spent 4 days at this hotel. Everything was great - the location, the service, the food and the cleanliness of the hotel all met our expectations. It is definitely value for money. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are tidied up very quickly too. Beside the welcoming drinks, the complimentary Turkish delight, I was most touched by the New Year gift that was left in our bedrooms on 31st Dec. These little things can really show how hard they try and they really think of their guests in many aspects. A few things to note: the noisy streets - it would be ideal if they have double-glazing windows. Unfortunately I won't recommend this hotel for light-sleepers. Another thing is the small bath tub, which makes it very difficult to get in and out. The breakfast room is also quite small for a hotel - you may have to wait for quite a while before you get a seat in the morning on a busy day. But overall, I will recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: RozNorthampton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to a side wall of Hagia Sofia so in a superb posiition for sight seeing in Istanbul. The staff are very welcoming and helpful- we arrived on a sleety December evening and were happy to be in a comfortable warm room, complete with tea and coffee making facilitles which were most welcome. The room is accessed across a courtyard -where no doubt meals may be taken in better weather- and down a small flight of stairs. There was a window but unfortunately no view but in December, not a problem. Breakfast is served in a lovely glass sided dining room with a view over the city. and there is a good choice of fruits, cereals, bread, toast and eggs. Getting around the main city sights cannot be easier and although we had some snow, it certainly didn't stop us walking for hours each day. This was our third visit to the magical city and we cannot recommend a trip there highly enough - the people are so friendly, meals can still be found at reasonable prices and just so much to see. This time too cold but on previous occasions we have taken boat trips up the Bosphorous - beautiful. This hotel is in an ideal position and for us, was good value for money and a little gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: dantm
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this gorgeous small hotel twice now once in July 08 for business and more recently in December 08 for a romantic break. First thing is the amazing location - across the street from the historical architectural masterpiece the Hagia Sophia. The views are breathtaking especially on the higher floors. All of the famous historical sites of Sultanhamet are within short walking distance. Also the excellent tram service into town passes the hotel this was useful when I was attending meetings during my business trip as often the tram was quicker than the taxi due to traffic. The rooms are decorated in a traditional Ottoman style offering great light and comfort. I enjoyed the relaxation and comfort of the rooms on both my visits when alone for business and with my partner on holiday. The traditional Turkish buffet breakfast is a great start to the day and the views from the glass constructed restaurant over look the real old Sultanhamet. As in the rooms the light in the restaurant is fantastic even in December.The staff are extremely friendly and informative and the service is personal. They all remembered me from my first trip and made me feel welcome. I have fallen in love with the city after many trips and have stayed in a few quality hotels in Istanbul prior to my last two visits as well as staying in hotels all over the world in the course of my business trips. The location of the Ottoman Imperial is one of my favourites for hotels all over the world and I look forward to returning there on all future trips to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheNYTravellers
Reviews.Content: Location is absolutely perfect and the hotel is decent. The breakfast is good and the rooms are clean. One night though, we did stay on a room facing the street and it was quite nosy. Luckily for us, there were available rooms facing the opposite direction that was just fine. The rooms are clean, but just a little small, which was cozy for us, but if your looking for a lot of space, then this is something to mention. The service from the hotel was absolutely fantastic! Turkish people in general are already that way, but definitely the service here was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great ottoman feel”
Reviews.Author: Esma1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the premium location full of historical and cultural sights , the service at this hotel i would say was excellent and they was happy to help you in any situation :) It has a lovely ottoman feel to it , the rooms are spacious and it was over looking a great view of the sophia museum . I would re-visit this hotel time and time again :) i had a nice stay .

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Ottoman”
Reviews.Author: DimitriDonskoi
Reviews.Content: While planning my third trip to Istanbul this year I realized I had neglected to post a review of my stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial this summer - time to remedy that lapse as this Hotel deserves to be recognized. The short form of this review: this is a fine, small hotel that is very clean, reliable and a great value. If you don't like smaller rooms, reserve one of the bigger rooms.
