You won't be disappointed, and I liked it well enough that I'm planning my third visit in a year to Istanbul and hope to stay in this hotel again. In what follows I'll comment on what some of the other reviews have discussed. After a great experience at the hotel on a business trip in January when my son and visited Istanbul in August I knew I wanted us to stay at the Ottoman. We had a tough itinerary planned with a late night arrival and an early morning departure, so I needed reliable airport pickup. I also wanted us close to the main historical sites - can't get any closer than this hotel, which is right across a narrow street from the Aja Sophia church/mosque/museum. I booked my room directly with the hotel and exchanged email with them about the airport pickup. I planned the trip two months in advance but the hotel did not lose any info about the pickup and was right on top of it. We stayed for three days. As before, the service was flawless, from airport pickup to welcome at the hotel to a ride back to the airport. I had reserved a larger room with a view of the Aja Sophia. See my other review for photos, which could have been of this same room and the same view. In the winter the hotel served breakfast in a somewhat unappealing lower level room. In the summer it is served on a delightful terrace. Some other reviewers commented that there are stairs involved, as indeed there are. The seating area for dining is on the outdoor terrace while the actual buffet is located in a glass-enclosed room that is a flight of steps up from the terrace. Both have very appealing old Istanbul, leafy urban views. There are large umbrellas or canopies covering part of the terrace and breakfast continued to be served there during light rain, with staff members holding umbrellas over guests in the open spot between terrace and the steps up to the buffet. This sounds not-so-pleasant but in fact it was somehow a very charming experience, a somewhat unexpected combination of endearing hospitality and an authentic sense of place, not overly manufactured to the point that rain is denied any part of life. Breakfast itself has been criticized in some of the reviews, and I suppose that depends upon what one expects. This is not a five star hotel with multiple omlette chefs and endless array of breakfast foods. The buffet has a good variety of foods but they tend to simpler Turkish fare, with slices of different sorts of local cold cut meats, odd garnishes like crushed black olive paste, Turkish breads and bagels, sliced cucumbers and olives, local cheeses and some hot choices of the runny scrambled eggs sort. Think of it as a local alternative midway between the absolutely unappealing European continental "breakfast" and the more elaborate display at some of the deliberately international, big-breakfast buffets. I'm a big breakfast eater and liked it just fine, especially since it had a local style to it. One other reviewer criticized the hotel staff for recommending a restaurant not to his liking. I think that's harsh and a bit unfair as there are many restaurants within a short walk with a wide range of prices. I'd give the restaurant at the hotel a try for convenience, and if you want something else read the many reviews here in tripadvisor. I don't mean to discredit the staff at the hotel but I would not expect them to be as good at recommending restaurants as the collective intelligence of many travellers on this website. We ended up eating on the rooftop terrace of a restaurant called the Seven Hills, a truly outstanding view with (astonishingly for a place with a great view...) outstanding food. As they say, bring your camera. Bottom line: great small hotel with personal, warm, welcoming staff. It has a perfect location for tourism, in the middle of where you want to be while still being quiet and restful. It is clean, reliable and an outstanding value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Will return back soon”
Reviews.Author: gibsonsally10
Reviews.Content: Wow, will make this review short and sweet. Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during my business trip to Istanbul. My company made the reservation and I'm pleased they made it to this hotel. If you're into history, this is the hotel for you as it's close to all the historical sites. Rooms are clean and comfortable, altough size of the rooms does vary. Courties and friendly staff, very helpfull. Will definitelly return back to Istanbul with my husband for a short weekend get away and stay at Ottoman Hotel Imperial as its close to all the important sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: finchbob70
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial 4 nights during our visit to Turkey. We're very glad we did, hotel is located close to all the touristic attractions, minutes from Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, tram and all restaurants. Staff is very kind and helpfull attended to all our needs. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. I do recommend the rooms over looking the Hagia Sofia, breakfast was nice, we did have dinner at the hotel restaurant 2 nights, excellent international menue. Well what more can I say, I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westc67
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during my business trip to Istanbul. To bad I did not have much time to do all the touristic events because hotel is located in the best spot. Across from Hagia Sofia, minutes to Topkopi Palace, Blue Mosque and the popular Grand Bazar. Rooms are clean, very helpfull staff, good choice of breakfast food, good price. I will for sure stay here again next time I'm in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “charming istanbul”
Reviews.Author: helene1marburg
Reviews.Content: it was a very great pleasure to stay in this nice hotel, very friendly and warm welcome, good breakfast, service all over perfect...the location is easily to find and all the historic aerea can made by walking distance...the rooms are small, but very charming...so this staying makes istanbul eaven more greatful...

Reviews.Title: “Liked Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: Ismo
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the a.m. place and had a good time in Istanbul. The hotel is centrally located, just next to Hagia Sofia and very close to the Blue Mosq. Had a small problem at arrival: the room was sprayed with a fragrance. This was solved - room cleaned - while we were having Turkish tea with Mr Balta, the friendly manager of the hotel. In general: very good service based on Turkish hospitality, we believe. Ismo and Lea Koponen from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: D-ro24
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Imperial is a great hotel. Check-in was fast and easy, our room was clean and ready for us even though we arrived early, and our A/C worked great. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of the tourist area in Istanbul, there are a ton of restaurants and shps nearby, not to mention all of the sights. We had no problems with noise, although it is on a busy street. The staff was great and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel close to all in the Old City”
Reviews.Author: 1955MGTF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ottoman for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. The hotel itself is beautiful along with friendly and happy staff that were helpful and loved a chat. Our room was perfect with a view at St.Sophia and down the road to The Blue Mosque. Everything was in walking distance and I would definately go back to this hotel. Thanks to Ozgur, Erhan, Gonul & Hendon, the staff members that were wonderful, Lynn & Mark.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Coffee”
Reviews.Author: travelindoc74
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is a extraordinary city! We enjoyed our stay at the Ottoman and like many others have committed the location is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was a nice amenity to our experience. Unfortunately, however, the coffee did not at all complement the breakfast. If you are willing to pay, there is a gourmet coffee option available from their restaurant (this coffee is magnificent!). If you are like us, and coffee is an important part of your breakfast experience then, until the restaurant and breakfast coffees are the same, we would recommend choosing another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel w/english speaking staff and helpful concierge”
Reviews.Author: mguyor
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, beautiful little lobby and halls, knowledgeable and very helpful concierge, lovely intimate patio for breakfast, mid-day meal or snack, cocktails/wine, and evening dinner. Fantastic location, within short walk to Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, and Haghia Sophia. Recommend the hop-on, hop-off bus, also available at the end of their short street to the corner. Grand Bazaar, also within walking distance, only a little longer walk. Nice breakfast buffet, but carrying plate and/or coffee down steep stairs, could have been nicer if carried by staff. Would love to go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian1977
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderfull stay in Istanbul (Turkey) in the Ottoman hotel Imperial. On the day of arrival we had a free transfer from the airport to the hotel. The hotel staff was very kind, Service was perfect. Nice clean room with a amazing view. The hotel is located in the center of Sultanhamet near all the major historical buildings. Public transport is near the hotel and is a cheap and save way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: markssArizona
Reviews.Content: We booked hotel after reading reviews thank you 2 Tripadvisor !!!The hotel was beyond our expectations. We had a fabulous time.The staff were amazing,The garden restaurant of the hotel is a fantastic place to rest and relax, food was delicious the decor was outstanding, its exactly how you see it on their special service and we didnt want to leave. Such good value for money.Small details make the difference and Ottoman Hotel knows how to provide you with a perfect holiday.Overall, We will recommend to any of the people who would like to visit Ä°stanbul ! only one address to stay Ottoman Hotel Imperial !

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to the Ottoman Hotel”
Reviews.Author: M-from-Montreal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at the Ottoman Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find it so well located-right next to the Hagia Sofia. The hotel is spotless. There was always someone cleaning . The hotel has a lovely rooftop terrace with wall fountains and a spectacular view. To add to the magic, there is a musician who plays the zither in the evenings. We were told that there was a whirling Dervish performance every evening at 7:30 but we were never there at that time. The staff was very helpful. We complained that our room might be noisy as it faced the street with the tram. They immediately volunteered to change our room the following night as the hotel was full. (The noise was not a problem once the windows were closed and the air conditioning was turned on. ) They upgraded us, at no additional cost, to a larger corner room with windows on all four sides. The room overlooked the tiny street that separates the hotel from the Hagia Sofia. The room was lovely, spacious and very clean. It was nicely decorated with Turkish ceramic plates. Breakfasts were served in the rooftop restaurant and these were very plentiful. The turkish cheeses and fresh vegetables( tomatoes and cucumbers) were delicious, as were the unusual sweet tahini spreads and rose jams. There were also scrambled eggs, Turkish sausages, cereals-corn flakes, cocoa puffs and fruit loops, Turkish breads and whole wheat buns. Coffee was good. Lots of fresh fruit-apples, plums and grapes, as well. They also serve dinner as well ,until 10:30pm. We tried it one night when we were too tired to look elsewhere at 10pm. The meal was excellent value. Salads were fresh and could easily make a meal. The eggplant appetizer was unctious. The lamb which came on a sizzling plate was aromatic and very tasty. The price was extremely reasonable for the quality and portions which could easily feed two people.( prices at the Grand Bazaar were higher for less). Internet use is free-watch out for the key board and the different letters, though. There was a concierge who appeared very helpful although we did not use her services except for help on the computer. All in all, all the staff were courteous and helpful, including the bellhop-Kaza. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would return to it on our next visit to Istanbul which is an amazing city. Note that this hotel is near the Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome, the Cisterns and Topkapi Palace. It is also near Divan Yolu and the trams which makes getting around very easy. Actually, it is close to most things-ie. walking distance to the Bazaars and the Galatta Bridge-20-30 minutes depending on how fast you walk. M and B from Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: majomesz
Reviews.Content: We are a young couple and decided to stay at the Ottoman Imperial during our trip to Istanbul. We are extremely happy with our decision. We stayed there for 3 nights at first, went out of the city for a weekend and decided to stay at the hotel again once we went back to Istanbul. We stayed in two different rooms during those two periods and each was very clean and tastefully decorated and felt cozy. We felt very comfortable as if we were at home. The common areas were also clean and elegantly decorated. The restaurant terrace is great for dinner or just beverages. We had dinner there a few times and the menu was excellent. The staff was very courteous and helpful at all times. The hotel is located on a charming little street and faces the Hagia Sophia. Despite being near all the tourist hotspots it is very quiet and there is little street noise reaching the rooms because it is all well insulated. Overall the hotel was a wonderful choice. We would stay there again and have been recommending the hotel to acquaintances and friends who plan to go to Istanbul. Ogul Tamer Judith Sari

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: bigregory
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading other reviews on TripAdvisor and we were so happy! It was a great boutique hotel. The room was very clean and decorated. The location was superb for our needs as we were going out for the museums and historic places . Best of all, the staff were great. Touristy magazines ,Turkish delight at the first day, pillow menu ,tea maker in the rooms were offered fresh flowers and daily English newspapers in the breakfast room â€¦ details were perfect! We would definitely go again and recommend highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: aa_cambridge
Reviews.Content: Pros: Ottoman Imperial has a great Location, next to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc. The hotel breakfast is very good. Cons: The staff is not friendly at all. The room and bathroom are quite small and my husband and I hit our heads on the tower rack

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Botto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ottoman Imperial for 3 nights in mid-June. The best feature of the hotel has to be the location which meant we were in a short walking distance of the mosque, bazaar and all the other sights of Sultanahmet. There is also a good selection of bars and restaurants in this area (and not just tourist traps!). Also, as taxis are relatively cheap, it doesn't cost much to get to the Taksim Square area, which has a great selection of bars/restaurants. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful (ie. happy to sort out taxis, restaurant bookings, etc) and made us feel v welcome. The breakfast buffet was well stocked with a good selection of options and the breakfast room had the added bonus of fantastic views. The rooms were of an adequate size (v compact bathrooms!), but we knew this as we'd booked only standard rooms as they were good value. Throughout, the hotel was clean and well maintained. The only downside we experienced regarded noise levels. As all our rooms were facing on to a semi-busy road and we were near the mosques, we all encountered some issues with the noise - from noisy neighbours, early morning calls to mosque and the road being dug up at 2 in the morning (none of which being the hotel's fault)! However, as all the windows are double glazed, it seems that the hotel has done what it can to remedy the noise issue. Overall, I think this hotel is ideal for a short stay in Istanbul as it's a perfect base for exploring the city and the staff made our stay more enjoyable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone (unless you're an extremely light sleeper!).

Reviews.Title: “Location is all”
Reviews.Author: wbBracknell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff pleasant. The bedroom (in this case a premium room in the main building) has a firm but comfortable bed, good air conditioning and was completely noise free and in good decorative order; however storage space was a little tight and the bathroom was miniscule. The breakfast, which is included in the room rate, is only acceptable if you enjoy instant coffee and cheap looking bread (the brown roll I had one morning turned out to be the white roll with colouring - lumps of white dough still evident in the mix). The breakfast is somewhat more bearable by being able to take it on the hotel's great outdoor terrace. Its location is so good for all the main tourist sights I would have to say it is worth booking for location alone - everything else is a bonus. Though note if you do suffer from any mobility problems check on the bathroom configuration before booking. Overall, good value for money, would stay there again and with a little more thought and some fresh coffee at breakfast could be magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a great hotel to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: joew41
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Ottoman Hotel Imperial in June of 2008 for few night's on a bussiness trip to Istanbul. I have to say it's one of the best hotels I have stayed around the world and I travel often. Hotel is located in the historical part of Istanbul, next to Hagia Sofia, 2 minutes away from Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque. Short tram ride to the popular Grand Bazar. Rooms are very clean, well decorated, in good size. Staff are very helpful, friendly and polite. Variety of international and Turkish food for breakfast, must try their outstanding Turkish cuisine for dinner. I will sure to return back here one day.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: peanutbutter30
Reviews.Content: We just returned from from Istanbul where we stayed on the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. *Positives* The positives about the hotel are the location, the service from the majority of the staff, the terrace, and breakfast. The hotel was in a great location for seeing all the tourist sights. If we wanted to drop of anything or relax we could go to our room and walk right back out to the action. When we arrived the bell boy immediately came out to the taxi and carried our bags to our room. The terrace is very beautiful and a great place to have a drink or some food. The breakfast had many great options and can accomidate everyone. *negatives* The negatives of the hotel are, the rooms are small and the bed in the room that we stayed in was extremely hard. It was like sleeping on a wooden plank. It got to the point where my back and hips started to ache and also restless nights of sleep. My husband had rug burns on his elbows from turning over. It is possible not all the beds are that hard and we should have asked to switch rooms. The other negative is we got terrible restaurant recommendation from one of the people working at the front desk. We arrived after a day of travel and asked if they could recommend something simple, that was nearby, with the typical local food. He sent us in a car to a place where the food was mediocre at best and they tried to charge us $130 for one grilled fish and $70 for 4 jumbo shrimp. Istanbul is expensive, but this was ridiculous. I'm sure he got a kick-back from the restaurant and the recommendation was a complete violation of trust.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: TCRK
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (including 2 teenage children) stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial for three days in early August. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the hotel. The location is excellent and really close to the main historical attractions. The rooms were very well decorated and very clean although a little bit small. The staff were very helpful throughout our stay and gave very good advice about trips and transport. Gonul and Erhan were very helpful on our departure day. This is an excellent, well managed, 'boutique' hotel with high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sybilUk
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a most enjoyable 9 night stay at The Ottoman Hotel Imperial in Istanbul. The location of the hotel - in a tranquil area in the heart of the Old City - is perfect and the hotel layout is welcoming (we loved the advantage of the garden area where we were able to sit with our friends after our evenings out). Our room was reasonably-sized with a roomy bathroom, but had only a wardrobe and one drawer (a few more drawers would have been appreciated!) for storage. We were aware that this might be the case, however, having read reviews of the hotel before our visit, so were able to improvise with a suitcase to add extra storage. It certainly did not spoil our stay. Definite pleasing features were the tea/coffee making tray in the room and the standard of cleanliness in all areas of the hotel. The staff, especially Erhan, were very helpful, polite and friendly at all times - nothing was too much trouble for them. This certainly added to the enjoyment of our stay. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the superbly located Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: fcoop
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial is a superbly located, high-quality hotel with excellent local flavor and a very responsive, pleasant and attentive staff. Located in a former school, it has lovely tile, a beautiful patio/outdoor dining area that is both quiet and active and pleasant for eating or computing or having a drink. it is open very early and very late. The hotel location is within one minute walk of the Aya Sofia, and within five minutes walk of the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the Archeology Museum. There are many excellent local restaurants within a very short walk as well. The hotel offered a wonderful free breakfast that was very comprehensive with varieties of local Turkish foods, fruits, olives, yogurts and a broad offering of international foods as well. Although this is not really a business hotel, I had a couple of business-related obligations such as local shipping, arranging meetings etc... and the staff was very helpful in this area. Because the hotel is in a converted school, rather than a new construction property, the rooms are not huge but they are more than adequate and very nicely appointed. The area also provides easy access to trollies and cabs are everywhere. I would recommend THe Ottoman Hotel Imperial for someone who wants a great local flavor, high quality, an excellent location, next to Istanbul's greatest sites and a very accomodating and welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: sam19791
Reviews.Content: This EXCELLENT hotel really made our trip to Istanbul. It is right in the center of the old town (Sultanahmet). A 5 minute walk to Haigia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, and the tram for other sights. It is very comfortable, clean, well appointed and air conditioned . The breakfast at the terrace was more than ample with multiple offerings. And, best of all, the staff was friendly and helpful. We most highly recommend this delightful Turkish hotel in the heart of an exciting exotic city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: hprovenc
Reviews.Content: We got a discounted "Premium" room from Expedia. The people were extremely accomodating and helpful. They took our bags and led us through the beautiful patio garden in the middle of the hotel. There were people relaxing and having tea. Our room was tiny and the balcony looked at the back of another building - which was a bit of a disappointment. The bed was very comfortable and the furnishings gorgeous and made up for the tiny size of the room. I wouldn't call a room that size premium since you could just barely fit the Queen bed in it, but that's what you get for booking online! The bathroom was wonderful - spotless. We ate dinner on the terrace and our waiter was wonderful. The food was very good. We were easily able to get to the location from the airport by the tramway. The sites are literally at your doorstep! I would definitely recommend this place, but if you're looking for a "premium" room maybe double check with the staff when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Whith out thinking”
Reviews.Author: hbo1111
Reviews.Content: Wooow After beeing in Istanbul I found out tthat Hostory was started here. And the location of this hotel was right in the middle of it all. The hotel itself is history. I n the begening I wasn't sure about this place because in the internet every hotel looks good Thank God I have nothing but great time in this Hotel. Location great, service great, food great, rooms only in there to sllep and shower but great I sleep like a baby. The personelat the hotel were very friendy and also very helpfull I am looking forward to going back and staying litlle longer this time, because guys believe me if you are going to Turkey 10 days is defenitly nor enough. Have fun I sure did

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Spot - Absolute pleasure to stay”
Reviews.Author: crackersSydney
Reviews.Content: The website makes the Hotel look beautiful - It is absolutely spot on. From the moment you arrive you are treated with friendliness and efficiency. The position is terrific just behind the Sofia Palace in a quiet street and very close to the Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace and the tram lines. Rooms are comfortable and very well appointed and in a chaotic city like Istanbul, quiet. The decor and style of the hotel is elegant. The restaurant is in a lovely courtyard with excellent Turkish food - service is impeccable. Breakfast is in a pleasant position either in a sunfilled room or the courtyard ,but food is ordinary. The thing that struck us was the way every member of the staff was pleasant to deal with but maintained high levels of professionalism and efficiency. We would have no hesitation about recommending the Ottoman Imperial to friends and will stay there again when we are next in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, loved Elif!”
Reviews.Author: yaknak
Reviews.Content: I read the previous review. I did not have the same experience. We have never been to Istanbul before. We did not know what to expect. The hotel is in an excellent location, literally next to the Hagia Sophia. We had two rooms (3 people). The rooms were together behind a door, so two rooms (separate) behind yet another corridor door. Our rooms were quiet. My 2 boys were in one and I was in the other. Our rooms were tiny! If you have travelled in Paris much, the rooms are similar in size to the mid range price hotels there. This was not a shock, but to some it may be. My bed was great. I went into my boys room because they were complaining about their beds being hard and I sat down-YES, very hard indeed! The breakfast is very good. The transportation from the airport was free (we did book directly with hotel). The front desk was helpful, but the gem here is Elif. She is their concierge service. She spent so much time with us and gave us great advice on how to plan our day. She made reservations for us for dinner, and gave us directions to everything and also obtained taxis for us when we needed them. She is so very helpful, she is what made our stay there perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman Imperial Istanbul is an incredibly wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizLaneBoulder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial with our children, 13 and 11. It was the highlight of our two week trip to Greece and Turkey. The hotel is beautiful and clean, with gorgeous outdoor terraces to eat the abundant and delicious breakfast, read the paper or talk to other travelers. The rooms were immaculately clean and comfortable with wonderful views of the Sultanahmet neighborhood, even the Aya Sophia itself. The location was perfect to see many of Istanbul's must visit sites: Aya Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and Cistern are all literally within 3 blocks. The hotel is right on the Tram and only a several minute ride to the port or the Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. As if all this weren't enough, the staff of the Ottoman Hotel were superb--friendly and welcoming and knowledgeable. Elif Efe, Head of Guest Relations is competent and charming and went far above her job requirements to ensure that all guests' needs were met, including arranging medical care when our son became ill. Ozghur and Erhan also stand out as impeccable staff who were willing and able to help in any way. We felt wonderfully cared for and hated to leave such a fabulous hotel. Liz Lane Boulder, CO

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful ottoman”
Reviews.Author: CHALKY_8
Reviews.Content: New to Turkey we arrived apprehensive. The staff at the Ottoman Imperial couldn't have been more helpful - spoke good English - had a sound grasp of visitor's needs and, places to see. The hotel is so well positioned for the Old Town sights as well as local transport services. Food was excellent and reasonably priced - breakfast a joy! If you have a choice select the upstairs rooms, less stairs (the hotel is built on a descending slope). We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PeterSurrey
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, only 1 year old, fantastic location in Sultan Ahmet area, right next to St Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Bedrooms are to a good standard and although small are quite a good size for the central old town district. Food offering was OK but a little disappointing compared with the general standard of the hotel. Breakfast was OK during the week but the standard of cooked breakfast declined at the weekend and the scrambled egg was inedible. Would I go back? Yes I would, because considering the location, the price and the general standard of the hotel, the advantages outweighed the sloppy scrambled eggs at the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A Lot of Problems with the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BornTraveler
Reviews.Content: After staying at the hotel for a couple of days, I wanted to warn future travelers about this particular hotel. Please let me be clear that this hotel is not terrible. Its location is wonderful, being so close to some of the major sites, and it is reasonable for the price, and it is clean. But there are some major concerns. As one reviewer wrote, the mattresses are incredibly hard. I like a firm bed, however, I have never slept on a bed that was so hard. It is literally like sleeping on the floor. The greater concern is the same thing noted by the same reviewer. The walls are paper-thin and you can easily overhear the conversation from the adjoining rooms. If they are watching TV, you will easily be able to follow the programing. This noise is heightened if you are in a room that is in the back of the hotel. While the front of the hotel faces a quiet street, the back of the hotel faces a major street where one of the city trams runs. I was forced to use the fan continuously to drown out the street and neighbor's noises. The last concern or problem was the service. It was terrible. The desk people were not terribly helpful nor friendly. When I got to the hotel, they could not or would not give me change for any denomination, and when I asked for a city map, they did not have one to give me but they were willing to sell me one for the equivalent of $2. Additionally, trying to get them to serve me a drink on the patio was a problem. Despite the fact that I sat there for 15 minutes while the server went back and forth in the small patio I was sitting, directly in front of me, I was never served until I chased him down. The same thing occurred when I wanted another drink and when I wanted to pay the bill. This occurred the very next day with a different server. By the end of the second full day, I checked out and went to the Four Seasons Hotel, not far from the Ottoman Imperial. The service, recognizing the difference in the room rates, was impecible. One other warning. While my room was rather spacious in relation to other European hotels, a floor map of the rooms on that floor suggest that rooms are not similar in size or shape, and that you may have the misfortune of getting one of the smaller rooms. Finally, be aware that while free transportation is provided to and from the airport if you stay three (?) or more days, the service is available only if you book directly with them. If you book with any travel service, while the hotel will make arrangements to provide the transportation, you are obligated to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice for pre-cruise visit”
Reviews.Author: Beachtango
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in May prior to our Oceania cruise and were very happy with the choice. The location is perfect and we enjoyed being able to walk to many of the major tourist attractions. Our room was clean, attractively decorated, and had an amazing view of Hagia Sofia. Two complaints: the mattress was uncomfortably hard; and, from our small bathroom, we could clearly hear conversations in neighboring rooms. Hotel staff was warm and helpful. Bellman Erhan Attilo was very speedy and energetic when he helped us check out. In fact, he seemed more interested in being mentioned on TripAdvisor than he did in getting a tip! If we return to Istanbul, we would consider staying here again - especially if the mattresses have been replaced!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whit4406
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Imperial has a great location next to the Hagia Sofia on a quiet street. The staff was exceptionally helpful and courteous. They even arranged a spontaneous birthday celebration for my wife. The hotel features newly remodeled rooms, a lovely quiet garden for rest and reflection, and a roof top restaurant where daily breakfast is served. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gertanja
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the ottoman hotel imperial. The location is excellent, next to the Aya Sofia and from walking distance (only 1 Ã  3 minutes) from Topkapi, Blue Mosque and Yerebatan Cistern. The Grand Bazar, Spice market, Galatabridge are about 10-15 minutes away. The staff is very friendly and speak very good english. We had a free taxi transfer from Ataturk airport because we stayed 3 nights. The taxi driver wasn't there by arrival but after a phonecall to the hotel, he arrived 10 minutes later. We didn't mind that to much, we appreciated this service. For our transportation to the airport (departure) we had to pay 25 euro. I think this is also what we would had to pay if we had taken a taxi. Breakfast was included, but we also had our lunches and dinners in the hotel restaurant. As breakfast was standard, the food and presentation of both lunch and dinner were very good and it was a nice peaceful place to eat and not to expensive. If I had to mention 1 negative point : the bed of our room was so hard, almost like sleeping on the floor. I would recommend this hotel for its location, its staff and because it's a beautiful and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Professional service and good location”
Reviews.Author: robertvanduin
Reviews.Content: I know that itâ€™s hard to satisfy everyone as Iâ€™m also in travel business. We used Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 2 nights on a 21 day Turkey tour which we had booked through a tour operator. We were happy with all the hotels throughout the country, but Ottoman Hotel Imperial was definitely the best one amongst all. There are loads of things to say about this hotel, the rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is fantastic, the staff is friendly, the bathrooms are big, wireless internet works properly etc. Small details make the difference and Ottoman knows how to provide you with a perfect holiday. The hotel is surrounded by all the major historical sights including the magnificent Hagia Sophia Church and splendid Underground Cisterne. On our return from Turkey tour we have stayed overnight at another hotel in Sultanahmet, which had higher rack rates than Ottoman and non of our tour mates were happy with the second hotel, the rooms were much smaller (most of the historical hotels in the old town are small) and the services were much poorer.

Reviews.Title: “Early Booking Not Honored”
Reviews.Author: kwey
Reviews.Content: In July, 2007, we planned a cruise on Oceania through American Express. This cruise originated in Istanbul, Turkey. As we wanted to spend three days touring the city before departing on the cruise we booked three nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. These arrangements were made and paid for in August, 2007. A few weeks before our departure date of May 6th, our agent at American Express informed us that the Ottoman Hotel Imperial was not going to honor our long paid for reservations. No reason was given and at this late date it was very difficult to get comparable hotel reservations. This was a great disappointment to us and we did not enjoy our stay in Istanbul as much because of these last minute problems.

Reviews.Title: “was really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Afzan
Reviews.Content: I had no intention writting a review but when i read the latest review about the hotel ottoman they said that they had a free transfers to and from the airport on the day of arrival and departure,which made me really sad and angry because we went to istanbul 2 weeks ago and they never provided us with the service,infact we had to pay for our transport which isnt fair at all,on the day of our arrival there was no one to pick us up so i thought we had to get our own transport i had to pay 30 liras for a taxi,after a few days in istanbul we met some people from sheffield they told us that they hotel provides free transport to and from the airport upon this i thought to inquire from my hotel what was the matter the guy on the receptions i forgot his name he told me that they charge and its not free they LIED to me he said they will charge 50 liras if we want the hotel to drop us off to the airport,i was shocked and reaaly disappointed,

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Jappeg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderfull 5 days-stay at the Ottoman Imperial Hotel in Istanbul. Situated right opposite the Aya Sofya in a pittoresque and quiet street. Our room had all facilities you might expect. We enjoyed excellent food in the restaurant. All great sights of Istanbul were in a walking distance from the hotel. We visited them all! The hotel staff was very kind and competent. And especially we appreciated the free transfers to and from the airport on the day of arrival and departure. Istanbul traffic is an experience you will not forget easily. So we can recomment the Ottoman Hotel for sure and will visit it again on our next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms was too small”
Reviews.Author: shameen
Reviews.Content: well will cut it short went to turkey for a week had a nice time,the hotel was nice and really clean have to say but the rooms where really small,i would say not child friendly at all had problems cleaning my babies botteles and she had to sleep with us in bed because the traveling cot they gave had a really awful smell and had a huge plug type in the middle stiking upwards which was hiting her back she hated it and cried so she was in bed with us didnt had nice comfortable sleep.But the stuff was friendly and the hotel was spotless clean but not ideal for some one traveling with children or babies.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Celticcutz
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a week in Istanbul and as I found a Real Gem in the Ottoman Imperial Hotel......I felt I had no option but to share my discovery with you fellow travellers...... This intimate and charming Hotel,located on a quiet corner of a quaint cobblestoned street,yet overlooking the Hagia Sophia is ideally situated in the heart of old Istanbul......a stones throw from all the major sites........a perfect base from which to discover the sights,sounds and experiences this wonderful city has to offer!!!! The Hotel with it's beautiful terraced roof garden was impeccably clean,bright and very well run, - the extremely friendly staff,in particular all of the reception staff(namely,Atilla,Kemal,Ehran,Ozgur and the two girls whose names I can't spell...sorry girls)whose endless efforts to please with all their charm,smiles and warmth, added so much to my stay and helped in creating a real "Home Away from Home"......At times we laughed 'til we almost cried........ As Excellent as the Hotel is,No place is ever totally perfect and if I were put in a position of having to find any fault with The Ottoman Imperial, it would be the room I was initially given was extremely small....Having asked on booking with my Travel Agent for a Double Room,I was disappointed to arrive and find a very small single room allocated to me especially when staying for a full week......A little bit of space is nice!!!! However,on mentioning it to Atilla on reception......my request for a slightly bigger room wasn't denied and I duefully got shown and assigned a very nice double room the next morning.....So,all I can say on that is, Top Marks for Customer Service and Care!!!! Speaking of Customer Care....One last point,I have a very bad experience in being ripped off in a Restaurant on The Galata Bridge(not actually recommended by The Hotel)....Avoid these Tourist Traps like the Plague or else ask which one to use, - Too long a story to get into here, but in a nutshell,I got totally overcharged(for the most appalling food and something I didn't realise I was getting) without the Price Structure on The menu being explained to me beforehand.......I happened to mention it in passing to the chaps on reception when I got back to The Hotel and the following morning,much to my surprise, the Manager came to me and kindly offered to get on to the Restaurant to see if there was anything he could do etc,etc.....Again,Top Marks for an effort above and beyond the call of duty!!!!! All in All,I can but only highly recommend this Hidden Gem in The Heart of Istanbul!!! 110 out of 100.........I'll be back......... Cheers Guys, Eamon Donoghue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: andy951
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, light and well presented. Our room was cleaned perfectly. Staff in all areas, but particularly reception, were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were good with sufficient variety and constantly being topped up. The location between the Blue Mosque and Tokapi Museum and immediately opposite Haghia Sophia is ideal and it's a short tram ride or 15 minute walk downhill to the ferries on the Bosphorus. An exciting city and a great base from which to explore it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: c1sailor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the great pleasure of staying at the Ottoman Imperial in early April of this year. When we travel for pleasure, we prefer smaller botique hotels rather than large chains that cater mostly to business travelers. It has been our expereince that smaller hotels often provide a higher level of personalized customer service which was certainly the case with the Ottoman Imperial. The staff was efficient, very friendly and helpful in assisting us with restaurant recommendations. This was very important because it was the first of what we hope will be many visits to Istanbul. The hotel is ideally situated on a quaint street off the main road just across the street from the Aghia Sophia. It is within easy walking distance or a short tram ride to all of the major sites. Our room was immaculately clean and comfortable. It was very quiet. (Although I would advise ear plugs if you aren't used to the early morning call to prayer.) All in all we had a wonderful experience at the hotel and we would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: faisalhg
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. It's location was very convenient. It is adjacent to a perimeter wall of Hajia Sophia. I went with my wife and three year old daughter and the room was a decent size. It even had a little suite. The bathroom was modern and very clean. The service was excellent. The staff was attentive to our needs and very friendly towards us especially my daughter. I had six large bags and they took them up to the room without any issues and had a crib for my daughter setup as well. They had a full breakfast and a great menu. I opted for having them drive us to and from the airport. They charged around $25 Euro ($40). It was well worth it. Saved me the hassle of dealing with Taxi drivers and did I mention the six large bags. They fit in the mini van and also saved me the trouble of storing them in the expensive airport storage. So all in all a very good hotel, very conveniently located and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Istanbul's "old city"”
Reviews.Author: AJMWashington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our third trip to Istanbul this month (April-2008). This was the first time though that we stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial. The Ottoman was a wonderful discovery. The staff is exceptionally pleasant and helpful. The location is unbeatable. In the heart of Sultanahmet, you can literally throw a stone and hit Aya Sofya and are less than a five minute walk from Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque. The hotel offers a lovely buffet breakfast included in their price. The rooms are comparable to most European boutique hotel rooms and decorated very tastefully. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in one of the smaller, more charming hotels in the old city. We'll definitely stay here when we visit Istanbul again. We booked online through the hotel's website which also offers several pictures of the hotel's interior and exterior. AJM.- Washington

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisMH
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. We booked it after looking at the reviews on trip advisor and were not looking to pay lots to stay somewhere in Istanbul. The location is excellent if you want to be near the big historical sites, being next to the Hagia Sophia and 10 minutes from the Topkapi Palace. Service was excellent and anything was dealt with very quickly. The rooms are of a good quality, and for the price we could not complain one bit. As we were staying more than 3 nights we got a complimentary pick up from the airport which was a nice touch. The only small downside was that the breakfast got a bit tiring after 4 nights there as it was exactly the same there every day. We ate in the hotel restaurant on the first night and that was OK, but there are many better places in the area, as I suppose is usually the case. I would recommend this hotel if you want a good quality hotel with excellent service which is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiburonTony
Reviews.Content: A better than average mid-range hotel in the center of the historical Sultanahmet area. Very convenient for seeing the major mosques, churches and palaces. The hotel feels mid-sized and the lobby is a little old fashioned. However, the staff are excellent: friendly, accommodating and providing excellent dinner recommendations. We were in a "standard" room in the annexe of the hotel proper, we didn't feel cut off from the main building. Prospective guests who are unable to easily navigate stairs may want to confirm that they are in the main wing as I don't think the annexe has an elevator. The room was large by European standards and clean. The bed while comfortable was the hardest I have ever slept in. The bathroom was adequate with a toilet, sink and half tub with shower which like many European showers leaked after use. The free WiFi worked well throughout the hotel, except for the dining room, but did work on the patio which provided an excellent spot for afternoon drinks. Breakfast was included and was a buffet affair, I didn't find it very interesting but that could just be my food preferences. We did eat dinner in the hotel one evening and while not an adventurous menu it was quite tasty and not too expensive. It is close to a tram stop on the main tram line in the city and from it one can get to the waterfront, spice market and over to Taksim Square, although it is a total of 45 to 60 minutes depending on connections via tram, funicular and tram again (all to be paid for separately). Taksim square is the area for night life; restaurants, bars, coffee houses. The hotel area is not (in my opinion) a great place to eat. We arranged a car from the airport through the hotel and were very pleased to see the driver waiting for us at close to 2am. There are a number of disadvantages with the hotel. While the room was quite large there was a paucity of storage space; one wardrobe, two small bedside tables and a tiny desk. The bathroom was equally short of storage space, one small shelf inadequate to hold toiletries for two people. The room was warm and while there appeared to be an air-conditioning unit on the wall we didn't use it (in fact I couldn't figure out how to turn it on), preferring to open the window which presented its own problems. Our room faced onto the major street which carried continuous traffic until late at night and which started again early in the morning. The bedroom walls were thin, we could plainly hear the television from the next room late at night. While they had an in-room safe it was too small to hold a small laptop. Overall a very good mid-range tourist hotel, definitely better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eprVancouver
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The lcoation is perfect, across the street with a view of the St. Sophia. The staff is polite and helpful. They booked a driver to meet us at the airport, which made things a lot easier. Four years ago I stayed at the Four Seasons in Istanbul, Although it is also nice, it cost ten times that of the Ottoman, did not include breakfast and was not any better located. The breakfast was delicious, a mixture of Turkish treats as well as the standard scrambled eggs, sausages and a variety of cereal. One complaint, as nothing is perfect. We stayed on the ground floor direclty across from the reception. It did get a little noisy at night, as well as smoke drifted underneath the door. I would recommend staying on a different floor. I will definately stay there again if in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Such a Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelling2004
Reviews.Content: We're just back from Istanbul, and this hotel is really lovely! The location is perfect. It's 5 (five) metres away from Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque is just 300 metres away, the Cistern Basilica is around the corner.We were on a room on the second floor, with a view on Hagia Sophia. My wife was delighted.The hotel staff spoke a perfect english, and they were very helpful. They booked us a taxi on arrival, so that we had no problem in getting to the hotel. The breakfast was excellent and the room was perfectly cleaned and spacious.I travel a lot for my job, and I'm quite picky when it comes to hotel services. Well, this hotel is really excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mols_nyc
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a five-day stay at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial and could not have been happier with our choice. The hotel staff was friendly, the rooms were very clean and comfortable, and the location cannot be beat as it is within walking distance of almost every major sight in the city. We took advantage of the free airport transfer from Ataturk and were grateful not to have to arrange transportation after arriving on a long flight. The staff was incredibly attentive, spoke English, and directed us to many of the area's best sights and restaurants. They also were very responsive to e-mails sent before our stay with regard to preferences, transport, etc. The complimentary breakfast was also good and never too crowded. Our only complaint is that the mattresses in the rooms were stiff and a bit uncomfortable. Otherwise, this hotel is near-perfect! We'll definitely be recommending this hotel to anyone traveling to Istanbul and we would gladly return on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheherezade
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel in the European style, with a perfect location directly behind Hagia Sophia. The room was small but very comfortable, pleasantly furnished and in good taste, impeccably clean. The management could not have been nicer, and went out of their way to help me arrange a change of hotel when I was obliged to prolong my stay. Fluffy bathrobes and Turkish delight included in the very reasonable rate!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: adventureBrighton
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial and had a fabulous time, the hotel is superbly located straight opposite the Hagia Sofia museum and just 2 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. The rooms are very comfortable, clean with nice decor. The hotel staff are exceptional nothing is too much trpuble and they know all the best places eat and spots to see the real Istanbul. Trully loved it, I'll be back and staying at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Ottoman”
Reviews.Author: JoeBlogsMidSussex
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful, pleasant room well looked after and prepared, with good view of Aga Sofia, in fact hotel situated in quiet street along side the Aga Sofia, most of the major sights within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: duvetdrops
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the good reviews on this site. The hotel is great for location, and the staff are very polite and nice. It was very cold when we stayed, but the hotel was very well heated. We had booked a double room, but to be honest, I would have found it difficult staying in the double room even on my own with my suitcase, as it was VERY compact, and the bathrooms would have bee useless for anyone over a certain age, as one had to practically step up 2 ft to get into the shower. I asked for a larger room on the secod day, as I found it claustrophic, and would have moved to a different hotel if they could not have accomadated me, and they very kindly upgraded us to a triple room for no extra charge. I did enjoy my stay in this hotel, but would not stay there again purely for the size of the rooms and location. It is good for sightseeing the old city of Istanbul, but it is very quiet at night, and Taksim has a better night life.

Reviews.Title: “People Make this Hotel Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ApurvaNY
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews of this and other hotels in the Sultanahmet area we decided to go with Ottoman Imperial. The short: The Hotel is EXTREMELY CLEAN and WELL KEPT. staff is VERY FRIENDLY AND READY TO HELP and it's LOCATION cannot be matched. Right from the start the Airport pick-up was seamless, great driver and well-maintained car. On our arrival we were given option of two rooms, and the next morning, when it became available we were upgraded to a superior room for no extra charge! The Hotel is very well kept and has all amenities. It is located 20-30 seconds walk from the main enterance of Hagia Sophia and is great for travellers looking to focus on teh historical sights. We were alos looking for an active night life scene and I would recommend all those travellers who would also like to enjoy Istanbul's night life to stay in the Taksim area as Sultanahmet sleeps early...very early. Breakfast is good and as everyone else has already said before the rooms and bathrooms are smallish. All in all if yo udo not plan to be outside after 9.00pm, you will be glad you stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ottoman Hotel, two nights before a cruise. The location is remarkable. You are steps away from every important site in Istanbul. The hotel is a charming boutique property. I would defiantely, pay more for rooms facing the Hagia Sophia. We stayed on a corner room, it was small but nicely furnished. US travelers have to get over the fact that European boutique rooms are not spacious. It was a great value for the 89 euros that I paid. The staff was crisp and professional. I had arranged for a car to pick me up and the driver showed up 10 mintues after I cleared the arrival hall. I let that pass, since traffic in Instanbul can be treacherous. I would recommend that the management expand the menu at breakfast. It was simple with a minimal presentation. The water pressure in the small shower was great. There is not a gym facility, but there is a park around the corner, that one can run or jog. The bed was on the firm side. The rooms have thin walls so if you cannot take any noise this may not be the hotel for you, otherwise it was not intolerable. I room was next to the elevator and I did not have any problems. There is an excellent selection of coffee and teas in the rooms. Istanbul can be ovewhelming from the number of people trying to hawk and force a sale from carpets to post cards, so it is nice to return to a pleasuable hotel every night. I would recommend the hotel for the price that I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Frendt1
Reviews.Content: The Ottoman Hotel Imperial was a wonderful find! It was located in the middle of everything and only a block from the tram that could quickly take you to the other side of the Golden Horn. We walked everywhere from here and found everyone to be friendly and helpful. The staff at the hotel was great. They went out of their way to help us in many ways. They kept our luggage while we took a sidetrip to Cappodocia, and arranged transportation to and from the airport that was always there at the correct time. They helped us with directions and where to find anything we needed. No matter what we asked, they found an answer. I cannot say enough good things about the staff. The rooms were somewhat small, but cozy and clean. They had everything we needed and a nice mini bar. The breakfast had many selections on the buffet table and the dinner we ate here was very good. We were in room 406, which was a corner room with windows on two walls, which made it bright and cheerful. This was a wonderful place to stay at an affordable price. It had the feel of a Turkish hotel rather than a big super chain hotel. I would look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworld51
Reviews.Content: I know that it is not easy to satisfy everyone because Iâ€™m also in travel business. I used Ottoman Hotel Imperial for 4 nights on a 15 day tour of Turkey. I was very happy with the standards of all the hotels used throughout my stay in Turkey, but Ottoman Hotel Imperial was the best amongst all. There are many affirmative things to say about Ottoman, the breakfast is very good with large variety of Turkish and International food, the rooms are comfortable, the whole staff is very friendly and helpful, the bathrooms are large, wireless internet works properly etc. I believe that small details make the difference at the hotels and Ottoman knows how to provide you with a perfect holiday. The hotel is surrounded by all the major historical sights including the magnificent Hagia Sophia Cathedral and splendid Underground Cisterne along with Topkapi Palace and Blue Mosque are very close, within 2 minutes walking. I highly recomend Ottoman Hotel Imperial.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in Ottoman Hotel Imperial”
Reviews.Author: stamatis_7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel comfortably using their airport transfer service. An unbelievable hotel, the service and staff were outstanding! The hotel is impeccable and very clean. Beautiful interior and clean. Beautiful interior and a view of Aya Sofia from our room was unbelievable. Location couldn't be better. All major sites are in walking distance, yet on a quite street. Staff were always smilling and no request was denied. The bed was very comfortable and there are extra pillows in the wardrobe. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: pkcasa
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Ottoman Hotel Imperial recently and the experience was perfect. It is a small, historic hotel located in middle of Sultanahmet, within walking distance or convenient (and tourist friendly) tram or funicular ride to all major tourist attractions. We never saw need to use a taxi or have a rental car at any time during our trip. We booked the room for between 94 and 109 Euros/night which was very reasonable, especially considering the continual rising of prices in Istanbul. We heard about the hotel through the Rick Steves' book which afforded us an additional 5% off. If you pay with hard currency you receive a 10% discount. The hotel offered a complimentary airport pickup which was a great start to our arrival. The hotel is a new renovation of a historic building. Rooms are beautifully decorated in warm, rich tones, dark hardwoods and with local accents. Our room was on the smaller side and had several lovely touches such as complimentary bathrobes and slippers and while the bathroom was near the entry, the bedroom was several steps down a winding small staircase. Quite charming! Breakfast was high quality and included in the price, offering a selection of breads, cheeses, meats, cereals, olives, vegetables, jams, coffees and juices as well as a complimentary English language newspaper at each table. It was cool in Istanbul when we stayed, but there appeared to be a lovely garden and terrace to relax and dine in when the weather was warm as well. A laptop is available at no cost from the front desk if you wish to access the Internet. All this was wonderful enough but the professional, attentive, patient, delightful staff was truly what separated this hotel from all others. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. In my case, the airlines lost my suitcase with all my clothes and the staff did everything from making multiple phone calls to the airlines daily (including the manager who contacted several personal contacts of his own, getting back to us on his progress from early in the morning to late in the evening) to recommending locations to shop in from inexpensive, outside markets to high end shopping centers. I cannot say enough about the staff. This hotel was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Istanbul hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2fab4you
Reviews.Content: A perfect location, friendly and very helpful people and a great manager doing a fantastic job with his team. If you're looking for a hotel in Istanbul, do not think twice about booking the Ottoman Imperial right away.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the ground floor”
Reviews.Author: Dave362
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights but unfortunately located on ground floor near to restaurant. Decent room, good facilities but woken 1st night at 4.30 a.m. by smell of breakfast cooking and 2nd night same time when staff prepared tables. Hotel full so could not change rooms. Excellent location would stay again, other guests were very complimentary

Reviews.Title: “Location, above all”
Reviews.Author: PedrodeBraga
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at this Hotel in October 2007. If you are looking for location, than this is the place for you. It is located accross the street from Hagia Sophia, 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and 2 minutes walk from a Tram Station. You basically cover all the major atractions of Sultanahmet from this hotel. Although it's a 4 star hotel, in reality (western european standards) it is not. I would place it at 3 stars. I stayed in two rooms and they are very small, so small that i had difficulties in getting in my side of the bed (double bed) as it was so close to the wall. The bathroom is a tiny little thing, unconfortable in getting two persons in there. If you want a room with a view, be sure to get a room facing Hagia Sophia. On the other side of the hotel (where I stayed) either you get a view of the street (higher floors) but not interesting and noisy because of the tram line or no view at all but quiet (lower floors). Breakfast is ok, no problems there. The staff is very friendly and helpful and gave me excelent recommendations regarding restaurants. For a 3 star hotel (see above) it is somewhat expensive (150 euros/double room) but...ther's the excellent location of course, and you have to pay for it. Overall I was satisfied, mainly because of it's superb location, although the hotel in itself does not deserve a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Minou-Annie
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel would be difficult to beat - literally overlooking the Hagia Sofia and 2 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque or the Topkapi Palace. We booked direct (nice easy website and good responses from the hotel) and deliberately choose one of the better rooms with a view of the Hagia Sofia. It was lovely and quiet, only a cobbled lane between the hotel and the church so no traffic noise. And the view was incredible! You might not be so lucky on the other side of the building with regards to traffic etc. The room was a reasonable size with a small sitting area and a small bathroom. Istanbul doesn't seem to go in for huge rooms - all the old houses are really quite small, so i suspect our room was generous by local standards. The furnishings were in good condidtion and everything was very clean. The staff were pleasant, the airport meet and greet worked, the rates were very reasonable for a city centre hotel, so all in all we'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in the very heart of old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very overrated”
Reviews.Author: reneebird
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this hotel gets so many five stars. I can only imagine that satisfied guests were in the main part of the hotel, if you are in the annex across the courtyard, you will not enjoy your stay. Our first room (609) overlooked a busy road with a tramline on it and as the double glazing didn't shut properly it was very noisy. Still at least it partially drowned out the noises from our neighbours. The walls here are paper thin. We moved rooms across the hallway to a quieter room (606) with a view of a wall, hardly any natural daylight and which was too small to have both cases open at the same time. It was also underneath a marble passageway, so cases on wheels and high-heeled shoes made themselves known. The breakfast was also poor, with no hot water available for fresh tea and coffee provided by a vending machine which meant queues built up (not helped by the tiny size of the cups). No fresh fruit and the juices were more like cordials. Much is made of this hotel's location opposite Aya Sofia. There are countless others with the same location, but if i were to return to Istanbul I wouldn't choose this part of Sultanamet again. I think the area between Aya Sofia and the Bosphoros (ie right on the promontory) is much nicer - smaller hotels and loads of restaurants and just slightly removed from coach party hell.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: flippywebsurfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days at this hotel, booked a superior room initially on Expedia. The afternoon we checked in, they put us in a very noisy room, you could hear the tramway and the cars outside. The double pane windows did not help at all so I requested a room change the next day, it turned out to be worse because it felt like you were in a box with a view of the wall. Again, I complained because the wifi access doesn't even work. Finally, I guess they got fed up because the third time, we were in a room with a view of the Blue Mosque, definitely a 100% improvement from the first two. The staff will definitely accommodate if there's availability so make sure you state your requests when you book. Remember, this is a boutique hotel, you can't compare the amenities with the big chains. For the price that you have to pay, there is definitely good value here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but.....”
Reviews.Author: oldvicar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late September, ok the room was a little small but everything was clean and the facilities good. You could even make a cup of tea in your room which for us Brits is a bonus. The location is absolutely fantastic couldn't really be better and contributed to a fantastic time in the city. We did leave with a bit of a sour taste as the promised 10% reduction for cash at check-in disappeared on check-out. It wasn't much, but at the time was somewhat annoying. In saying that I'll bite my lip and say that it has to be recommended for the fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in the middle of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: garbo
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of the positive reviews from this site. My husband, myself and one year old son booked a premium sultan room for three nights ( you get a free one way airport transfer if you do this). The hotel is a beautiful yellow building. Well restored on a quiet cobblestone street across from Haghia Sofia and down the street from the entrance to the Topkapi museum. When we checked in, (not sure of his name), but the reception staff was a little hostile to us as they discussed that if you pay cash you get a discount. If you have a Rick Steves Istanbul book you get a 5% discount plus a free airport transfer by the way. Originally, they just wanted to give us a 6% discount and i had to go through all my printed emails to show the man that we were suposed to get the extra 5% due to the book. Some other guest got 10% right away, so i guess this is negotiable. After this was settled everything was fine. They prefer you pay in euros or US dollars, not turkish lira. You can get either currency at ATMS. They don't explain to you in the emails, that they charge a 6% ( i think) fee for using credit cards, which seemed way too much. We got in early, so they gave us a standard room for a few hours until ours was available. very small on ground floor. Our premium sultan room had an amazing view of Haghia Sofia. I think the room was 201. Room was much smaller than expected. We had a tiny sitting room to the side with two chairs, which was pretty useless expect to store luggage. The bathroom is very small. The shower tub is too small. It's a bath/shower combo, but half the size. If this makes sense. It's more like a large foot bath, half of it is the bath/shower and then a seat of some kind. Getting out of it is very tricky, especially with a wet baby. Everything is clean and the bed is very comfortable. We had no problem with hearing other guests, but we only had guests on one side. The baby cot is quite good and appropriate for older babies. The baby cot looks like a graco pack and play. But it really makes the room small, since you have little free space. There is a lift in the buildng. They have internet access in the hotel, but if you don't have a computer they have a few laptops which you can check out and use in the hotel. A great idea. We used this a few times. The highlight of the hotel for me was the terrace. I loved having breakfast out there in the morning. You have a view of one minaret (which they light up at night), some houses and buildings. You can hear the boat's horns on the river/bospherous. If you go by the lounge area of the terrace, you can see one of the minarets of Haghia Sofia. For breakfast, they had a decent spread of breads, turkish cheese, some meats, scrambled eggs, semi cooked tomatoes, yoghurt, but the highlight to me was the homemade jams. Wonderful! At night, the food is so so, but it has a nice atmosphere. The night we had dinner, they had a musician and a whirling dervish performing. The manager of the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: jw71
Reviews.Content: We had booked two, superior rooms through the hotel web site. One room was a double for my wife and me and the other was a single for my elderly mother. As part of the package, the hotel picked us up at the airport which was very convenient. The double room was nice and comfortable, but not very large. The singel room was very small, especially the bathroom. For the small difference in cost, I would have booked a double room for my mother had I known the small size of a single. As others have said, the location is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, atmosphere, staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: skopelitis
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Turkey/istanbul. We had sent inquiring e-mails to a number of hotels located in the ancient part of the town. The main reason we decided on the Ottoman Imperial versus the others was the promptness, clarity and re-assurance of their responses to our questions. Little did we know that this hotel has also the most remarkable location!! A narrow side street separates it from Aghia Sofia, the entrance to the TopKapi palace is a hundred yards away and the Blue Mosque, the Hippodrome and the Museum of Turkish and islamic Arts (great antique carpet collection!!!) is only a little further down. In the five days we stayed there, we took taxi only once (to go the old Byzantine church of Aghia Irene which has the best mosaics east of Ravenna, italy). We walked to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market, Istanbul University and Suleiman the Magnificent Mosque. For trips to the modern part of the city (Taxim Square) or the harbor to take the inexpensive public ferry to where the Black Sea meets Bosphorus, we boarded the clean, safe and frequent trams from a nearby stop (tram fare was about $1.3). We were also fortunate to be there at the time of Ramadan, a major Muslim holiday, since the square close to the hotel is designated by the city for the nightly celebratory feasts by working class Turks (who had been strictly fasting all day). Getting back to the hotel, it is a renovated old building decorated in a beautiful,elegant and understated manner with Ottoman art. Our room was beautiful, clean, with all the comforts Americans are used to from the big hotel chains. What however made this hotel so special aside from its location was their remarkable staff, especially the front desk people. We are frequent and fussy travelers but we have never met more helpful and delightful hotel professionals as Yasar Celen, the front desk manager, and his assistant, Gonul Akkaya. Their genuine interest in their guests and ability to promptly provide satisfactactory solutions was amazing. As an example, the day of our departure, the taxi we had ordered to take us to the airport seemed to be delayed because of a traffic jam; Mr Celen noticed our anxiety of missing the plane and immediately drove us to the airport in his car with lots of time to spare!! We left Istanbul with wonderful experiences of the city and its people; this hotel and its staff made our trip even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Whinbrook
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from spending 4 nights at this hotel. We were a party of six in three rooms, two Premium rooms and one Junior Suite. We studied Trip Advisor frequently prior to our trip and expected to be in for a real treat based on the all glowing reviews we read day after day. It was disappointing all told. The location of the hotel is unbeatable. This was our first visit to Istanbul and it was thrilling to stay right in the historical centre, none of the essential sights was more than a 10 minute walk, while the Hagya Sofia was adjacent. Despite being in the thick of things the hotel is in a quite location on quaint cobbled street. There are plenty of good restaurants close by, the better ones being down the less busy streets. The staff were helpful and friendly and always on hand if required. We used the comlimentary airport pick up which worked a treat. The public areas are small but the delighful outdoor terrace with a linden tree for shade, makes up for this. The weather was warm and sunny, so we used the comfortable well furnished terrace frequently, especially to have breakfast on. If the weather had been inclement, then the public areas would have been crampt and uncomfortable. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant on our first evening and we all enjoyed everything, with good service as well. Breakfasts were only adequate though, perhaps a little too biased towards local tastes. The fly in the ointment though were the bedrooms and bathrooms. The two premium rooms were quite pleasant, fairly spacious and airey but the Junior Suite was cramped and claustrophopic despite tall ceilings. We asked to be moved and were disappointed to be told we could not change. We did hear several people asking to change rooms during our stay. If they were accommodated we do not know. The dark wood furniture and trim does not help, making the space more opressive. The lighting as very poor too in all the rooms which did nothing to alleviate the gloomy atmosphere. The beds were very hard and unforgiving in all our rooms and a good nights sleep was difficult. The pillows were poor too which added to the misery. The so called sitting area in each bedroom was a tiny space off each room, part of the original layout no doubt. It was practically useless except for storing the suitcases (no where else to put them). With a little thought and redesign, these rooms could so much more comfortable. The bathroom was tiny too. The hip bath is a bad choice - its too small to use as a bath and the moulded seat makes it useless as a shower unless you are a contortionist. The tub is set too high off the bathroom floor and the shower screen slides the wrong side against the wash hand basin so entering and exiting the bath/shower is not only very awkward but quite dangerous, especially as the shower screen is totally inadequate in containing the shower spray, so the floor is flooded after a shower. There is no storage space in the bathroom either for toilet bags, make up etc . The towels are very thin too. You must bring a plug for the sink if you intend to use it as none was provided - an important oversight I think! And this claims to be a 4 star hotel? The rooms have minibars and a complimentary tea and coffee tray. However, although the rooms were adequatley cleaned, the replenishing of the tea tray varied between none existant to over zealous. We had over 10 creamers, no tea, one coffee, no sugar and one sweetner during our stay. What is the point of having this extra if it is not correctly provided? I'm sure the front desk would have rectified it immediately (they brough extra hangers immediately) but it should be automatically done without having to ask. The Junior Suite's a/c worked fine but the other two rooms machines worked irratically. We sound like picky miserable complainers don't we! But this is how it was during our stay. We still greatly enjoyed our visit to Istanbul and will return, its an amazing city. We did have a splurge meal at the Four Seasons hotel not far from here and chose to have the Ottoman Buffet as part of the Ramadan Festival. It was superb. The hotel looked beautiful too and be all admitted that we would have liked to have stayed there - cost be damned!

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel in the Crown”
Reviews.Author: GUINNESSVancouver
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a cruise Istanbul to Athens with hotels each end. In Istanbul which was our faivourite venue, we stayed 3 nights at the Ottoman Imperial. Just a read through the reviews on this hotel tells the story, it has all been said before. Our stay at this hotel was instrumental in making Istanbul the highlight of our trip. I must reafirm the advice to book Taxies through the hotel desk, Attila or Gonul will be glad to help and be waiting with a smile on your return. We had an additional day in Istanbul from the cruise ship and our taxi experience was not so smooth, they tried to charge double the metre reading and in euros. We stuck to our guns but ended up walking back to the ship rather than go through the hastle. Our thanks to Mr Balta and his wonderful staff, especialy Attila & Isa. Chris & Carol Trafford Vancouver, B.C, CANADA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jv8a
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning and the end of a 3 week trip to Turkey. We arrived at the end of August and got a room on the first floor across from the front desk. It was a little noisy and small, but since it was Formula One week, we were lucky to get it. Clean and comfortable. The hotel is pretty centrally located in the Sultanahmet district, within walking distance of all the major sites: Hagia Sophia (across the street), Blue Mosque, underground cisterns, museums, Tokapi Palace, covered bazaar, Hippodrome and Egyptian spice market (which we liked much more than the bazaar). A bit more expensive than other hotels, but heck, you get more for your money than you would for the same price room in New York. Staff was great. Had our room ready for us when we first arrived on the red eye. When we returned at the end of our trip, early again, they bought us a drink and we enjoyed the cool terrace while we waited about 15 minutes for them to prepare our room. We stayed in a suite on the second floor this time. Spacious, comfortable, with a view of the Hagia Sophia. Attilla Kalender on the front desk was especially helpful. Can't beat the location. A comfortable friendly place to stay.
